loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Irenea has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Irenea has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Irenea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a very active and nice lady. She takes care of her home by doing her household responsibilities. In addition, she works as a seamstress and embroidery expert. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. She started doing this work to support her husband financially. Now she has become renown among her community clients for her good skills and work. The income she earns helps to pay off the utilities and to manage the other household expenses.
  
Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transport services to his passengers. Safia is the mother of four sons and a daughter. Only her two younger children are able to attend school and get their education. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business, the second son is a laborer and the third one is a building contractor. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery frames and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to be able to make better quality embroidered clothes and increase her income. She has been operating her business for the past eight years and is very confident that the investment will be a profitable one for her business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy embroidery frames and embroidery materials

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Warlita has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Warlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Warlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is now 57 years old and married with six adult children. He earns about 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Benjamin grows rice and he has been doing it for almost 35 years. Benjamin is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used in purchasing the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Benjamin hopes to have a plentiful harvest to earn a higher income to acquire their daily basic needs and to save for their future. He is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance for him to improve their source of living.

loans.use: to purchase the needed agricultural inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: Brgy. Parai, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married. She lives in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Virginia sells fresh fish and "tinabal". Tinabal is salted fish, which is packed in salt in a plastic container for days to age. She requested a loan to buy fishing hooks and nets. This will help her husband catch more fish for Virginia to sell.

In the future, Virginia hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Luzviminda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from sugarcane farming.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Shyriel

texts.en:
Shyriel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Shyriel has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs and electronic re-loading (selling cellphone time).

Shyriel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 

Ralph is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities for the service.

Ralph has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ralph hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the utilities

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. He earns about PHP 7,500 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Walter grows rice and has been doing this for almost 18 years. Walter is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used to purchase the needed agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Walter hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have a higher income to finance the education of their children and to satisfy their daily basic needs. He believes that through patience and hard work he can improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Jonah Sharon

texts.en:
Jonah Sharon, 25, is married but doesn't have children yet. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Jonah Sharon grows rice and has been doing it for almost three years. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase necessary supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the services rendered by helpers in planting rice.

In the future, Jonah Sharon hopes to yield a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income for the sake of her family's future and for their daily basic needs. She hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously support them in the business so she can be able to start a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the services of helpers.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s Punjabi food restaurant business. He operates his restaurant in the market. He sells Punjabi food items called Nan chanay & Biryani at reasonable rates. He is very good in his dealings and has a good number of clients. 

With the loan, he will buy the required ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, rice etc to be able to cook good food and in a bigger quantity to offer to his clients. 

Farzana is a housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities.

Her husband has been operating his business for the past 12 years and has a good name in his area for his good quality services. Farzana is confident that an investment will help him attract new clients and retain his current customers by providing better quality food to them.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a Punjabi food restaurant business

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth, 38, runs a cake business. She is married to Paulus, a 49 year old fisherman. Their marriage has been blessed with six children. They are: 
- Amelia, 21, who is married and lives with her husband 
- Rosmiati,15, in third grade of junior high school 
- Ariel, 10, in sixth grade of elementary school 
- Stevani, 8, in third grade of elementary school 
- Olan, 6, in first grade of elementary school
- Mona, 2, who is not yet at school

Elisabeth has been running her cake business for one year to support her husband in generating income for their family. Elisabeth recognized that she needs more money to support her family. Paulus has an idea for Elisabeth to create a net for fishing to sell, as Elisabeth has the skills to do it. The idea came about when a friend of Paulus had a problem with his net and he couldn’t afford to buy a new one. Paulus and Elisabeth plan to sell the net created by Elisabeth at an affordable price for the fishermen around them.

To implement the plan, Elisabeth needs money. She is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 IDR from TLM. She plans to spend the loan on rope, string, balancing floats and other supplies to make the net. Elisabeth hopes that her loan application will be approved.

loans.use: to buy rope, string, balancing floats, and other equipment to make a fishing net.

loans.name: Antoneta

texts.en:
Antoneta, 39, runs a kiosk business. She has three children from her marriage with Ingman, 46. The children are: 
- Marlon, 19, who just completed senior high school 
- Erwin, 18, in third grade of senior high school 
- Ferdinand, 8, in second grade of elementary school

Antoneta has been running her kiosk business for two years. The business was initiated based on her will to generate more income for her family, in addition to her husband's income. In the beginning of her business, she only used a small table to dispL. her stocks. The business grows slowly as she only has a limited stock.

Antoneta plans to add more stock to her kiosk and to expand it. She really wants to improve her business in order to generate more income, as she realizes that her children will need a lot of money for their future education, especially Marlon, to fund his university studies. Antoneta is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 IDR from TLM. She plans to buy a shelf on which to place her stock and to purchase additional stock, i.e. soap, cooking oil, flour, sugar and medicine for her kiosk.

loans.use: to buy a shelf and additional stock for her kiosk, i.e. soap, cooking oil, flour, sugar, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is 46 years of age and married with five children: four sons and a daughter. Only two of the children were able to study until 5th due to financial constraints. Her eldest son operates a juice corner in the market. Her second son is married and sells fruit salad. Her third son sells popcorns like his father and her fourth son works as an employee in a grocery store. 

Her husband sells popcorns on a cart. Every morning he puts the popcorn-making machine on his cart and visits different streets in the city. He sells his popcorn by announcing in loud voice. Children like popcorn and he makes a reasonable amount of income every day from the sales
. 
Shamshad is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to repair his popcorn machine and buy corn in a larger quantity, which will help him make more sales and earn better profits. 

He has been operating his business for the past seven years and Shamshad is very hopeful about the growth of his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To repair a popcorn-making machine and buy corn

loans.name: Shayne Mae

texts.en:
Shayne Mae is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital for her clothing sales business.
Shayne Mae has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from her food-vending business. Shayne Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Darwen

texts.en:
Darwen, 23, is single and lives in the Philippines. He has a shop that sells printed t-shirts and blouses, a business he has had for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses.

Darwen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Darwen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en: Beberly, 38, is married with four children, aged 8 to 21. She is a farmer and helps her husband till their rice farm. Beberly has been engaged in farming for 21 years. She also provides tailoring services to her community. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. Beberly hopes for this loan to help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 39, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram, a business she has had for two years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rean

texts.en:
Rean, 25, is single with one child and lives in the Philippines. She has a vulcanizing shop that provides repair and air pressurizing services. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 5,000  PHP to buy materials needed for her shop.

Rean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 50 years old and is a married woman with 10 children. The oldest child is 32 years old while the youngest is only 6. Her older children are already married and do not live with them anymore.

Daisy is a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. According to Daisy, she has been engaged in rice farming for 35 years.

Daisy has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes for their business to prosper. She also hopes to send her younger children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more new mobile phones and prepaid telephone cards

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Marites has a retail shop that sells tablea or home made chocolate bars. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars.
Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home made chocolate bars

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jeralyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Jeralyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeralyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Aida has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Aida has been in this business for three years now and also earns additional income from her fish-vending business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional tools

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Randy has a shop that sells souvenir items. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making souvenirs.
Randy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Randy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making souvenirs

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 35 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional items for her store and ingredients for her food production business.
Analy has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns an income from her food-vending and computer games businesses.
Analy aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stocks of clothes and cosmetics to sell to her customers.
Laura has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from her furniture-making business. Laura has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Elvina has a retail shop that sells canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergents, beverages & snacks.
Elvina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра проживает в районе Исфара. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж находится в России. Сама Гулчера занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает женскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже три года. Она берет кредит для покупки школьной формы и женской одежды. Гулчехра хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Gulchehra lives in the Isfara region. She is 27 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband is now in Russia. Gulchehra does retail on the central market in the region. She has own store where she sells women's clothing. She has been in this business for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy school uniform and women's clothing. Gulchehra wants to increase variety of her merchandise to attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy school uniform and women's clothing

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 38 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
Almira has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase blouses, pants, slippers, body lotion etc. to sell to customers. Almira has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, slippers, body lotion etc. to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edielito

texts.en:
Edielito is 47 years old and is married with 6 school-aged children. He earns about PHP 5,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Edielito grows rice farming and has been doing it for almost 30 years. Edielito is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Edielito hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn income to support the needs of his family, especially the education of their children and for their daily basic needs. He believes that through patience and hard work, he can able to improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Josephine has a furniture shop that sells dining table & wooden closets. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for making furniture.
Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making furniture

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 60-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a baker for over 42 years. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. With his requested loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will renew his bakery’s oven so that he can proceed with his business operation properly. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood. In the future, he is planning to further develop his business.

loans.use: to renew his bakery’s oven

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jovelyn has a junk shop that sells recycled bottles & plastic containers. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional recycled bottles and plastics.
Jovelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional recycled bottles and plastic containers

loans.name: Jesites

texts.en:
Jesites is 34 years old and is married with two school-aged children. She earns about PHP 7,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Jesites grows rice and has been doing this for almost 8 years. Jesites is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Jesites hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to finance the education of her children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offers a financial assistance to strengthen their source of income. She believes that having patience and strong determination will lead her to reach her business goals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has been working as a freelance sweet and candies distributor since 2007. He sells his products to multiple mini-markets located in different areas and villages. With his business income, he is able to help his family pay the high costs of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional sweets and candies in order to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is willing to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional sweets and candies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase vegetables and an assortment of cereals for sale

loans.name: Menorida

texts.en:
Menorida is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Menorida has a fish shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional fish to sell.

Menorida is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Menorida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 46-year-old married to Peter, and they do not have children.

She sells fish in the Kariobangi area. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) every month.

She knew about KADET through marketing. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, with which she plans to purchase more stock of fish. She plans to use the anticipated profit to open a shop where she will be stocking fish.

She hopes to be the one supplying fish to big hotels. She is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 60-year-old married father of 12 children. Richard owns a workshop in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last 13 years and it has been a success. 

This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, he plans to purchase timber, nails, iron sheets and soft boards. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails, iron sheets and soft boards.

loans.name: Chari

texts.ru: Чари проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области Чари более 20 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Chari lives in the Jilikul Region. He is 35 years. He is married. He has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Chari is a farmer. He leases a land plot and grows vegetables for sale. He has been in this line of work for over 20 years. He is taking out a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers  in order to do his planting and eventually obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 43-year-old single lady. She is a poultry farmer in Mariakani. She has been in this business for the last one year.
 
She has been a KADET client, and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Luz has a food shop that sells several dishes like escabeche & adobo. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like meat and vegetables.
Luz is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his herd of livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 42 year old single lady. Lucy runs a green grocer in Mariakani. Her business has been in operation for the last four years. 

She has been a KADET client previously and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Lucy’s dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, pineapples, cabbage, potatoes, onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Cristy has a retail shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy green & yellow bananas for sale.
Cristy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Cristy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green & yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of new clothes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 43 year old married lady. Susan runs a food cafe in Mtwapa, Mombasa. Her business has been in operation for the last five years.

She has been a KADET client previously and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal into her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, cooking oil, wheat flour and maize meal

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Victorina has a food shop that sells chicken and pork adobo and afritada. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for the dishes which she serves.

Victorina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the dishes which she serves

loans.name: Lennox

texts.en:
Lennox is a 36-year-old married father of one child aged nine. Lennox runs a retail shop in Kilifi. This business has been in operation for the last nine years and it has been a success. 

This marks his fourth borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, Lennox plans to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and maize meal. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and maize meal

loans.name: Denie

texts.en:
Denie, aged 33, earns a living through farming. She helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has two young children aged seven and six.

Denie has been engaged in rice farming for eight years. She works hard to support her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs. Denie is hoping that their business will grow and that it will enable them to save for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Rita has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel.  She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 36-year-old father of one child. He sells tomatoes wholesale in Kongowea, Mombasa. This business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, Joseph plans to increase his stock of tomatoes. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to increase his stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 23-year-old father of one child aged four.  Charles runs a retail shop in Kilifi. This business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, Charles plans to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a widow and lives with her brother and sister. She works as a teacher at a nearby school where she gets income on a monthly basis. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her nephew who operates a mobile shop in the market. Through his shop, he sells new and used mobile phones as well as mobile accessories at reasonable rates. 

He is very good in his customer dealings and earns a reasonable income every month. With this loan, he will buy mobile phones and accessories to put in his shop. 

Naseem is very hopeful that after the loan investment her nephew's income will be increased and it will help him have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Rhona May

texts.en:
Rhona May is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rhona May has a food shop that sells banana and sweet potato cues (caramelised sweet snacks). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy ripe bananas and sugar.

Rhona May is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ripe bananas and sugar

loans.name: Shasenem

texts.ru: Шасенем проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж и старшая дочь работают в средней школе, они преподаватели. Сама Шесенем у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев и наволочек. Кроме того она занимается вышивкой разных рисунков на наволочках. Этим видом деятельности Шасенем занимается более семи лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Shasenem lives in the Jilikul Reigon. She is 42 years old. She is married. She has five children. Her husband and eldest daughter work as school teachers. Shesenem sews traditional ethnic outfits as well as pillowcases out of her home. She also  embroiders  pillowcases. She has been in this business for over seven years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells afritada (a chicken dish) and caldereta (a stew). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes

loans.name: Sapy

texts.en:
Sapy is a 47-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has had a tailoring business from her home since 2000. She specializes in sewing pearls in with textiles. 

As with the majority of Lebanese wives, her story illustrates the day-to-day challenges in running a business to help their husband with the household expenses. Today, she is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tailoring machinery in order to increase her business productivity and therefore her income. In the future, she is planning to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase new tailoring machinery

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 41-year-old married father of four children aged between two months and ten. He owns a retail shop in Mariakani, a business that has been in operation for the last two years and which has been a success. 

Morris has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking oil for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His hope and dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old and married. She has four children aged 25, 24, 21 and 10. She lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Elizabeth is a farmer who has been growing rice for 25 years now. She sells her harvest to rice traders. Elizabeth works hard to help sustain her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to own and manage a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rolem

texts.en:
Rolem is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Rolem has a retail shop that sells snacks, biscuits and breads. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and  beverages.

Rolem is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar, aged 47, lives in Darkhan city, the second largest city in Mongolia with his wife and four children in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. His older daughter has a job, but she could not get a higher education until now and the other children are pupils in secondary school. 

Ganbaatar became a repairman in a private company this year. He also has three milk-cows for his house usage and sales to citizens of Darkhan city. Currently this is a major source of income for his family. His family moved to this city from another region in 2002 and they lived in a rental house at first. After that he was able to buy his own small-sized piece of land by saving some money from the productivity of his milk cows.
    
Now he needs to have one more milk cow with a calf to raise the sale supply to increase his family income. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to buying one milk cow with calf to increase his family income.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow with calf to increase his family income.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is 24 years old and married. He has a one-year-old child.

Elmar is a farmer who tills land located in Surallah, South Cotabato. He grows rice, corn and vegetables. Elmar sells his harvest at his town's local market. He works hard to improve his harvest and earnings.

This loan will be used to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Elmar hopes to earn more and to save for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lina has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Lina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
K. is a 55-year-old man living with his wife and six children, four of whom are still attending school. In 1990, he started farming. His work consists of cultivating all types of vegetables according to the season, and distributing them to specified agricultural markets he works with. He's thankful for his business; it allows him to earn a good income for his family.

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds. He is planning to expand his business and he is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming season.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
 
Marilou is providing a motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) service. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service.

Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул жительница района Джиликул. Ей 56 лет. Она вдова, имеет 7 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она имеет 14 га земли, где сеет пшеницу, выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. В этой области она уже три года. До этого Бозоргул работала в ферме, дояркой. На сегодняшний день она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Bozorgul lives in the Jilikul Region. She is 56 years old. She is a widow, with seven children. She has finished secondary school. She has 14 hectares [about 35 acres] of land, where she sows wheat, grows vegetables and plants fruit trees. She has been in this line of work for three years. In the past she used to milk cows at a farm. She is taking out the present loan in order to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been selling timber in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 36 years old, married to Jedida and they have school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new power saw.

In future, Samson hopes to grow his business and become a leading supplier of timber in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a new power saw.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for improving her business of selling animals. She sells buffalo, cows, and goats. With the loan, she will purchase young animals and will sell them to butchers and to other people after raising them. 

She is very experienced and has been doing her business for the past 20 years. She is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will be able to expand it successfully. 

Her husband is also an animal seller by profession. Both Bashiraan and her husband also get milk from their cattle to earn an additional income. 

Bashiraan has two sons: the eldest one is in college while youngest one is not yet reading. 

Bashiraan is confident that after the loan investment, her family business will grow further and her family will be able to enjoy better living facilities as a result. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy animals for resale

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 43-year-old married father of one child aged 13 years. Alex operates a food cafe in Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last 14 years. He has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour for his restaurant.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. Alex's dream and passion is to give his clients the best service and to eventually expand and open another restaurant in Kilifi.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour for his restaurant.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Narcisa has a retail shop that sells coconuts for copra (the dried meat or kernel of the coconut). She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts to sell.

Narcisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his metal and welding shop in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 34 years old, married to Lilian and they have one child who is two years old.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of KES 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fabricating metals.

In future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and open more metal and welding stores around Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy more fabricating metals.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, 33, lives in the Philippines and is married with one child. He has a shop that sells pusit (i.e. squid) and dried fish, a business he has had for three years. He has requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to buy pusit and dried fish.

Francis is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pusit and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Florites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Florites requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Florites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 33, is married woman with six children, aged 2 to 17. She began farming 10 years ago and now helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops to sell. Helen has requested a loan because they need financial assistance for their farm. She plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

In the future, Helen hopes for a stable business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 35, is the married mother of four children. She is a boutique owner and a tailor in Mariakani and her business has been in operation for the last eleven years. Her business has been doing well.

She is a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to offer the best life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has operated his tailor shop in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He is 48, married to Hildah and they have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fabric for making new clothes for sell.

In the future, George hopes to move into a more permanent place as his business grows.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for making new clothes for sell.

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
Asela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a "trisikad" transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her "trisikad" transport business.

Asela has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

Asela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her "trisikad".

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn, 32, is married with two children, aged 11 and 9. She lives with her family in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato.

Jennlyn is engaged in farming and has been growing rice and corn crops for four years now. She earns as much as 15,000 PHP per month when the harvest is good.

Jennlyn requested this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her farm to always be productive.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for uplifting her business of selling animals. She buys young animals and sells to butchers after raising them. Her business grows fast on Eid (a Muslim occasion) because people buy animals for slaughtering, and on other days she sells to butchers. 

With the loan, she will buy some goats to raise with good care, to sell and earn a good profit. 

She is a widow and a mother of 3 children. All of them are studying at a nearby school. 

She is very hopeful that an investment will prove beneficial for her business and that her children will enjoy better living facilities as a result.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, 42, is married with three children, aged 23, 21 and one year. Both Letecia and her husband are farmers. She engaged in rice farming 23 years ago. Now, she and her husband own and till a land in their town, Surallah, South Cotabato. They currently need financing for the farm so Letecia applied for a loan from CEVI. Letecia is planning to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Letecia hopes to have a stable business and for her children to succeed in their chosen fields.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 41 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a sari-sari store in the Philippines. Lilibeth requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like noodles and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 48, is married with five children. Both she and her husband are farmers. Merlyn supports her husband in tilling the land and growing rice crops. She also manages their sari-sari store business, selling items such as eggs, canned goods and vinegar to the people in her community.

Merlyn requested this loan to fund their farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies they need. Merlyn hopes that through their businesses, their lives will be uplifted.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 32, has operated his food kiosk in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is married to Mary and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to restock his food kiosk with cooking oil, flour and sugar, items which he buys in bulk.

In the future, he hopes to expand his food kiosk and open a bigger kiosk where he can serve many people at the same time.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with his mother and his wife.

In 2008 Rida opened a store selling construction and building materials. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 to renovate his store and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his store and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 57 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Bernardita works very hard to provide for her family.

Bernardita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Bernardita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, candy, snack foods, etc. 

In the future Bernardita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of flour, margarine, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cherry is 35 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Cherry has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

Cherry has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mobina

texts.en:
Mobina, 46, is married with two children, aged 13 and 10. She is a farmer and has been growing rice and vegetables for 13 years. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Aside from farming, Mobina also sells barbecue to the people in her community.

Mobina requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is hoping for a stable business for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmelita has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.
Carmelita has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 35, is the married mother of one child. Caroline is a green grocer in Majaoni, Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last six years. Her business has been doing well.

She is a KADET client and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more stock of vegetables. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady and to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melinda works hard to support her family. She has a personal products sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Melinda is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional products such as perfumes, body lotion etc. to sell.
Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as perfumes, body lotion etc. to sell.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has two children.
Haydar has owned a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuff to his market. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuff to his market.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more fish to sell at her stall.
Aida has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Novily

texts.en:
Novily, 32, is an entrepreneur from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She has a rice farming business, a fish pond and a sari-sari store. Novily hires farmers to help till her land. She works hard to manage her business and sustain her family.

Novily requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies. She hopes to gain more knowledge in managing her businesses well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell in her store.
Emelda has been in this business for a year. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two school-aged children. Her husband is past the age of 64. 

Mariam is the proud owner of a car repair shop. She handles tasks such as the business expenses, returns, appointments etc. Her husband assists her with the work. He is responsible for changing tires, repairing engines, and other manuA. labor. They work together to satisfy the family needs and to be able to cover their children's education fees. 

Today, Mariam is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a scanner machine. She says that this machine will smooth the work operation and help identify the smallest car damages. She is very optimistic and hopes to further expand her business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner machine

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky, 28, is married with two young children, aged one year and 8 months.

He is a farmer who owns and tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato, primarily growing rice to sell. Ricky also sells salted peanuts in his neighborhood.

Ricky has requested a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer such as urea. Ricky hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer such as urea.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 
Rowena has a purified drinking water sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more plastic containers for her purified drinking water business.
Rowena has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has two children.
K. has owned a sound recording studio since 1999. He has deep expertise in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2400 loan to pay the annual rent for his studio. He is optimistic about his business' development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his studio.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. She works hard to support her family. 

Vicenta has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 64, has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twelve years. He is married to Esther and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Josphat hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 66, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is married to Isaac and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 44 years old, married and has two children, both of whom work.
Malika has owned a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, sweets, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. She is requesting a loan of $3,000 to buy three refrigerators and to make sliding doors for her market. She is aiming to earn more profits to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy three refrigerators and to make sliding doors for her market.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 53, is a married woman with 10 children, aged 10 to 30. She is a farmer and helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. She also helps in growing rice crops and keeping the farm free of weeds and pests. Teresita also buys fresh fish and makes dried fish to sell. She works hard to help provide for their household needs and send her children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and more fish to dry and sell. Teresita hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, sugar and flour for his shop.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school.  Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, snack food, etc. 

Elvie has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory.

Elvie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her tailor shop.

loans.name: Margarette Ann

texts.en:
Margarette Ann is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years.
Margarette Ann works hard to support her family.

Margarette Ann has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Margarette Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, 31, is a single man who has been working in furniture making for fifteen years. He started his own business in 2003.

Mahmoud is a man with a good reputation and he is recommended by most of his clients because of the quality of work he does. To improve his quality of work more, Mahmoud requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business, in addition to renewing his working permit since he's a foreigner.

Mahmoud works hard on improving his image in his domain and hopes to further expand his work in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, 54, is married with five children. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years and grows rice and corn crops at her farm in Surallah, South Cotabato. Tessie sells her harvest at her town's market.

Tessie needs additional capital for her business. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

In the future, Tessie hopes to be successful and to be a lender to other farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 55 years old and married with two children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (restaurant).

Josefa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 39, has been extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He is married to Lydia and they have six school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to diversify his sources of income.

In the future, he hopes to expand and own many quarries.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda, 40, is a resident of Pasay, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her daily expenses.

Criselda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. Criselda earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the unit. Her store is adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Criselda hopes to be able to expand her store to other communities. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Leonida is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF, all of which she has repaid. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Kaiss

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has one child.
Since 2003 Kaiss has run a workshop selling spare parts and engine oil for cars. He has more than 12 years of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,600 loan to pay the annual rent and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 55 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Clarita runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.
Clarita has borrowed and paid back 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her variety store for 21 years and also earns an income from e-loading and computer gaming. Clarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as soft drinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell.
Cheryl has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from her general store. Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.
Since 2006 Bahaa has run a barber shop where he offers shaving and massage services. He has long experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate and change the decor in his shop and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate and change the decor in his shop and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 19, has been selling stationery in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more stationery to sell in his shop.

In the future, Stephen hopes to grow and becoming a leading supplier of stationery in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy more office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha, 43, is a single woman who has been working in women's beauty for 10 years and is still working hard to achieve the best in this field. She insisted to make her own business in 2004 and she's doing her best to improve it to fit all customers needs. Salha also sells accessories in addition to beauty supplies.

To increase her stock of accessories, Salha requested a loan from Al Majmoua and hopes it will be effective like the previous three loans she paid back, with a good standing history.

She is willing to expand her business more but she believes that she has to plan in a very cautious way to not do something she might regret.

loans.use: to increase her stock of accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla, 28, has been selling fruits and vegetables in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is married to Benson and they have one child, who is one and a half years old.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy three bags of potatoes and one crate of tomatoes to add to her stock.

In the future, she hopes to expand and open a big grocery store in a more permanent place.

loans.use: to buy three bags of potatoes and one crate of tomatoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Qaraoglan

texts.en:
Qaraoglan is a hardworking husband and father of two children. He owns a small café which serves all sorts of food and tea. He likes his work and stands out in it due to his attention to detail, the cleanliness of his establishment, the quality of his work and his friendliness. He has three years of experience in this field and his monthly profit is about 300 USD. 
Qaraoglan started his business cooking the national meat dish, which is very popular. Today, he rents a place at the central market of Sabirabad city. He would like to extend his business and purchase new plastic chairs and tables to make his place more attractive to customers. For this purpose, he has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs and tables to improve his café.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 32, has operated his electrical shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is married to Ruth and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy mobile phone accessories to sell in his shop.

In the future, Samuel hopes to grow his shop and start selling in wholesale.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 51, has operated his metal and welding shop in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is married to Jane and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of 13,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy a drill and grinder to replace the ones he currently has, which are broken.

In the future, John hopes to expand and open a hardware store to run side by side with his welding shop.

loans.use: to buy a drill and grinder.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masirika, leader du groupe d’affaire « Miujiza »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 25 ans, jeune mariée, mère de 1 enfant encore bébé. Elle est vendeuse d’articles divers. Son mari est un enseignant, instructeur. Elle installe ses marchandises dans une petite boutique (kiosque), près de son domicile. Il y a une année qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  2 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 casiers de Fanta, 1 box de sel de cuisine, lotion de beauté, biscuit, etc.  En plus, elle ambitionne  acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Miujiza » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client, Masirika, is the leader of the business group called "Miujiza". She is 25 years old, a newlywed and the mother of one child who is still a baby. She is a salesperson for a variety of goods. Her husband is a teacher and an instructor. 

She sells her merchandise from a small store, or kiosk, close to her home. She has been in this business for a year. She has completed two loan cycles with the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan will be used to purchase two cases of Fanta, one box of kitchen salt, beauty creams, biscuits and so on. Additionally, her ambition is to purchase a plot of land so that she can build comfortably. 

She would like to thank Hekima for its work helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. It should be noted that the members in the business group "Miujiza" are mostly women.

loans.use: To purchase two cases of Fanta, one box of kitchen salt, beauty cream, biscuits etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has three children.
Haydar has owned a mechanical lathe workshop since 1991. He has more than 20 years of experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area. He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to earn more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Surn

texts.en:
Surn is a house wife and stays home with her husband.  They have 5 children, one is studying in school and the other 4 are working in the factory earning $2 per day each.  The payment of all expenses in the family is dependent on all of her children. 

Every month, the expenses in the family are about $50.  She would like to request a loan of $600 to repair her house.  The repayment will be the responsibility of all of her children.  She expects to get a good place to stay and will push her last child to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Heyran

texts.en:
Heyran is married and has one daughter. Her husband is unemployed. Heyran helps her husband to take care of their family. She sells everyday products in her grocery store, which is located in the central market of Sabirabad. She purchases goods two times a week. Her monthly income is about 250 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN). 

Heyran would like to get a loan of 1,000 AZN for purchasing a new assortment of foods in order to expand her business and allow customers greater choice. This will be her second loan and she has a good credit history. She is a careful and responsible borrower of AqroInvest CU.

loans.use: purchase more products in order to increase her profit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase one cattle

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.en:
Ibodullo is married and he is the father of four children.  He is a hardworking and honest man.  For the last 13 years Ibodullo has been selling woman’s fabrics in several local markets, “Chorku”, “Vorukh” and “Surkh” where there is great demand.  His wife is also engaged in this business and she sells fabrics at home because women in this village are not allowed to run a market business. 

With this business he receives a good profit and he wishes to keep his money for building a home and buying wheat.  His son who is 13 years old is also engaged in their family business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
