These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new woman’s fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been offering transport services and renting houses for seven years in Naivasha.  He is 41 years and is married to Winne.  He has three school age children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.  This is his third loan.  He paid the other loans well and in good time.  He intends to use this loan to repair his vehicle.  In future, he intends to buy another matatu in order to increase his income.

loans.use: To repair his minibus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
Sadek is a 44 year old married man and the father of 3 children.  Sadek has had experience as a blacksmith since 1979.  He started his own business in 1991 in order to provide his family with better living.

Sadek is a hardworking man and seeks the best for his customers and family, especially his wife and kids.  He insists on providing his children with the best education ever and that's why he requested a loan from Al  Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to pay his children's school fees.

Sadek is a man with a good standing history and he has been a Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles, and hopes to continue to be a good borrower.  He stated that the previous loans helped a lot in improving his family and business social and financial situation.
Sadek hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to insure covering his children's university education expanses.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school expenses

loans.name: Chomrouen

texts.en:
Chomrouen is 25 years old and married.  He is a math teacher in a state school. His wife is a biology teacher in the same school. Their income is $6.50 per day. Every month, he has to spend $66 on food and $10 on electricity. 

Chomrouen is requesting a loan for $1,000 to buy farm land and enter the agricultural field. He was doing farming during his spare time, so that he would earn more income for meeting his expenses. They have a strong commitment to improve themselves to be good teachers in the future by receiving more training and studying.

loans.use: to purchase a farm land.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 26, has operated his motorbike in Naivasha town for the last four years. He also has a retail shop run buy the wife. He is married to Martha and has one school-going child.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer and this is his fourth loan. He paid the other loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to add cosmetics and plastic items to his shop and buy a motorbike.

In the future, he aspires to own a vehicle which he will use in his taxi business and expand his shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and plastic items to his shop and buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a mango selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation of mangos from the countryside to the market. Her major dream is to expand her business.

With the 20,000 Kshs, she wants to purchase two sacks of mangos for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of mangos for sale.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 35, has run a boutique for ten years in Naivasha. She is a widow and the mother of two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer and this is her second loan. She intends to use this loan to add childrens wear, skirts and blouses to her stock.

Hannah’s future dream is to enlarge her boutique to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay is a farmer with her husband and their income is $2 per day. She has two children who both work in the factory earning $5 per day each. Every month, Lay has to spend $55 on food, $20 on transportation and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy pigs for feeding. With this loan, she can make other benefits for her family. In the future, she plans to feed more animals and to repair her house when she have enough money.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Veth

texts.en: Veth, 60, is a grocery seller. She is a single mother with four children, two of whom are studying and two working for $3 per day each. Every month, she spends $70 on food, $12 on school fees and $10 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods to sell. Her career is going well and she can make a good income from it. She wishes to sell medicine as she wants to send her children to study pharmacy in university, so that she can open a pharmacy which also sells groceries at home.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mama Women's Group

texts.en:
Sarah, 37, started her fish-sales business three years ago. The courteous mother of one says she started this business to earn her keep after she graduated from school. 

Fish sells well on the markets in Lugazi, and provided one has enough in reserve, one is likely to do good business.

Sarah's business has been boosted by the fact that Lugazi is in close proximity to the shores of Lake Victoria, which supplies most of the fish people consume in Uganda. She therefore does not have to move far to purchase the fish she sells. In most cases, she purchases the fish she sells from fishermen who bring their catch to Lugazi town.

Her biggest challenge has been the fact that she has to sell her fish while moving. This, she says, has stifled the growth of her business as some of her clients are not easily accessible. She has to spend money every day to reach some of them and some of these clients reside in far off places. This, needless to say, has played havoc with the consolidation of her finances.

She says this business's gross profits total up to UGX 50,000 weekly.

Sarah says this Kiva loan is to help her construct a permanent stall from which she can sell her fish.

loans.use: To construct a permanent fishing-selling stall.

loans.name: Entha

texts.en:
Entha, 45 years old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife sells groceries at home. Their income is $7.5 per day. 

He has two children, 20 and 16 year old, and both are studying. 

Every month, he has to spend $75 on food, $10 on electricity, $25 on school fees and $15 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy more grocery goods for his wife to sell because he sees that his wife can make a good income while staying home to take care of the children and property. He hopes to be able to send his children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has run a boutique for two years in Naivasha. She is 19 years old and married to David. She is the mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is her second loan. She intends to use this loan to add more women's clothes like skirts and blouses to her stock.

Her future dream is to enlarge her boutique stock shoes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle and one cow

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is a hardworking man. He is married and the loving father of one child. 

Firuz has been engaged in selling sausages for the last six years. He purchases his products from Khujand and transports them with his own car. He distributes the goods to the local shops in Isfara city. 

He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital to buy more sausages to sell in order to make a good profit for his child. He wishes to give a good education to his child to provide him with the bright future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sausages to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia, age 35, is a very hard-working entrepreneur. For 10 years, she has operated a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale.

She and her husband have three children, all enrolled in school.

In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has run a garage in Naivasha for seven years. He is 33 years old and married to Jane. He has two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is his second loan. He paid the other loan well and in good time. 

He intends to use this loan to buy spare parts such as oil filters and plugs.

Michael’s future dream is to open a new garage.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as oil filters and plugs.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Santa dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and kerosene for sale. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Bunchan

texts.en:
Bunchan, 29 year old, is state teacher in one of the primary schools in his village with $4 per day for his income. He lives with one younger sister. 

Every month, he has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $10 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for traveling to teach in the school and for his extra class that he is taking to get more knowledge to apply in his career. 

In the future, he plans to support his sister to study until she is able to be a teacher like him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work and classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and two calves

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for nine years. He is 36 years old and married to Serah. He has four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is his third loan. He has paid the other loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay labor costs.

In the future, Samuel hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three calves and fodder for them

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has run her cafe and practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 20 years. She is 49 years old and married to Paul. She has three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is her second loan. She paid the other loan well and in good time. 

She intends to use this loan to boost her cafe by enlarging it and also to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, she aspires to enlarge her cafe and improve her farming to a more profitable level.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides, and also to buy stock for her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals, sacks of beans, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Thirty-four-years-old, married to Martha, and the father of two school-going children, Samuel has practiced farming  for the last nine years in Ndunyu Njeru.

Introduced to KADET by a KADET officer, this will be his third loan, which he intends to use to rent a piece of land and purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and a small bull to rear. He repaid the previous loans well and in good time. Samuel's dream is to increase his farm's productivity so as to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and a small bull to rear.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 52-year-old married man, father of three children, who has been working in transportation since 2002. Ghassan wants to buy a new car that will help improve his business by attracting tourists who ask for a private taxi to go on a tour all over the country in a comfortable car. He said that "it is time to change my car, because this one is getting old and tired like humans it's almost its time to rest."

Ghassan intends to sell his current car and has requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to add this money to what he gets from his car's price. This will allow him to purchase a new car.

This business is his only source of living, and he works hard to improve it to stay attractive to new customers and adapt to different changes. Ghassan hopes to stay healthy and active, in order to reply to all requested tours, and to keep on providing his family with the best living.

loans.use: to buy a new car to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his fuel sales business to include a spare auto parts operation

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: Rovshan 33 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom ,pereselenec iz Kalbadjar region, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Rovshan jenat i u nego 2 rebonka. Rovshan ranshe zanimalsya vipechkoy xleba no uje 2 qoda kak on otkril svoy magazin dla prodaji produktov. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Rovshana on ochen blagodaren za pevuyu ssudu Kive i lenderom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit xolodilnik dlya xraneniya produktovv magazine.
texts.en: Rovshan is 33 years old. He is an internally displaced person. He has been relocated from Kalbadjar region and now lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Rovshan is married and has two children. He used to be in the business of baking bread, but since two years ago he opened his own grocery store. This is a second loan for Rovshan and he is very grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the first loan. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy a refrigerator for storing food in the store.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for storing of food

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 11 years. She is 39 years old and married to Benson. She is a mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET customer. This is her third loan. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and meet labor costs.

Her future dream is to improve her farming by introducing an irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and meet labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha, 43 years old, is selling food. Her husband is a soldier and their income is 13 USD per day. She has 3 children, 21, 18, and 13 years old. All are studying. Every month, she has to spend 50 USD on food, 12 USD on electricity, 60 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 500 USD for buying supplies to make food and stuff related to her business in order to sell more. She plans to extend her career by selling more food as she gets more customers. For her children, she wants to send them to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy goods for making food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three cattle, fodder, and one pregnant cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattles and some new clothes for summer season to offer for sale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Imelda's husband is a tricycle driver.

Imelda is managing a general store. She has invested all of her loans in maintaining her general store and has managed to keep it running with a great deal of commitment on her part. 

With this new loan of 8,000 PHP, Imelda will buy a variety of products that she can display in her store, such as soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, crackers and cookies. This will enable her to have a better store and more products to sell to her customers who come to her store every day to buy from her. 

She is grateful to ASKI for the loans they have given her before and she is hoping her new loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, canned goods, noodles, crackers and cookies to sell

loans.name: Ma.elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 46, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a mechanic, and father to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elena is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is bU. mineral water in containers from wholesalers, sells them per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. She also earns additional income by selling personal products like Avon, Natasha and other direct-sell products to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to bU. more stocks of mineral water and other merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elena dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional mineral water containers and other personal products she needs in her business

loans.name: Souen

texts.en:
Souen is a basket seller who earns $3.50 a day. She lives with her two children, one of whom is a farmer and earns $1.50 per day. Every month, Souen spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses.

Souen is requesting a loan of $500 to buy medical treatment for herself. This loan will help her to get well and be able to continue her career.

In the future Souen hopes to buy more baskets to sell so that she can earn more for her family.

loans.use: to buy medical treatment for herself.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dishes to sell

loans.name: Saidmahmad

texts.ru: Саидмахмад проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Саидмахмад занимается растениеводством. Он при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает дыню, арбуз и овощи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Saidmahmad lives in the Jililkul region. He is married. He has five children. His wife works in the collective farm in the region. Saidmahmad does agriculture. He has a small plot of land by the house where he grows melons, watermelons and vegetables. He has been in this business for fifteen years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Rahim ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Rahim rodilsya v 1989 qodu. Rahim uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svayo kafe. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy i pomog yemu otkrit eto kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye kafe dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Rahim is not married and does not have children. He lives in the Absheron region together with his mother. Rahim was born in 1989. He's had his own cafe for two years now. He learned about this business from his father who helped him open the cafe. Right now Rahim needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of the cafe to grow his business.

loans.use: to expand the cafe space

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a beautician and has one child. Her husband is a construction worker. Together they earn $8 a day. Her expenses include $60 for food, $5 for electricity and $12 for everyday expenditures.

Chantha wants to open her own salon. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy beauty salon equipment to open her own shop.

If Chantha’s salon results in a good income and gets a lot of customers, then she will expand it by provide vocational training to others in her shop as a source of more income.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment to open her own shop.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 39 years old and married to Charles. She has four school-going children. She has farmed and run a clothing shop for the past thirteen years in Ndunyu Njeru.

Serah was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer. This is her third loan. She paid the other loans well and in good time. She intends to use this loan to buy a dairy cow, seed, fertilizer, pesticides and pay school fees.

In the future she aspires to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy buy a dairy cow, seed, fertilizer, pesticides and pay school fees.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 35 years old and married to Lilian. They have three school-going children.

George has been working in a quarry in Naivasha for the last thirteen years. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET LTD customer. This is his third loan. He intends to use this loan to buy an extraction site, working tools and meet manpower costs.

In the future he aspires to buy several extraction sites and transport lorries.

loans.use: to buy an extraction site, working tools and meet manpower costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Two

texts.en:
Two, 56 year old, is a fish seller who earns $4 a day. Her husband is retired. She has two children, all of whom are working and earning $7 a day each. Every month she has to spend $165 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $30 on other expenses.

Two is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a car for her son’s taxi service. He had a car, but it is old and needs a lot of repairs, which cuts into his profits. Two also wants to repair her house and extend her fish-selling career wH. she has enough money.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son’s taxi service.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 55 year old, married to Ambrose and blessed with four children.

For the last ten years Christine has run a poultry farm in the area of Kahawa Sukari. From this she earns an income of 12,000 KES a month.

Christine has a good credit history with KADET. She is now applying for a fourth loan of 65,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more chickens and chicken feed. She will use the extra profits to expand her poultry business.

In the future Christine hopes to venture into laying hens so as to supply eggs over and above the broilers she raises now.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 year old, married to Erastus and is blessed with two children.

For the last ten years Elizabeth has sold milk in Jericho market in Nairobi. She earns an income of 16,000 KES a month.

Elizabeth has a good credit history with KADET. She is now applying for a second loan of 60,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more milk.

Elizabeth will use her extra profits to expand her business and educate her children. She hopes to expand her business so as to become an authorized milk distributor.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 44 years old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband repairs motorbikes. Together their income is $6 per day. Sothea has four children; three are working in the factory and earning $6 each a day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Sothea would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom. She would like to construct a shop for her husband to do motorbike repair at home, because now he is working in a shop under its owner.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Dedan

texts.en:
Dedan is 25 years old and a business-oriented businessman. He is single. He has been making a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He wants in the next five years to be a prominent businessman. 

He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving him finances to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a bakery business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, butter, baking powder, potatoes and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, butter, baking powder, potatoes and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food-selling business, selling to her neighbors and school-going children. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, utensils, cooking fat oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, utensils, cooking fat oil and beans.

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
Davron is a hardworking man. He is married and the father of four children. His wife works as a teacher.

Davron has been a farmer for seven years and has much business experience. Davron cultivates onions, carrots, tomatoes and watermelon. His wife helps him in the business, and during the harvest season he hires additional help.

Davron would like a loan of $1,500 to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay his workers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Bostan

texts.ru: Бостан проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена. У нее две детей. Она живет вместе с родителями. Ее родители пенсионеры. Она одна обеспечивает семью. Бостан занимается растениеводством. Она арендует земельный участок, где сеет хлопок и пшеницу. Кроме этого она выращивает кукурузу. Этим видом деятельности Бостан занимается более 20 лет. Она берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Bostan lives in the Jililkul region. She is 36 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She lives together with parents who are retired. She supports the family by herself. Bostan is in agriculture. She rents out a small plots of land where she sows cotton and wheat. She also grows corn. Bostan has been in this business for more than twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer to sow and collect a good harvest for sale.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old, married and has five children. The family lives in their own house, which receives water and electricity services, in San Mariano, an area known primarily for its agriculture and livestock businesses. Margarita and her family are known in their village as a hardworking family.

For almost six years Margarita has sold fruit in the village. She has acquired a lot of customers because of her friendliness. Her earnings help her a lot in improving her quality of life.

The 5,000 PHP loan Margarita is requesting from ASKI will be used to buy fruit that she can sell to her customers such as bananas, pineapples and cabbages. By increasing her sales, she will be able to cover her loan payments and meet her household obligations.

Margarita is a person who has many aspirations. One of them is to have a larger vending post at the market so that she can offer a wider variety of fruits, attract more customers, and obtain more income. As a result, she can acquire the comforts that she wants to have in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, pineapples and cabbages to sell.

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano, Isabela

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 and married with five children, three of whom are still in school. She and her family live in Muranga in central Kenya.

Alice has been farming for over 26 years, producing maize, beans and bananas. She currently employs one farmhand. She points out that disease and poor markets are constant threats to a farmer.

Alice has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase piglets for her venture into pig farming. She says the new venture will improve her income and enable her to educate her children without too much strain. She believes the loan will have a positive impact on her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas, a 38-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines, is married to Larry, a tricycle operator, and the mother of four children. She, her husband and children manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Necitas is a mineral water distributor, buying from wholesalers and then selling in five-gallon containers for a profit. She earns additional income by selling cell phone air time loads to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, Necitas is requesting a Php35,000 loan to buy more stocks of mineral water and cell phone airtime loads. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands.

Necitas dreams of enabling all of her children to attain a good and high quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. Faithfully meeting up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional mineral water stocks and cell phone loads.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a married woman with seven children, three still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food for the family. For the past four years, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells fresh water which contributes to her income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With the Kshs 30,000 Mwanajuma wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 37 years old. He is a determined and focused businessman. He is married and blessed with four children aged 12, 8, 6 and 4. To make ends meet for the last 12 years, he has been repairing automobiles in his shop where he has employed 7 employess. His dream is to one day open up a company dealing with automobiles. He is requesting a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy needed auto repair equipment. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for empowering him financially.

loans.use: to buy needed auto repair equipment

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past thirteen years, Martha has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells paraffin which contributes to her income. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her living standards. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en: Pharis is a farmer in Muranga employing one farmhand in his farm which produces eggs, milk and horticultural products. He is aged 40, has been in farming business for over 10 years, and is married with one child aged five. Pharis has made a loan request for 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry at 60,000 KES, and goats for milk at 20,000 KES. He says the two businesses are promising and he remains hopeful his income will improve. He is however concerned about fluctuating market prices and proposes regular training for farmers in farming basics.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and goats for milk

loans.name: Mohamad Ramzi

texts.en: Mohamad Ramzi is a 63 year-old married man, and owner of the only Internet cafe in his region. He is a hard-working man who seeks the best to secure his family's living. He opened his Internet cafe to attract teenagers and students to keep them away from drugs and bad habits, as well as to improve his living standard. To allow his customers to spend their time smoothly and happily, Mohamad Ramzi has a small snack stand in his shop where he sells chips, soft drinks, and sweets. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to buy a juicer that will help introduce fresh juice to customers, and to increase his inventory of tobacco and sweets. Mohamad Ramzi enjoys being at work because he likes to watch his customers enjoy spending their time at his place. He hopes he can upgrade his machines in the future and expand his shop.

loans.use: To buy a juicer, tobacco, and a sweets for his Internet cafe

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti, a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. For the past two years, Binti has operated a food business, selling in the nearby school to both students and teachers. She faces the major business challenge of high transportation costs but dreams of expanding her enterprise in the future to meet growing customer demand.

Binti decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder and beans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cooking oil, wheat flour, baking powder and beans.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 34 years old, is married to Patricia and they are blessed with children. Thomas owns a malimali (household items) shop in Tala market where he supplies items such as pegs, toys, belts and many others. He has been doing this for the last four years and earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Thomas has a good credit history with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000, which he plans to use to buy more stock. He will use the extra profit to educate his children. Thomas hopes to  own a wholesale shop. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 58-year-old client who lives with her husband and four children in their own house in Manaring, Ilagan, Isabela. Leonida lives in the rural part of this area with only electricity service. Leonida is eager to raise her family and give them a better quality of life.

Leonida works daily, selling different products in her store. She has many customers because she is very approachable. Leonida also raises poultry which she sells to the people of her village and in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different products such as fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell. This loan will allow her to continue to develop her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee, bread, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sorghum and millet seeds to plant on his farm

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 33 years old, is married and blessed with two children, aged 4 and 3. He is an honest and hardworking businessman. For the last 9 years, Charles has been repairing cars and selling spare parts to provide for his family's needs. In the next 5 years, he wants to go large scale to be able to realize his dream of being a landlord.

Charles is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts such as alternators, headlights, etc. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has now become economically empowered.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as alternators, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en: Marcus is 30 years old and lives in Congo Town. He is married to a businesswoman and they have one child. For the past year, Marcus has been selling rice and drinks (soda, beer, etc.) wholesale. One of his major problems is the continuous rise in the price of rice. Marcus is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and drinks for his business. He hopes to become an international businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and drinks

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.ru: Махмад проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 34 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того он выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Mahmad lives in the Jililkul region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. He does animal husbandry and grows plants. He breeds small horned cattle for future resale. He also grows vegetables for sale. Mahmad has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy small horned cattle to increase their headcount.

loans.use: to buy small horned cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate his business premises and incorporate a retail shop

loans.name: Portrial

texts.en:
Portrial is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. Portrial has two children, one of whom attends school.

For the past five years, Portrial has been selling drinks such as beer, soda, etc. One of the major problems she faces is the transportation of goods to her business site. Portrial is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks for her business. She hopes to open her own store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials and renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will purchase ten kilograms of lye, ten kilos of soap powder, eleven boxes of perfumes and one box of dye.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.ru:
Etibar 33 qoda. On jenat i uje imeyet 3 detey. Etibar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Kalbadjar region, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Etibar 6 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey stroitelnix materialov. Eto uje 3aya ssuda Etibara. Vse suddu kotoriye bral Etibar bili oplacheni vovremya. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey gruzovoy mashini dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/3396

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/93852
texts.en:
Etibar is 33 years old.  He is married and has three children.  Etibar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Kalbadjar region who now lives in the Absheron region with his family.  Etibar has been selling building materials for six years.  This is his third loan.  All of his loans were repaid on time.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his truck in order to develop his business.  

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/3396

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/93852

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his truck

loans.name: Isphiwo Group

texts.en:
Babhensile is 49 years old and married, with 5 children between the ages of 16 and 35. One of her children attends school. Babhensile runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

Babhensile has been in business for 2 years selling drinks, airtime and snacks at her home. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy more of these items to sell in her general store. Babhensile says that the extra income from this loan will help her take her children to institutions of higher learning and to have a better living standard for her family. She faces a challenge of not having money when she needs to buy her stock. In the future, Babhensile would like to see her business grow, to have employees and to make her business a supermarket. She added that the group received a lot of help from WDB and Kiva and hopes they will succeed in their businesses as they are new to WDB.

loans.use: To buy drinks, airtime and snacks

loans.name: Khayolbi

texts.ru: Хаёлби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Хаёлби предоставляет услугу. У нее имеется столовая на рынке "Саховат", где она работает поваром. В этой области Хаёлби работает уже четыре года. Она берет кредит для приобретения камфорной плитки и духовки.
texts.en: Khayolbi lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a secondary education.  Khayolbi offers a service.  She has a cafe in the Sakhovat market where she works as a cook.  Khayolbi has been doing this for four years.  She is taking out a loan to buy ovens and portable stoves.

loans.use: to buy ovens and portable stoves.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, pepper, salt, flour, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Donakhon

texts.en:
Donakhon is a hardworking woman who is married and the loving mother of three children. She is a market vendor and she sells children’s clothes, women’s underwear, bed clothes and towels. Her husband sells DVDs and CDs at the market of Isfara. Donakhon works hard and she tries to meet her customers' needs in order to make many customers and earn more money. Donakhon purchases her merchandise 3-4 times a month from Khujand City. She requested a loan for purchasing children’s clothes, bed clothes and women’s underwear. 
	
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy children’s clothes, bed clothes and women’s underwear

loans.name: Zaidi

texts.en:
Zaidi is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Zaidi has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is seasonality. He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

Zaidi plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to repair a freezer and to purchase a compressor. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To repair a freezer and purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a divorced man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three years, Yusufu has operated a spare parts business, selling from his shop to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge in the business is seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate a motorcycle business. Yusufu dreams of owning a public transport vehicle in the future. 

Yusufu plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: See Us Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “See Us” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each woman in the group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. She is 23 years old, married to a businessman and they have 3 children. Isatu sells clothes. She requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva lenders in order to buy more clothes to build her inventory and offer a larger selection.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Aïsseta

texts.fr:
Mme Aïsseta est marié et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des pagnes depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Ses clients sont les agents de la Splendide Hôtel et les personnes ambulantes car elle est vendeuse ambulante.

Avec cet argent, Mme veut s’acheter 01balle de pagnes.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes et veut scolariser ses enfants pour un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Mme Aïsseta is married and the mother of 3 children, aged between 20 and 3. 2 of the children go to school, and she is responsible for 4 people. 

For the last 20 years, she has been selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She obtains her supplies in Lomé, Togo. Her customers are guests of the Hotel Splendide and passers-by, as she is a walking salesperson. 

With the money from the loan, she wants to buy 1 bale of "pagnes." The profit will be used to increase her activity. She also has the goal of opening a large store and educating her children, for a better future.

loans.use: to buy one bale of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past ten years, Mary has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenges are seasonality and perishability of products. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of vegetables in the future.

Mary plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase bundles of green vegetables, cabbages and potatoes and to renovate her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, cabbages and potatoes and to renovate her business.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru:
Fariza zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Fariza 45 let.
Fariza uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey molochnix produktov osobenno sira. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoratya i pomogla yey otkrit etot magazin. Fariza seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi molochniye produkti dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en: Fariza is married and has three children.  She lives in the Absheron region with her family.  Fariza is 45 years old.  For nine years already, Fariza has worked selling dairy products, especially cheese.  She started this business with her mother who helped her open the shop.  Fariza now needs 2000 AZN to buy dairy products for resale.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for resale

loans.name: Soamédé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits génériques, Soamédé est âgée de 24ans. Depuis 2006, elle a commencé par vendre en 2006 à toutes personnes désireuses de se soigner.  Ce premier prêt lui servira d’acheter des produits génériques (vitamines, efferalgan, paracétamol). Son conjoint est docker au port. Elle vend aussi des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
At age 24, Soamede is a retailer of generic drugs. She started selling them in 2006, to anyone seeking to heal themselves.
This first loan will be used to buy generic products (vitamins, acetaminophen, paracetamol).
Her husband is a dock worker at the harbor. She also sells shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy generic drugs.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 32-year-old woman; she is married and has three daughters and six sons. Muna's husband is a taxi driver; he drives a taxi in the city of Gaza. 

As Muna's husband doesn't have enough cash money to cover the maintenance and repairs his taxi needs, she took out the amount needed to cover the repair expenses. 

FATEN's loan will allow Muna's husband to have the maintenance done and resume working in his taxi. It is the only source of income for his big family.  As Muna is a conservative woman, her husband appears in the photograph in her place.

loans.use: To pay for taxi maintenance and improvement

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanaisha has operated a preparatory school for young children. Her potential customers are school-going children from her neighborhood. She dreams of establishing a full primary school for all children in the future.

Mwanaisha plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to renovate her classes and to set up another class to meet the rising of number pupils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To renovate her classes and set up another class to meet the rising number of pupils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and construct a poultry unit

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as beans, rice, salt, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing items (blouses, pants, skirts)

loans.name: Parvin

texts.ru: Парвин жительница города Куляб. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в аптеке. Сама Парвин более пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района, где продает мужскую, женскую и детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Parvin lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in a pharmacy.  Parvin has been trading in the market for more than five years.  She has a shop in the region's central market where she sells men's, women's, and children's clothes.  She is taking out a loan to buy children's clothes.  She wants to increase the variety of goods she offers.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes

loans.name: Come And See Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you members of the “Come and See” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Amie is the leader of this group. Amie is 32 years old and married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school. Amie sells bulgur wheat, beans, gari (food made out of cassava roots), etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Amie is going to buy the above mentioned items in wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bulgur wheat, beans, gari, etc. in wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Maman de 03 enfants, Ayawa revend des draps et torchons au  Grand Marché de Lomé. Ce prêt l’aidera à acheter plus de marchandises. Son conjoint est déclarant en douanes elle a démarré en 1996.
texts.en: The mother of three children, Ayawa re-sells sheets and dish cloths at the large market of Lomé.  This loan will help her to purchase more merchandise.  Her spouse is a customs officer.  She started her business in 1996.

loans.use: to purchase dish towels and sheets

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saum is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Saum has operated a clothes selling business for the past one year, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of clothes for sale in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Messanvi

texts.fr: Agé de 23ans, Messanvi est, revendeur de friperie. Elle vend de jolis habits pour dames et hommes. Il est à son premier cycle de crédit à WAGES et a démarré en 2008.
texts.en: At 23 years old, Messanvi is a second-hand clothing retailer.  He sells good-looking clothing for women and men.  He is on his first loan cycle from WAGES and he started his business in 2008.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Ahlonkoba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sacs et habits friperie à BAGUIDA, Ahlonkoba revend à toutes personnes après avoir acheté à Lomé. Elle veut ce premier cycle pour acheter des habits et sacs. Elle est mariée à un électricien et ils ont 03 enfants. Elle a démarré en 2001.
texts.en: A retailer of bags and used clothing in BAGUIDA, Ahlonkoba sells to anyone after having made her purchases in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She wants this initial (loan) cycle to buy clothing and handbags. She is married to an electrician, and they have three children. She began in 2001.

loans.use: to buy bags and clothing

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida está casada con el Sr. Miguel, juntos tienen dos hijos, los cuales ya son mayores y están ya en la Universidad. Su marido trabaja en una empresa privada hace ya unos años.
La Sra. Elida tiene una pequeña despensa hace ya unos años, por medio de la cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa. Ella sostiene que su marido también la ayuda en el mantenimiento del negocio. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por generar un poco más de ingresos, con lo cual podrá tener una mejor condición económica. La cliente manifiesta que uno de sus sueños es poder, algún día, abrir un supermercado donde pueda tener ya todo tipo de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, lácteos, embutidos y demás, para poder abastecer su local y por medio de esto no quedar sin mercaderías cuando los clientes lo demanden.
texts.en:
Elida is married to Miguel and together they have two grown children who are in college. Her husband has worked for some years in a private business.

For several years, Elida has run a small store that allows her to cover the costs of their home. She says that her husband also helps out with the business. She says that everything that they do is to make a little more money so that they will be able to have better living conditions. One of her dreams is to one day be able to open a supermarket where she can have every kind of product to offer her customers.

This loan is to purchase food, dairy products, sausages and other things to stock her store so that she won't lack the merchandise that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, sausages and other things.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 62-year-old married man and father of four children. Ghazi has owned a grocery store since 1995. He has 30 years of experience in such a business.

Ghazi is a hardworking man who seeks his customers' satisfaction. Ghazi works hard to provide a healthy living for his family and improving his business at the same time.

To get ready for Holy Ramadan month, Ghazi is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua (a Kiva partner) for the second time, in order to increase his store's capitA. with sugar, tea, herbs and seeds, as well as speciA. dates, syrups and nuts requested a lot during this month. His previous loan was very effective and helped both his sociA. and financiA. situation.  He was a borrower in good standing, too.

Ghazi is optimistic about this loan and hopes to achieve what he looks forward to.

loans.use: to increase his store's capital and purchase items to sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008, Afi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes à Lomé. Femme d’un instituteur, elle a 02 enfants. Elle veut voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions, avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 2008, Afi is requesting this loan to buy some pagne cloth in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is the wife of a primary school teacher and has two children. She wants to see her children grow up in the right environment and to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a 34-year-old man. He is married and has four sons. Ameen owns a taxi that he drives inside the city on one of the public transportation lines, as well as transporting clients upon request. Such a job doesn't help Ameen make the money he needs to cover both family and car expenses. Therefore, he had to take out a loan from FATEN to cover the insurance and licencing fees. With the help of the loan, Ameen (who is photographed next to his car) will be able to cover the fees without exhausting himself financially.

loans.use: to pay for taxi insurance and licensing fees.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a hardworking 44-year-old business lady. She is single and the proud mother of two children who are going to school. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last 20 years to make a living. In the next 5 years she wants to have increased the number of bales she stocks and sells so that she is able to realize her dream of being a major importer of clothes.

She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to buy second hand clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access funds to inject into her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 37 years old, married, and has seven children, six of whom are currently attending school. For the past 17 years, she has been a farmer in Kitale town in western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells to the local market. She mainly depends on her farming income to provide for the needs of her family.

Hellen has made a loan request of 62,400 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will enable her to improve her family's standard of living. 

Her biggest challenge in this business has been fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. In the future, she hopes to venture into zero grazing and own high-bred dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abumuhsini

texts.ru: Абдумухсин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 21 год. Женат. Детей не имеет. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для покупки мужской осеней обуви.
texts.en: Abumuhsini lives in  Hamadoni.  He is 21 years old, married, and has no children.  His wife is a housewife.  He trades in the market.  He rents a shop where he sells men's clothes and shoes.  He has been doing this work for three years already.  He is taking out a loan to buy men's shoes for autumn.

loans.use: to buy men's shoes for autumn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and expand horticultural farming

loans.name: Ikromiddin

texts.en:
Ikromiddin is a cattle farmer, continuing his father's business for the past six years. Ikromiddin buys cattle, feeds them over a certain period of time, and sells them at a reasonable price. He would like to request a loan of 5,000 TJS for the purchase of cattle in order to increase the number of his herd and expand his business. 

Ikromiddin is married and is the responsible father of two children. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road as well as the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase the number of his herd and expand his business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer in the Muranga area of central Kenya for over 25 years. He practices mixed farming, producing coffee, milk, horticultural products, and eggs. He is married and is 64 years old.

Joseph has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry. He says increasing the number of birds in his flock will help him achieve economies of scale and significantly improve his family's standard of living. He is hoping to become a major egg distributor in the area.

Joseph says animal diseases and fluctuations in market prices are the primary challenges bedeviling farmers. He adds that Juhudi loans will surely improve farmers' living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex, age 30 and unmarried, is a farmer in his home area of Muranga, central Kenya, producing horticultural products, milk, and coffee.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a motorcycle, which will help him venture into the transport business. He says this will improve his income due to cheaper delivery of his own produce to the market, unlike when transportation is offered by other parties.

Alex says fluctuation in prices remains a challenge to local farmers, and general knowledge in farming remains a challenge.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for better delivery of his produce

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a taxi driver. He is married and has one son. Mahmoud took out a $1,500 loan to cover the insurance and licensing fees for the taxi he drives in the city of Gaza. Mahmoud (who is photographed next to his taxi) took out the loan from FATEN as he couldn't cover the expenses from his income. He can't drive without insurance and licensing, which would cut off the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for taxi insurance and licensing fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hard-working 31-year-old man. He and his wife have a five-year-old child who is enrolled in school. For the past year and a half, he has been providing tailoring services to make ends meet. His alternative source of income comes from working as a matatu driver. Previously, he used to operate a cafeteria. 

Over the next five years, he hopes to own more than one tailoring shop. This goal is in line with his dream to become a major distributor of clothing materials.

He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances well.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, age 47, is a resident of Muranga in central Kenya and has been in farming for over 20 years, producing bananas and milk, which he sells at the local market. He and his wife have three children, all enrolled in school.

Francis has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 53,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy income will enable him to feed his family better and offer them more security, with the extra milk serving as a supplemental meal. Francis focuses on his dream of becoming a recognized breeder in the area and improving his business.

Francis praises Juhudi's loan services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to contruct a modern poultry unit

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman, age 25, works in the manufacture of glass windows, doors, and closets. He has operated his business since 2007 and has eight years of experience in this field. He has built up a good reputation over the years. He started working at the age of 17 in order to help his family to increase their income so as to cover their expenses. Ayman was lucky because his grandmother gave him the shop he's working in as a gift, so it belongs to him now and he does not need to pay rent, which helps in increasing his income. 

Ayman requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new, upgraded machines and tools, since the ones he has currently are old and not suitable for today's designs and requests. In spite of this challenge, he manages to provide all requested work at a high standard.

This is Ayman's third cycle with Al Majmoua. He is a borrower in good standing, and his previous loans have had a positive effect on his family's social and financial situation. He and his wife have one child.

loans.use: to buy new, upgraded machines and tools for his business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 51 years old and married to Fidelis, is the mother of two independent children over the age of 18. The owner and operator of a posho mill business for the past six years, Francisca earns a monthly income of about KES 7,000 which she uses to help support both her business and her family.

Having requested her first loan for KES 20,000 by KADET Ltd., she intends to purchase stocks of maize wheat and millet for sale in the posho mill and plans to use the additional profits to improve her family’s living standard and become financially stable. In the future, Francisca hopes to open another posho mill to serve more people and earn more income

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize, wheat and  millet  for sale.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 31-year-old man. Ismail is married and a father of five children. He lives in Qalqilia city in Palestine. Ismail owns a small grocery store. Ismail wants to expand the grocery store by purchasing a different variety of items from the ones he sells like a better quality coffee, a variety of cheese, etc. 
Ismail, who is photographed here, took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the goods he purchased and attract more clients to increase the store's income.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing grocery store goods.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité D. la ciudad D. Encarnación surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona D. la ciudad, el grupo se encuentra en el noveno ciclo, y cuenta actualmente con 16 integrantes.
Las miembros comentan que se unieron con un fin en común, que es el D. lograr mayores ingresos para cada una, con lo cual pretenden solventar los gastos D. la casa y así poder tener un mejor estilo D. vida.
La Señora Ana, tiene 2 hijos pequeños es soltera, se dedica a la peluquería que tiene en su domicilio. Comenta que por medio D. este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y mantener a sus hijos, sueña con que ellos, algún día, puedan seguir una carrera universitaria y convertirse en personas D. bien.
La Señora Ana solicita el crédito para la compra D. insumos para su peluquería tales como gel, spray, tintes, tijeras y demás. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida ya que la oportunidad que le da la Fundación es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and was started as a result of promotional events that were held in the area.  The group is in its ninth loan cycle and consists of 16 members.

The members say that they joined together for a common purpose, which is to earn more income so that they can cover their household expenses and have a better lifestyle.  

Sra. Ana is single and has two small children.  She operates a beauty salon in her home.  Ana says that through her work she is able to support her children and help them get ahead.  She dreams of seeing them continue to earn a college degree and develop into good people.  

Sra. Ana is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her salon such as gel, hair spray, dyes, scissors, and other items.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya has given because it is very important to her.

loans.use: Compra de gel, spray, tintes, tijeras y demás.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets and construct a unit for housing them

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with three family members. Two of the family members work.

Ahmad has had a barber shop since 2008, where he offers shaving and massage services. He has a lot of experience and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate and change the decoration in his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate and redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 46, is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for 16 years. Her mixed farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables, and bananas, which she sells at the local market. Farming has always been her main source of income. She and her husband have nine children, seven of whom are currently attending school.

Grace has requested a loan of 51,200 Kenyan Shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to buy chickens. She says that the income from these projects will enable her to provide a better livelihood for her family. She cites disease as the primary challenge for her business, as it affects both her dairy cows and her poultry. 

Grace plans to improve her milk production by acquiring high-yielding dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hard working and self determined business lady. She is 37 years old, single and a proud mother of two children aged 20 and 15 years. She has been selling cereals for the last 8 years to provide for family. Previously she used to sell second hand clothes. She wants in the next 5 years to be a whole seller in line with her dream of being a greater distributor of cereals.
She is requesting for a loan of 60000 Kenya shillings to buy a fridge, rice and beans. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learnt how to save and expand her business through easy access of finances.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for educational center furniture and teaching tools

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with seven family members. Four of his family members work.

In 2008, Atheer opened a store selling prayer beads, coffins and funeral supplies. He has a lot of experience in this field and a good reputation.His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to enlarge his store, to make an advertising lighting box and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge his store, to make an advertising light box and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael has operated a poultry business for the past three years, selling poultry at wholesale and retail levels to butcher shop operators and restaurant operators. She dreams of expanding her business in order to raise her family's standard of living. She and her husband own a house that has electricity and piped water. Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. They have six children, one of whom still attends school.  

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
