Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a hardworking 31-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with a 9-year-old child who is in school. To meet the needs of her family, for the last three years she has been operating a boutique. In the next five years, she wants to own rental houses whose proceeds will catapult her forward to meeting her dream of owning a flat.

Maureen is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes for sale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to keep and maintain her business records.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 40 litres of milk as her stock.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with five family members. Three of the family members work. 

Amjad opened a shop in 2009 to decorate wedding cars and to rent audio, video, and projection equipment. He has more than three years experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to make a sliding door and to purchase additional equipment for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to purchase additional equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a single woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: La Fatima Group

texts.es:
La Fatima se forma con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santani, actualmente cuenta con 11 integrantes. Ellas se definen como mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras, todas manifiestan estan muy a gusto trabajando dentro del programa.
Ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y solidaridad. Se unieron con el propósito de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo conjunto realizado por ellas.
La Sra. Maria tiene un almacen hace ya varios años, todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas para abrir su negocio, ya que desde temprano vienen los clientes. Ella manifiesta que gracias a los años que lleva en el negocio, ha logrado tener muchos clientes, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, para el abastecimiento del almacén.
texts.en:
“La Fatima” is the name of a group of several neighbors from the city of Santani. There are currently 11 members. They define themselves as determined and hardworking women. All of them say that they like working with the program. Every one of these members works in a spirit of cooperation and solidarity. They have gathered together with the goal of helping their families through the work they pursue.

Sra. Maria has managed a store for several years. She wakes up very early every day to open her business because she has customers who come early to shop. Maria says that thanks to the many years she has been in business, she has been able to acquire many customers and generate good income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food products, beverages, and vegetables to restock her store.

loans.use: to purchase  food products, beverages, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past 12 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring shops in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widowed woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling firewood, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her livelihood. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a preparatory school, teaching children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by parents with school-going children. She dreams of expanding her school to incorporate other pupils in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase furniture and chalk for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and chalk for her school.

loans.name: Nabatbubu

texts.en:
Nabatbubu lives in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 47 years old, single and has four children. She works at the registration office in her local area. 

After the breakdown of the Soviet Union, in order to support her family, Nabatbubu began her business of cattle breeding and farming. She rented land near her village where her family started to cultivate potatoes and beans. In addition, she gained a good income from selling milk products at the local market. Thanks to her persistent work, Nabatbubu managed to expand her business and still is eager to develop her farm. For this reason, Nabatbubu plans to use the loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer to manure her land and one more heifer. With the revenue from this investment, Nabatbubu plans further development of her farm in order to make it a successful family business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cattle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, he has operated a meat goat business, selling wholesale and from home to his neighbours. He also owns a motorcycle used for transportation which contributes to his other source of income. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase meat goat for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase meat goat for sale.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a textile industry in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth materials and threads

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
Owen is 31 years old and married to Joyce. They have two children aged five years, and two months. He has been operating his house furnishing business for the past 11 years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 108,000, which he uses to take care of his business and family.

This is his fourth loan. He has been loaned KES 70,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use this loan to purchase stock like materials for making duvets, curtains and bed covers. He plans to use the profit from his business to build a family home.

In the future, he hopes to enlarge his business with stock worth over KES.500,000 and to employ over five people, thus creating job opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making duvets, curtains and bed covers

loans.name: Njiwa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sifa , leader du groupe d’affaire « Njiwa », est entrepreneur, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des souliers. Son mari est aussi petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de  CADECO- Ville.Il y a 8 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette petite activité génératrice de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 pairs de souliers à marchander. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  acheter une parcelle personnelle qu’elle offrira à ses parents biologiques. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Njiwa » est de 16 femmes.Néanmoins, derrière la photo, on retrouve 2 figures en distance, qui se sont improvises dans le camera.
texts.en:
Sifa, the leader of the Njiwa business group, is an entrepreneur, aged 34, married and the mother of seven children, all attending school. She sells shoes. Her husband is also a small merchant; he sells various products. Sifa offers her products for sale at the Cadeco municipal market. She has been busy in this small income-generating activity for the past eight years. In the meantime, she was granted nine loan cycles by the microfinance institution Hekima. This new loan will help her to purchase 15 pairs of shoes for resale. In addition, her aim is to provide full schooling to her children and buy a plot of land that she wants to donate to her parents. Sifa thanks Hekima for their efforts in favor of poor women excluded from the classical banking system.

It should be mentioned that Njiwa Group is composed of 16 women. However, two people pictured behind the group do not belong to it; they simply happened to appear in front of the camera.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dalu

texts.en:
Dalu is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He also operates a boda boda (motorcycle) business, which contributes to his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his business. Dalu dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and spare parts for his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raul trabaja como portero de lunes a viernes en una iglesia de la ciudad  y también se dedica a la venta de libros tanto usados como nuevos. El crédito lo requiere para cancelar los impuestos de la casa de sus padres y de esta manera ayudarles. Vive en la casa de sus padres  misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos anteriores que se le otorgaron, pues así pudo afianzar más su negocio de venta de libros.
texts.en: Raul works from Monday to Friday as a caretaker in a church in the city.  He also sells new and used books.  He needs this loan to pay the taxes on his parents' house and help them in this way.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in the Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  Raul is single and doesn't have any children.  He has been very happy with the previous loans that he has received as they helped him to further strengthen his book sales business.

loans.use: to pay annual taxes on his parents' house

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Primavera nace gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros que organizó a sus vecinas y amigas con la idea de producir un bien para ellas, dándoles una visión de que a través del comité estarían alcanzando el progreso de cada una. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 12 miembros, donde todas trabajan muy unidas y de esa forma les es más fácil cumplir con sus obligaciones. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando para salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad.
La Señora Agustina se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropas, hace un buen tiempo que lo hace por lo que ya tiene un grupo de clientas y clientes bien definido, que siempre compran de ella sus productos. Ella por medio de este trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y puede solventar los gastos que surgen en la casa. Sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde vender sus ropas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de estación con lo que podrá actualizar su stock de mercaderías y también cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Tiene las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This committee called “Primavera” (Spring) was started thanks to one of its members who organized her neighbors and friends with the idea of doing something good for them.  She had the vision of a committee that would help each member make progress.  The group currently has 12 members and all of them work very close with one another, which makes it easier for them to meet their obligations.  All of them strive to move forward in search of success for themselves and their communities.  

Sra. Agustina sells all types of clothing.  She enjoys what she does because she already has a group of customers who always buy merchandise from her.  Through her work, Agustina has been able to get ahead and cover the expenses accumulated by her household.  

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing so that she can keep her inventory stocked.  Agustina hopes this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: Compra de ropas de estación, para la posterior venta

loans.name: Jeanine Adolphine

texts.fr:
Femme mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 25 ans. Elle est dans le commerce du poisson salé dans un marché depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de vente poisson salé en gros, elle le revend en détail sur une table. Ses recettes journalières sont comprises entre 20.000F et 30.000F, elle joue sur les prix au rabais pour satisfaire les clients à revenus moyens.

Avec le prêt qu’elle va avoir, elle va renforcer son stock de poisson salé en achetant : 3 cartons de morue,  2cartons de poissons soles,  4cartons de thon.
Ce stock lui permettra d’attirer plus de clients, de vendre beaucoup afin d’augmenter ses revenus. 

Ses objectifs sont : acheter au moins 10cartons en stock, faire du poisson localement, fournir sa marchandise dans les grands restaurant de la place. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle contribue à l’éducation de ses enfants en aidant son époux dans la gestion du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a married woman, 45 years old, and the mother of two children, aged 17 and 25. Her business has involved salted fish at the market for ten years. She gets her supplies from warehouses selling salted fish wholesale. She resells the fish retail from a table. Her daily receipts range from 20,000 to 30,000 francs. She offers cut rates to satisfy middle-income customers. 

With the loan she will obtain, she is going to bolster her stock of salted fish by buying: 3 boxes of cod, 2 boxes of sole, and 4 boxes of tuna. This stock will enable her to attract more customers and to sell a lot in order to increase her revenues. 

Her goals are: to buy at least 10 boxes of inventory, to deal in local fish, and to provide her goods to large restaurants in the area. Like a good mother, she contributes to her children's education by helping her husband to run the household.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cod and salted fish

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 32 years old and married to Stanley, who is a driver. They have two children. She has been running her salon business for seven years. Her monthly income is 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses in her business and for personal use.

She has been loaned KES 60,000 by KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the loan to purchase cosmetics and beauty products for use in the salon and for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business by establishing a modern salon.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty products for use in the salon and for sale.

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: La cliente K., leader du groupe d’affaire « Sheria », est entrepreneur, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous et 4 autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  vendeuse de farines de manioc.  Son mari est un gardien (sentinelle) auprès d’une entreprise privée. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal de  Nyabushongo.  Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  17 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 sacs de farines de manioc à marchander et le reste d’argent sera affecté à son projet de construction de sa maison.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  construire une maison confortablement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Sheria » est 14 femmes. Néanmoins, 2 autres collègues du marché nyabushongo se sont improvisées sur la photo du groupe , d’où 16 figures visibles.
texts.en: K., an entrepreneur, is the leader of the "Sheria" business group.  She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 10 children who are all in school and 4 others who already have their own homes.  She sells manioc flour.  Her husband is a guard (sentry) at a private enterprise.  She sets up her merchandise at the Nyabushongo communal market.  She has been operating this small business for 10 years.  Meanwhile, she has completed 17 loan cycles with Hekima.  This new loan will enable her to stock up with 3 bags of manioc flour to sell and the remainder of the money will be used for building her house.  In addition, her goal is to educate her children and to build a comfortable home. She thanks Hekima for its actions in support of poor women excluded from traditional banks.  It is fitting to mention that there are 13 women in the "Sheria" business group.  There are 3 other colleagues from the Nyabushongo market included in the group photograph, where 16 people are visible.

loans.use: 3 bags of manioc flour and funds for her housing project.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, where he makes a living as a painter at an auto body shop. He has held this job for the last five years. 

Hector is requesting a 22,000 HNL loan to purchase cement, sand, gravel, doors, and tiles to finish construction on an additional bedroom in his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, doors, and tiles

loans.name: Christa Eric

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante de 31 ans, mariée avec 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 6 à 10 ans, ayant arrête ses études très jeune par manque de soutien elle se lance en 2001 dans la vente de friperie avec une somme 80.000frs et s’approvisionne auprès des demi-grossistes. Ses recettes journalières sont d'environ 30000 à 100000 f par jour.

Si le prêt lui est donne elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant des ballots de vêtements pour enfants et adultes, afin d’avoir une capacité de s’approvisionner deux fois le mois. 

Pour la croissance de son activité, elle profite des périodes de vacances pour vendre plus, et choisit des ballots de qualité  pour intéresser ses clients; malgré les difficultés elle tient bon pour bien gérer son commerce, puisque cela l'aide a prendre soin de sa famille.


A la longue elle est aimerait devenir une vendeuse stable afin de s’approvisionner en gros auprès grossistes.
texts.en:
At 31 years old, she is a female shopkeeper, married, and has two children aged six and ten. After stopping her studies at a very young age for lack of support, she started selling second-hand clothes in 2001 with an initial investment of 80,000 XAF. She gets her supplies from semi-wholesalers. Her daily sales vary between 30,000 and 100,000 XAF.

If her loan is granted, she is planning on strengthening her activity by purchasing bundles of clothes for children and adults, in order to gain the ability to stock up twice a month.

To grow her business, she takes advantage of holidays to sell more, and selects quality bundles to appeal to customers. She remains strong to manage her business in the face of difficulties, since it helps her to take care of her family.

In the long term, she would like to stabilize her sales to be able to gets her supplies in bulk from wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes, polo shirts, tops, baby clothes.

loans.name: Sagynbubu

texts.en:
Sagynbubu is 54 and widowed. She lives with the family of her son and brings up two grandchildren. 

In order to add to their income, Sagynbubu’s family is engaged in cattle breeding. They started this activity with initial capital of 5,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) and now they have a farm with three milk cows and two heifers. In the summer season, they pasture their cattle in the mountainous areas with different types of herbal forage. 

Sagynbubu has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cattle, which will allow her to increase milk-product sales. Sagynbubu’s family is very tight-knit and makes every effort to make their dreams of a prosperous future come true. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sop Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Dabakh est créé le 28 décembre 2010. Il est constitué de seize femmes qui ont des liens de parenté et de cousinage et habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activités principales,le petit commerce, l’élevage et la transformation d'huile d'arachide.

La responsable madame Ndéye est âgée de 42 ans;mariée, elle est mère de huit enfants et a la charge de deux autres une fille et un garçon; elle mène une activité de transformation artisanale d'huile d'arachide et a une bonne expérience. Elle est debout à droite à l'extrême, teint clair et a levé la main gauche.

Elle s'approvisionne en arachides dans les marchés hebdomadaires, fait la transformation et vend l'huile et le tourteau dans le village. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter beaucoup d'arachide à stocker pour la transformation et ainsi avoir une bonne quantité à revendre.

Elle aide son mari pour la nourriture et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Dabakh solidarity group was created on 28 December 2010. It comprises 16 women who are linked through familial relations and live in the same town. Their main activities include running small retail businesses, raising livestock, and preparing peanut oil.

The group leaD., Ms. Ndéye, is 42 years old and married. She is the mother of eight children and has two additional children - one girl and one boy - in her care. She runs a business preparing handmade peanut oil and has solid experience in this field. She is standing all the way on the right in the photo, in the light clothing with her left hand raised.

She gets her supplies of peanuts at the weekly market days, and processes and sells the oil and oil cake in town.

Her loan will allow her to buy lots of peanuts to stock and process, thus ensuring she has a large quantity to sell.

She helps her husband take care of the children's food and health needs.

loans.use: To buy peanuts to make peanut oil for sale.

loans.name: Amelie Clementine

texts.fr:
Femme commerçante 44 ans,mariee et  mère d’un enfant âgé  de 20 ans et à trois personnes à sa charge. Après son BEPC, elle s'est lancée dans la friperie il y a 10 ans de cela, elle s'approvisionne dans les grands dépôts de la place, et ses recettes varient entre 20000 à 50000f le jour.

Des qu'elle va recevoir son prêt elle compte acheter un nouveau ballot de friperie telle que les ballots de vêtement pour enfant tel que jeans, body, culottes et marinieres.

Usant de beaucoup de stratégies pour accroitre son activité elle épargne aussi et est très méticuleuse dans la gestion et sait convaincre les clients pour apprécier ses marchandises.

A la longue elle aimerait etre une femme capable en affaire et être grossiste des ballots de friperies ainsi que d'acquérir une capacité financière en epargnant afin de changer le mode de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman, a merchant, is a 44-year-old married mother of one child aged 20, and has three people in her care. After her BEPC (secondary school certification), she began selling second-hand clothing business 10 years ago. She gets her supplies at the large stores in the area, and her income varies between 20,000 and 50,000 F per day.

After receiving her loan, she intends to buy a new bundle of second-hand clothing, which would include bundles of children's clothing such as jeans, onesies, pants, and smocks.

Having used many strategies to enlarge her business, she also saves and is very meticulous in her management and knows how to get her customers to appreciate her merchandise.

In the long term, she would like to be a successful businesswoman and to be a wholesaler of bundles of second-hand clothing, thereby having enough financial savings to improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy bundles of children's clothing, jeans, onesies, and pants.

loans.name: Namasuba Women's Development Initiative Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Fatumah has been selling electronic goods for five years now in Kampala. The single mother of one says she began this business under the financial auspices of her close friends and relatives. 

At her shop, she sells a variety of electronic goods such as kettles, DVD players, iron boxes, bulbs, etc. She says this business generates her sales revenue totaling 50,000 Ugandan shillings weekly. She says she is to utilize this Kiva loan money to purchase more electronic goods such as electric kettles, bulbs, iron boxes, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic goods such as electric kettles, bulbs, iron boxes, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras se llama el comité formado por 17 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, el cual actualmente se encuentra en su ciclo número doce. Este comité se forma gracias a que mujeres de otro comité de la misma ciudad instaron a sus vecinas a formar su propio comité para ellas también puedan invertir en actividades que les genere buenos ingresos.
La Sra. Mirna se dedica a la venta de bebidas, por medio de esto logra solventar los gastos que implica la manutención de una casa. Ella ha logrado hacerse conocida en el barrio, por lo que ya tiene muchos clientes. Comenta que es en los fines de semana cuando mas demanda tiene, por eso le gustaría poder aumentar su stock. Sueña con poder, algún día, agrandar su negocio para tener mas espacio donde almacenar sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, whiskys, energizantes, vinos y demás para la posterior venta.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Luchadoras” (Women Fighters) is the name of this group that consists of 17 women from the city of Luque. They are currently in their 12th loan cycle. This committee was formed as a result of another committee from the same city who urged their neighbors to form their own committee so that they could invest in their businesses and generate good income.

Sra. Mirna sells beverages in order to cover the expenses related to maintaining her household. She has become well-known in the neighborhood since she already has many customers. Mirna says that she has more demand on the weekends, which is why she would like to increase her inventory. She dreams of someday expanding her business so that she will have more space to store her merchandise.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beer, whisky, energy drinks, wine, and other beverages for eventual resale.

loans.use: to purchase beer, whisky, energy drinks, wine, and other beverages.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José, tiene 37 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su familia, él posee un taller y venta de bicicletas, tiene 10 años de haber iniciado el negocio, cuenta con experiencia pues este negocio lo heredo de su padre, quien le enseño todo el proceso sobre la reparación de bicicletas.
Actualmente necesita de financiamiento para comprar herramientas y repuestos para el taller, ya que necesita llaves, sierras, frenos, pedales, llantas, rayos, entre otros más que ofrece a los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el taller y estar más competente.
Su aspiración es ofrecer a su familia una condición de vida más estable, tener mayores comodidades a través del negocio, por tal motivo se esfuerza por mantener surtido el taller.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He has his own house here he lives with his family. He has a workshop and bicycle shop. He started the business 10 years ago and has experience because he inherited the business from his father, who taught him all about repairing bicycles.  

At present, he needs a loan to buy tools and replacement parts for the workshop. He needs wrenches, saws, brakes, pedals, wheels and spokes, among other things that he offers his customers. This loan will help his strengthen the workshop and be more competent.  

His aspirations are to offer his family more stable living conditions, and to have a more comfortable workplace. That is why he is working to keep his workshop supplied.

loans.use: to buy tools and replacement parts for his workshop, since he needs wrenches, saws, brakes, pedals, wheels and spokes.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Las Perlas entrando a su novena  secuencia conformado por 10 integrantes que viven en la zona de la guardia,  cuentan con negocio y actividad propios. La Presidenta es la Sra. María de  edad de 28 años oriunda Santa Cruz de la Sierra  vive en la zona de la Guardia hace 11 años.           Su Actividad es la venta de refrigerio, desayunos y almuerzos  en domicilio propio desde hace 5 años, le va muy bien en su actividad, la Sra. María ya tiene muchos clientes, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. comprara abarrotes e insumos para la elaboración de sus refrigerios, ya que desea comprar algunas cosas por cantidad, ella no esta casada pero convive con el   sr. Gustavo quien a veces le ayuda con la venta de refrigerio y tienen 1 hijos pequeño, la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The 'Las Perlas' community bank is entering its ninth loan cycle.  The group has 10 members who all live in La Guardia neighborhood.  They all have their own businesses and business activities.

The group's president is María.  She is 28 years old and comes from Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  She has lived in La Guardia neighborhood for 11 years.  Her business is selling light refreshments, breakfasts and lunches from her home.  She has been doing this for five years and her business is doing very well.  María has a lot of customers and she will use her loan money to buy groceries and supplies for making her snacks as she would like to buy some things in bulk.  María isn't married but she lives with Gustavo who sometimes helps her to sell her food.  The couple have a young son.

María is a very hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy groceries and supplies for making snacks

loans.name: Lima Roselyne

texts.fr:
Célibataire, mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge est varie  entre 8 et 14 ans.
Depuis 2ans, elle s’approvisionne à Kinshasa en bijoux pacotilles qu’elle revend au marché sur un étalage. Elle maitrise la qualité et les modèles actuels pour satisfaire la demande de ses clientes, elle vend par jour 20.000F et pendant les périodes de fêtes, elle atteint 50.000F.

Avec le prêt, elle va acheter : les parures pour les cérémonies, les ensembles colliers-boucles d’oreilles-bracelets-bagues, vernis à ongle.

Son but est d’acheter beaucoup  pour être une fournisseuse  auprès des revendeurs.
texts.en:
This woman is an unmarried mother of three children whose ages vary between 8 and 14.

For 2 years, she has been getting supplies of costume jewelry from Kinshasa and re-selling them at a stand in the market. She has mastered the process of selecting the quality and current styles that her customers are looking for. She sells 20,000 F worth of jewelry per day, and during the festival season she reaches up to 50,000 F.

With this loan, she is going to buy ceremonial jewelry, sets of necklaces-earrings-bracelets-rings, and nail polish.

Her goal is to buy in large quantities in order to be a supplier to retailers.

loans.use: To buy ceremonial jewelry, rings, earrings, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Zhanylbubu

texts.en:
Zhanylbubu is 62 years old. She worked as a milkmaid at the local farm for 30 years and is known as a hard-working person. 

To find means of subsistence for her family, Zhanylbubu began her business in cattle breeding and land cultivating. Owing to her wide experience in these activities, she managed to develop her farm successfully. Currently, she grows barley and clover and has six sheep, four goats and cows on her farm. She sells milk to the local dairy farm. 

With the revenue from these activities, Zhanylbubu was able to provide her children with the essentials. Now Zhanylbubu plans to use this loan for 35,000 KGS to purchase one more milk cow to raise her sales of milk. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to make renovations on her house.
 
In the future, Zhanylbubu plans to maintain a big farm with a large number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena, tiene tres hijos, vive con ellos y poseen casa propia, ella tiene un negocio D. verduras y también realiza cultivos agrícolas, aunque debe emplear a jornaleros para que realicen las labores pues es trabajo pesado.
Actualmente está realizando la siembra D. maíz, y se ve en la necesidad D. solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. abono e insecticidas, también pago D. jornaleros, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar el cultivo consumiendo parte D. la producción y comercializar otra parte D. esta.
Magdalena aspira con el cultivo, tener una buena plantación, que su cosecha sea abundante para la alimentación D. su familia y también le genere mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Magdalena lives with her three children in their own house. She has a business selling vegetables and also grows crops, although she does employ casual labourers to undertake the heavy work. At present she is sowing maize, and sees it necessary to seek a loan for the purchase of fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay the labourers. This loan will help her to produce the crop, part of which will be consumed and the rest sold. Magdalena hopes for a productive plantation, and that the harvest will be plenty to feed her family and also to generate a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for growing maize.

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es: El señor Pacifico nacido en Valle grande vive con doña Felicita no tiene hijos, el tiene su casa en la Guardia tiene su tierra en Quebrada Portuque a 4 km de la Guardia, el trabaja en la agricultura, siembra yuca, maíz tiene cítricos pero también se dedica a la crianza y ventas de chanchos, el destino del crédito es para siembra de yuca, y también para la compra de Chancos pequeños, el es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia, su deseo es pronto tener hijos para así completar su familia,  se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. en la foto el Sr. Pacifico se encuentra en compañia de su pareja.
texts.en: Señor Pacifico was born in Valle Grande. He lives with Doña Felicita, and has no children. His house is in La Guardia, and his land is 4kn away in Quebrada Portuque. He works in agriculture, sowing yucca and maize. He also has citrus trees. He dedicates much of his time to raising and selling pigs. The loan is intended for planting yucca and for the purchase of piglets. He is a very hard-working person, always thinking of his family's well-being. He would like to have children soon to make his family complete. He is grateful to the institution for the support offered. In the photo you can see Señor Pacifico with his partner.

loans.use: To plant yucca and buy pigs.

loans.name: Jesus El Salvador Group

texts.es:
“Jesús el Salvador” es una Alcancía Comunal Nueva que está conformada por 07 personas entusiasta y comprometidas a trabajar bien con el Programa.
Zoraida tiene 37 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y  2 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando junto a su conyugue en sus estudios. Zoraida nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace más de tres años, pero también vende ropa la cual trabaja con pedidos que le hacen sus familiares y conocidos de su zona. Es así como Zoraida a podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y mejorar su vivienda. A futuro a Zoraida le gustaría poner una bodega en su vivienda donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad y así tener más ganancias y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de ropa como pantalón, chompa, chalinas, polos. La Alcancía Comunal “Jesús el Salvador” agradece la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
“Jesús el Salvador” (Jesus the Saviour) is a new communal bank consisting of 7 enthusiastic people who are committed to wrking with the Programme. 

Zoraida is 37 years old. Her family consists of herself, her husband and their two children, whom she and her husband continue to support through their education. Zoraida recounts how she has dedicated herself to the sale of beauty products for the past 3 years, but she also sells clothing, for which she takes orders from her friends and acquaintances in the area. In this way Zoraida has been able to help her husband with the household exprenses and improvements to their home. In future, Zoraida would like to open up a store in their home, where she could sell basic groceries and thus have more income and offer her family a better life. With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in the purchase of clothing, such as trousers, sweaters, scarves and polo shirts.  

The members of the “Jesús el Salvador” communal bank are grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza, tiene 71 años. Su negocio es una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como azúcar, cereales, leche, carnes y cerveza.
Gracias a FINCA Perú, Juana se ha independizado y ya no depende de su esposo financieramente. Hace más o menos 4 años que Juana se hizo socia de FINCA Perú, y lo que le gusta más es el hecho de que ha aprendido a trabajar mejor.  FINCA Perú le ha enseñado como hablarle y tratar a los clientes y los mejores métodos de producción. Juana trabaja desde muy joven, pero no fue hasta hacerse socia de FINCA Peru que pudo agrandar su tienda. Ella dice que ahora su esposo trabaja más duro que ella, pero ella hace más dinero.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Bonanza" communal bank. She is 71 years old. Her business is a grocery store, in which she sells all kinds of products, such as sugar, cereals, milk, meat and beer.

Thanks to [the field partner] FINCA Perú, Juana has made herself independent, and no longer depends financially on her husband. For the past 4 years or so, Juana has been a member of FINCA Perú, and what she likes best about it is that she has learned to work more effectively. FINCA Perú has taught her how to speak to people and how to treat customers, and the best ways of working. Juana has worked since she was very young, but it was not until she became aa member of FINCA Perú that she was able to expand her shop. She says that now her husband works harder than she does, but that she makes more money.

loans.use: compra de productos al por mayor

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Angel de 42 años de edad, esta casado hace 21 años con la señora Eliodora de 46 años de edad; y tienen tres hijas, una de 20, la otra de 12 y 9 años, la mayor se encuentra trabajando en el exterior y las otras estan cursando el 7mo. Y 4to grado.
El Sr. Angel se dedica al transporte de pasajero desde el año 2004, desde joven contaba con vehiculo de carga que utilizaba para transportes en general, ya sea de verduras, frutas y servicios, de fletes, como este trabajo es muy cansador por el trayecto largo que tenia que realizar, cambió su vehículo e hizo trabajar como colectivo interno de la ciudad de Caaguazu, donde el trabajo se volvió menos agotador.
El cliente solicita este préstamo para la compra de cubiertas nuevas y con lo que podrá ofrecerle seguridad a los pasajeros.
texts.en:
Sr. Angel is 42 years old and has been married for 21 years to Sra. Eliodora, age 46. They have three daughters (ages 20, 12, and 9). The eldest daughter is working abroad and the other two are in the 7th and 4th grades respectively.

Sr. Angel has been transporting passengers since 2004. As a young man, he obtained a vehicle for general transportation, whether it was carrying vegetables, fruit, people, or freight. Making repeated long trips was very tiring, so he replaced his vehicle and started working as part of a collective within the city of Caaguazu, which is less stressful.

Angel is requesting this loan in order to buy new tires, which will provide safety for his passengers.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: Damiana tiene 76 años, es viuda, y sus 6 hijos le han dado 26 nietos. Su negocio es la venta de quesos.  Ella compra y le distribuye quesos a las chacras.  Y a veces ella vende leche fresca y mazamorra desde su propio hogar.  Antes Damiana trabajaba vendiendo carne, pero con la edad se le hizo más difícil, y decidió cambiar a la venta de quesos.  Ahora ella está sufriendo de algunos problemas de la salud, y va a utilizar sus ahorros para ver a un médico. Sufre de inflamación de los riñones, y dice que a causa de eso le duele caminar.  De todas maneras Damiana tiene mucha fe en Jesús Cristo, ella dice que el cura sus problemas.  Hace más de 4 años que ella es socia de FINCA Perú, y dice que lo que más le gusta son los ahorros, con los cuales pudo construir un baño y una ducha para su casa.
texts.en: Damiana is 76 years old. She is a widow, and her 6 children have given her 26 grandchildren. Her business is selling cheeses. She buys cheeses from local farms and distributes them. Sometimes she also sells fresh milk and mazamorra (a type of dough) from her own home. Previously, Damiana worked selling meat, but with age she began to find this more difficult, and decided to change to selling cheese. Now she is suffering from various health problems, and is going to use her savings to see a doctor. She is suffering inflamation of the kidneys, and says this makes walking painful. Nonetheless, Damiana has great faith in Jesus Christ, and believes he will cure her. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than 4 years, and says that what she likes best about it is being able to save: with the savings she has been able to add a bathroom and shower to her home.

loans.use: To buy the goods she needs for making cheeses.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: El señor Orlando, oriundo de Jorochito de Santa Cruz, no es casado pero tiene su pareja, tiene un solo hijo, su actividad es de draguero, saca del rio arena y piedra, para luego vender a las personas que venden material de construcción, su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que necesita de todas sus fuerzas, el sr. Orlando ahora el quiere incursionar en otro negocio para esto esta solicitando el  crédito para la compra de Patos y poder tener una granja de patos,   esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder invertir en otro negocio que es en la crianza de patos obteniendo así otra fuente de ingreso y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is from Jorochito, in Santa Cruz.  He is not married but lives with his partner and has one child.  He works as a 'dredger', removing sand and stone from the river to then sell to people who sell construction supplies.  His work is very demanding as he needs all his strength.

Orlando would like to make inroads into another business.  For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy ducks and set up a duck farm.  He is grateful to our institution for having placed our trust in him and given him the support he needs to invest in another business (raising ducks).  This will be another source of income for him and will provide him with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in a duck farm

loans.name: And Ngir Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Ngir Yalla est créé le 1er juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois Gad Demba Peulh, il est constitué de dix sept femmes qui sont parentes et voisines et qui habitent le même village;les principales activités qu'elles mènent sont l'agriculture, l'élevage et le petit commerce.


Madame Khady la responsable est âgée de 64 ans, mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle a une orpheline en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits divers et fait en même temps de l'embouche ovine. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou bleu et couverte d'un châle beige.


Elle achéte ses produits pour son petit commerce dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans le village.



Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter deux moutons qu'elle va revendre après 4 mois d'embouche pour rembourser son prêt.


Elle envisage de venir en aide ses enfants avec les bénéfices attendus, mais aussi épargner.
texts.en:
The And Ngir Yalla solidarity group was created on 1 July 2011, the day the Gad Demba Peulh Village Loan Fund was established. It comprises 17 women who are linked through familial and neighbourhood relations and live in the same town; their main activities are farming, animal rearing, and small retail businesses.

Ms. Khady, the group leader, is a 64-year-old married mother of four, and also has one orphan girl in her care; she runs a small retail business selling various items and raises sheep at the same time. She is standing on the right in the photo, dressed in a blue boubou with a beige shawl.

She buys her products at the weekly market days and re-sells them in town.

This loan will allow her to buy two sheep that she is going to re-sell after raising for 4 months, thus helping her repay her loan.

She foresees using the profits both to care for her children and to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and re-sell.

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member who is an orphan.      

Adella  has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works six days out of every week. Adella sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.   

Adella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenges for Adella include defaulters and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build more rental rooms.  

Adella lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Poetas Group

texts.es:
La señora Irma es parte del grupo Poetas, ellos comentan que le pusieron así a su grupo por que la colonia donde se reunirán se llama así, y por eso decidieron ponerle ese nombre. Dona Irma tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella, comenta que tiene una refaccionaría desde hace 19 años, su esposo y ella la atienden dice que ese negocio su suegro se los heredo. Esta pidiendo un crédito para invertirle a su negocio, ella vende refacciones para carro, aceites, un poco de llantas, bujías, partes de vehículos etc. Ella y su esposo llamado Noe salen cada mes a la cuidades de Querétaro y México a surtir las refacciones que le hacen falta y tienen varios distribuidores que les  surten de lo que necesitan en el negocio. La meta de la señora Irma es darles una carrera a sus hijos y poner otra refaccionaría en otra población para así tener un poco mas de ganancias. Doña Irma esta muy contenta por que dice que gracias a los préstamos que le ha hecho la financiera su negocio a crecido.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Petra, Ernesto, Guadalupe, Maria Luisa, Celia, Teresa, Maria del Rosario, Eduardo, Maria Remedios y Beatriz ellos usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios de venta de colchas por catalogo, panadería, jugos y licuados, antojitos mexicanos, zapatos y cosméticos por catalogo, refaccionaría, frutas y legumbres, abarrotes y en una peluquería.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Poetas group.  The members of the group tell us that they chose this name because it is the name of the area where they meet.

Irma is 42 years old and has three dependent children.  She tells us that she has owned an auto parts store for 19 years.  She and her husband both work there.  She says that they inherited the business from her father-in-law.

Irma is requesting a loan to invest in her business.  She sells car parts, oil, some tires, spark plugs, spare parts, etc.  She and her husband Noe visit the the city of Querétaro and Mexico City every month to stock up with the spare parts that they lack.  They have several suppliers who provide them with what they need for their business.  Irma's goal is to provide her children with a career and to open another auto parts store in another town so that she can make a little more profit.  Irma is very happy because she says that her business has grown thanks to loans from our financial institution.

The other members of the group are Petra, Ernesto, Guadalupe, María Luisa, Celia, Teresa, María del Rosario, Eduardo, María Remedios and Beatriz.  They will use their loans to invest in their businesses selling bedspreads through a catalog, running a bakery, selling juices and smoothies, selling Mexican snacks, selling shoes and cosmetics through catalogs, selling car parts, selling fruit and vegetables, selling groceries and running a hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy car parts

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Nuru has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Nuru sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Nuru has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Nuru include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to sell on a wholesale basis.   

Nuru lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy responsable en su casa con las labores del hogar, tiene 2 hijos pequeños un niño estudiante de primaria de 8 años de edad y una niña de 6 años que pronto entrara en la primaria. Doña Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de jugos y licuados afuera de una escuela, tiene con esa actividad aproximadamente 7 años, dice que emprendieron ella y su esposo este negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que los dos tenían trabajos estables y desgraciadamente hubo recorte de personal y tuvieron que abrir un negocio por desempleo. Ella también se dedica a vender dulces los compra en la ciudad de Toluca ya que allá le dan un buen precio y surte a diferentes tiendas de su población en una camioneta. Ella esta muy contenta por el préstamo que le esta otorgando la financiera por que gracias al crédito ella podrá comprar un poco mas de dulces de diferentes variedades y podrá surtir mejor a sus clientes y surtira mejor su puesto de jugos y licuados. La meta que tiene doña Eli como es conocida en su población es poner una dulcería grande pero primero ella quiere hacer un ahorro para hacer un local y poner la dulcería. Elizabeth pertenece a un grupo llamado "Abejitas Trabajadoras" que pidieron un préstamos a Fundación Realidad ñpara impulsar sus negocios.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Gloria, Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, Maria de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa ellos usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios como en un taller de costura, mueblería, bordado de prendas artesanales, taller de manualidades, panadería, tienda de ropa y antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a very hard-working woman who does her household chores very responsibly.  She has two young children: an 8 year-old boy who is in elementary school and a 6 year-old girl who will start elementary school soon.

Elizabeth's business is selling juice and smoothies outside a school.  She has been in this business for approximately seven years.  She says that she and her husband started the business so that they could get their children ahead in life.  They both used to have stable jobs but, unfortunately, the company made staff cuts and they had to open a business as they found themselves unemployed.  Elizabeth also sells sweet treats which she buys in the city of Toluca as she receives them for a good price there.  She supplies the stores in her town in a pickup truck.  She is very happy to be receiving this loan from our financial institution because, with the loan, she will be able to buy a few more, different sweet treats and will be able to better supply her customers.  She will also be able to better stock her juice and smoothie stall.

The goal that Eli, as she is known in her town, has is to set up a large candy store but first she would like to make some savings so that she can build premises and set up her store.  Elizabeth belongs to a group called 'Abejitas Trabajadoras' (Hard-Working Little Bees).  They requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to boost their businesses.  The other members of the group are Gloria, Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana and Teresa.  They will use their loans to invest in their businesses which include a sewing workshop, a furniture store, embroidering garments, a craft workshop, a bakery, a clothes store and selling Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats and to buy fruit for her juice stall

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco comunal Siempre Viva, tiene 53 años y vive con su esposo, el menor de sus 5 hijos obtendrá su título en ingeniería civil a fines de este año. Rosa solicita un préstamo para su negocio de productos naturales. Rosa vende de casa a casa y tiene clientes en varias oficinas. Ella lleva tres años en este negocio. Al comienzo su esposo no quería que trabajara independientemente, pero ahora ya esta conforme con la idea.  Rosa lleva dos años en FINCA Peru y lo que mas le gusta es la responsabilidad y la confianza de la organización.  Desde que esta con FINCA Peru ella es una persona mas extrovertida e independiente. Rosa está ahorrando para poder alquilar una tienda y vender desde una oficina, en vez de cliente a cliente.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Siempre Viva" community bank.  She is 53 years old and lives with her husband.  The youngest of her five children will receive his degree in civil engineering at the end of this year.  Rosa is requesting a loan for her natural products business.  She makes her sales door to door and also has customers in several offices.  She has been in this business for three years.

At first, Rosa's husband didn't want her to work independently but now he is happy with the idea.  Rosa has been with FINCA Peru for two years and what she most likes is the responsibility and the trust of the organization.  Since she has been with FINCA Peru, Rosa has become a more extroverted and independent person.  She is saving up to rent a store so that she can sell from an office instead of having to sell from customer to customer.

loans.use: to buy natural products wholesale

loans.name: Cesar Anibal

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar  es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 12, 09, 07 años de edad, su esposa labora como empleada del hogar; Cesar se dedica a brindar servicio de  transporte por todo el cercado de la ciudad en una moto taxi alquilada, tanto Cesar como su esposa  trabajan para sacar adelante a su familia, los desafíos  que enfrenta Cesar es el frío ya que trabaja hasta altas horas de noche y brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación, los sueños de Cesar es comprarse su propia moto taxi para hacer crecer su negocio y darles estudios superiores a todos sus hijos; Cesar está muy agradecido por haberle brindado el crédito.
texts.en: Cesar is married and has four children aged 16, 12, 9 and 7.  His wife works as a domestic employee.  Cesar provides a transport service around the city in a rented motorcycle taxi.  Both Cesar and his wife work in order to get their family ahead in life.  The challenges that Cesar faces are the cold, as he works until very late at night, and providing his children with the best education.  Cesar's dreams are to buy his own motorcycle taxi in order to grow his business and to provide all his children with a higher education.  Cesar is very grateful that he has been given a loan.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: La señora Giovana dedicada a la elaboración y venta  de comida esto ya hace un tiempo atrás junto a su pequeño en brazos ella durante todos los días debe de cocinar para vender y los platos para el almuerzo que los clientes vienen a degustar a medio día, la señora debe de trabajar muy dura ya que es madre soltera y ella debe de cubrir todos los gastos para mantener a su pequeño bebe pero con esfuerzo y empeño ella desea tener un a pensión mucho mas grande y así salir adelante, mejorando su calidad de vida, la Sra. Giovana, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz, harina y papa para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy dinámica agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Giovana has been making and selling food for some time.  With her little one in her arms, every day she must cook and sell lunches to her customers who come to eat at midday.  She must work very hard as she is a single mother and must cover all the expenses involved in supporting her small baby.  With effort and hard work, she would like to own a much bigger restaurant so that she can get ahead and improve her quality of life.  With her loan money, Giovana will buy groceries such as noodles, rice, flour and potatoes wholesale so that she can make her delicious dishes.  She is a very hard-working and dynamic person and is grateful to the institution for the support she has been given.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, rice, flour and potatoes wholesale, so that she can make her delicious dishes

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es: Andrés es socio del Banco Comunal Siempre Viva, tiene 49 años y vive con su esposa y su hijo D. 11 años. El es dueño D. un negocio donD. sirve comida típica D. Ayacucho como cuy chactado, chicharrones, trucha y mondongo.  Andrés solicita su préstamo para abrir otra negocio en un local que le va a prestar su amigo. El terreno esta equipado con dos piscinas. Andres ha estado con FINCA Peru por dos años y lo que mas le gusta D. FINCA Peru es L. armonía que existe entre las socias. Dice que L. unión D. su banco lo ayuda a salir adelante. DesD. que se unió a FINCA Peru siente que es una persona mas responsable e puntual. Su sueño es darle a su hijo L. infancia que el no tuvo.
texts.en:
Andrés is a member of the "Siempre Viva" community bank.  He is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 11 year-old son.  Andrés is the owner of a business where he serves typical Ayacucho food such as ''cuy chactado' (fried guinea pig), 'chicharrones' (pork rinds), trout and tripe.  He is requesting this loan to open another business in premises that his friend is going to lend him.  The plot of land has two swimming pools.

Andrés has been with FINCA Peru for two years and what he most likes about FINCA Peru is the harmony that exists between the members.  He says that the unity of his community bank helps him to get ahead.  Since he joined FINCA Peru, Andrés feels that he has become a more responsible and punctual person.  His dream is to give his son the childhood that he never had himself.

loans.use: to prepare new premises for his business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. She takes care of additional family members (her mother and her late brother’s children). 

Susan has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week. Susan also sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Susan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Susan include transportation, thieves and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and also to open up another restaurant in Ntinda. Susan lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees for late brother’s children and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, rice and beef

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Community Group

texts.en:
For 12 years, 33-year-old Deborah has been overseeing operations at her beauty salon business in Kampala city, Uganda's capital city. Beauty salons are widespread all over Kampala, and it's always the way beauticians handle clients that sells their services. If one's beauty salon has a reputation for servicing clients well, that will, without a shadow of a doubt, play in the favor of that business. That is what has been unfolding at Deborah's salon. She and her employees aim at offering the best of service to not only their usual clients but also new clients. This has endeared them to many people, most especially women.

Not everything has been going well, however. She says the rising cost of doing business in most of East Africa has not spared her business. She says most of the cosmetics and other equipment she uses at her salon are increasingly becoming expensive. As a result, her business's growth has been stifled somewhat.

She remains upbeat, hoping for a favorable turn in circumstances soon. For a woman who was previously a housewife, this progress and attitude in the face of business adversity is encouraging. This mother of three says this business's gross profits total up to 500,000 Ugandan shillings weekly.  She says this Kiva loan will come in handy in the purchase of more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, hair dryers and other hair products to use at her salon

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 47, widowed, and has four children. Her one son went to Russia in search of a living. Two of her other sons are her main helpers in breeding cattle and land cultivating. Her youngest daughter goes to kindergarten. They have been engaged in the breeding and cultivating businesses since 2004. They work hard to grow beans and potatoes on the rented plot of land and breed 15 sheep at their farm. These activities allow them to earn about 6,000 KGS a month. Gulnara plans to use her loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase mineral fertilizers to manure her land, which will allow her the best quality harvest. With the revenues, she wants to help her son build a barn for the cattle and in the future, she plans further development of these businesses. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Esther has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for one year and she works seven days out of every week. Esther sells her products from home, by means of retail. Esther has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and a school canteen. The main business challenge(s) for Esther include transportation, defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to sell at wholesale only. Esther lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  Margarita, es madre soltera con tres hijos: Carlos Daniel de trece años de edad, Víctor Manuel de diez años de edad y el más pequeño es  Jesús Enrique de cinco años de edad.

     El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra  de hilos para costurar blusas de mantas para bordarla y luego venderlas, en esta actividad  lleva diez años y cuatro meses en donde cometa que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso y ha estado sacando adelante a su pequeña familia .

     Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia ya que ella desde muy pequeña aprendió  a bordar  y cuando su esposo la abandono decidió  trabajar con ello para así  salir adelante   dándole lo más necesario a su hijos.

      Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  y  el préstamo  pueda seguir trabajando  para  tener sus propios ahorros y apoyar a sus hijos en su crecimiento y educación.
texts.en:
Margarita is a single mother with three children: 13 year-old Carlos Daniel; 10 year-old Víctor Manuel; and her youngest, 5 year-old Jesús Enrique.

Margarita will invest her loan in buying threads for making 'blusas de mantas' (a typical style of blouse) to embroider and then sell.  She has been in this business for ten years and four months.  She tells us that it is doing very well since it has made her a good income and she has been getting her small family ahead in life.

What motivated Margarita to start this business was her family as she learned to embroider at a very young age and, when her husband left her, she decided to work in this business in order to get ahead and provide her children with what they most need.

What Margarita would most like is to be able to continue working, with this business and her loan, so that she can make some savings of her own and support her children in their growth and education.

loans.use: to make blouses, embroider them and then sell them

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
These borrowers are the staff of a noble organization situated in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan the staff of this organization has received from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 3,800,000 to benefit the entire group. With the help of this loan, these borrowers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their current salary does not let them do.

Abu Bakarr is the leader of the group. Abu Bakarr is 56 years old and was born in Bendu II, Sierra Leone. He is married and has six children. He has been in the teaching profession for 32 years now. Abu Bakarr has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe tiene veinte años  de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de tres años de edad de nombre Rodrigo  Ángel y viven en la localidad de Ajilho.

     Ella es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad, y es para invertirlo en la compra  de materiales para la elaboración de bordados de mantas, así como también en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes  y comenta que se dedica a estas dos actividades para  que mejor sea sus ingresos en su hogar.

    Su motivo esta actividad es que  ella es una mujer sola con un hijo  pequeño y desea darle lo más necesario, y con estas actividades trabajar para tener un mejor ingreso económico para comprar cosas que le hacen falta su hijo.

      Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para que con  ellos siga trabajando y así salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in Ajilho.  She’s 20 years old and the single mother of a three year old son named Rodrigo Ángel.

This will be her second loan through Fundación Realidad and she will use the money to invest in embroidered blankets and also other merchandise to stock her grocery store.  She tells us that she is involved in these two businesses so that she can improve her household income.

She does this because she is a single mother with a small son and she wants to provide for his needs and doing this type of work provides her with a better income so that she can buy her son the things he needs.

What she wants the most is to be able to have her own savings though these activities and continue to work to get ahead with her small family.

loans.use: to buy blankets and inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Edwin Roman

texts.es: El señor Edwin es un cliente nuevo en Emprender  es su primera secuencia, el es soltero  vive en casa de su padre El Sr. Agustín quien se dedica a la llantería, el vive en la zona El tejar de la ciudad de la Paz, el cliente independientemente se dedica a la costura de maletines  pequeños los cuales tienen mucha demanda porque son de novedad en el mercado. El joven  Edwin necesita el crédito para la compra de tela lona y cuerina por mayor para la confección de sus mochilas, es una joven emprendedor con el deseo de tener un taller mas grande y emplear mano de obra, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edwin is a new client with Emprender, and this is his first loan cycle. He is single and lives in the home of his father, Agustín, who works in the tire business. He lives in the neighborhood of El Tejar in the city of La Paz. The borrower works independently, making small bags [briefcases/laptop bags/backpacks], for which there is great demand because they are new on the market. Young Edwin needs the loan to buy fabric, canvas and leatherette on a wholesale basis to make his carry bags. He is a young entrepreneur with the desire to have a larger workshop and employ workers. He is grateful to the institution for the support provided to him.

loans.use: to buy fabric, canvas and leatherette on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia, es viuda desde hace 18 años y ha tenido que criar a sus 7 hijos como madre soltera. Su hijo más joven de 19 años ha ingresado a estudiar para ser Policía. El resto de sus hijos son taxistas, y sus hijas venden en el mercado. Teodora va a utilizar su préstamo para su negocio de mantas, en la cual lleva más o menos tres años. Ella compra las mantas de Juliaca y las manda al penal para que las aborden, luego ella viaja a Lima donde las vende en la calle.  Teodora ha sido socia de FINCA Perú por más de cinco años. Lo que más le gusta son los ahorros que le han servido para comprarle a su hijo su uniforme de Policía y su laptop. Su nueva meta es ahorrar para su terreno para construir una casa más grande porque ahora en su casa pequeña, en donde vive con sus hermanos, viven muy apretados.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank.  She has been a widow for 18 years, and she has had to raise her seven children as a single mother.  Her youngest child is 19 years old, and he has enrolled in studies to be a policeman.  The rest of her sons are taxi drivers, and her daughters sell at the market.

Teodora will use the loan for her blanket business, which she has had for more or less three years.  She buys the blankets from Juliaca, and she sends them to the prison to be embroidered.  She then travels to Lima where she sells them on the street.

Teodora has been a member of Finca Perú for over five years.  What she likes the most are the savings that she used to buy her son a police uniform and a laptop.  Her new goal is to save for land in order to build a bigger house because her current house is very small.  She lives there with her siblings, and they are very cramped.

loans.use: to buy blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila es socia del Banco comunal Magnolia, tiene 52 años y vive con su hija de 19 años que ha ingresado a la Universidad San Cristóbal para sacar su título de profesora. Cirila es ambulante y vende huevos, helados y gelatina. Ella estará utilizando su préstamo para comprar más mercancía de Lima.  Durante las fiestas de 28 de Julio (Fiestas Patrias de Perú), Cirila también venderá escarapelas de tela y de metal. Cirila recuerda muy bien el día en que se hizo socia de FINCA Perú.  Fue un día 9 de Diciembre, hace más de 20 años, cuando solo habían diez bancos, que “La Morenita” le sugirió que se uniera a FINCA Perú.  “La Morenita” le dijo “no me hagas quedar mal, se puntual” y desde ese día que Cirila siempre ha sido puntual y responsable.  Su primer ahorro lo tenía listo para comprarse un carro, pero su esposo se enfermó y le pago su cirugía.  Luego dice, que su esposo la dejo, pero que eso solo le ha servido para seguir adelante y ser una mujer más fuerte e independiente.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank.  She is 52 years old, and she lives with her 19 year old daughter.  Her daughter has enrolled in the Universidad San Cristóbal in order to get her teaching degree.

Cirila sells eggs, ice cream, and gelatin in an itinerant manner.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise from Lima.  During the July 28th festivities (Peruvian national holiday) Cirila will also sell fabric and metal rosettes. 

Cirila remembers very well the day she became of member of FINCA Perú.  It was the 9th of December over 20 years ago, and there were only ten banks.  “La Morenita” (The Virgen of Guadalupe) suggested joining FINCA Perú.  La Morenita told her “do not disappoint me, be punctual.”  From that day on Cirila has always been punctual and responsible.

She had her first savings ready to buy a car.  However, her husband became ill, and they paid for his surgery.  Then, she says, her husband left her.  Nevertheless, this only served her to get ahead and to be a stronger and more independent woman.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
