Doña Emilia vive en Ajilho un lugar bonito de mucha vegetación, ella es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Pedro Pablo de catorce años, Guadalupe de de trece años de edad, diego Andrés de nueve años de edad, Luis Alfredo de siete años de edad.
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: huevo, harina, aceite, quesos, entre otros   para la elaboración de panes, en done cometa que le va bien ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante a  su familia que es lo más importante para ella un bien estar mejor para ellos.
   Su inspiración por esta actividad fueron  sus hijos ya que  para sacarlos adelante tenía que tener un trabajo en el cual se pudiera poyar  con los ingresos que se generan en su pequeño hogar, así también darle una mejor educación.
    Lo que desea es que con el préstamo y su actividad pueda mejorar su ingreso de su actividad para apoyar a su hijos en su educación como también comenzar a comprar  materiales para techar su cocina donde  se encuentra el ornó donde ornea los panes.
texts.en:
Emilia lives in Ajilo, a beautiful place with a lot of vegetation.  She is a single mother with four children she is responsible for.  They are:  Pedro Pablo is 14, Guadalupe is 13, Diego Andrés is 9, and Luis Alfredo is 7.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like eggs, flour, oil, and cheese, among others, for making bread.  She says that it is going well for her.  Through her business she is getting her family ahead.  The most important thing for her is to improve her family's well-being.

Her children were her inspiration for this business activity.  In order to get them ahead she had to have work in which she would be able to support them with the income generated in her small home.  That way she also gives them a better upbringing.

She wants to use the loan to be able to improve her income from her business.  She wants to do this to be able to support her children’s education.  She will also start to buy materials to thatch the roof over her kitchen where the oven that she uses to bake the bread is located.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: María es socia del Banco Comunal Magnoli, tiene 41 años y vive con su esposo y su hijo de 15 años. Ella estará utilizando su préstamo para invertir en más mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes en la cual vende gaseosas y golosinas.  Aparte de su tienda, María también vende gelatina, cancha, yogurt y chupetes en las ferias.  Abrió su tienda hace 20 años junto a su esposo y ya lleva 10 años vendiendo en las ferias.  María se unió a FINCA Perú en el 1988 y lo que más le gusta son los ahorros que le han ayudado a establecer.  Ella también ha aprendido la importancia de ser responsable para superarse como persona.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Magnoli Communal Bank.  She is 41 years old, and she lives with her husband and their 15 year old son.

She will be using the loan to buy more merchandise for her grocery store.  She sells soft drinks and sweets there.  Aside from her store, María also sells gelatin, yogurt, and lollipops at the fairgrounds.  

She opened her store with her husband 20 years ago, and she has been selling at the fairs for 10 years.  María joined FINCA Perú in 1988.  What she likes the most are the savings that they have helped her to establish.  She has also learned the importance of being responsible in order to improve as a person.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es:
Ana, tiene una hija de 20 años de edad, administran una tienda de productos de uso domestico, este negocio tiene 10 años de existir, Ana lo heredo de sus padres, actualmente le provee los necesario para el hogar y mantiene un buen número de clientes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como: azúcar, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, esta compra será una gran ayuda para el negocio y para Ana, pues ofrecerá un mayor variedad de productos, atendiendo la demanda.
Su objetivo es tener el negocio surtido de mercadería, ya que esto le ocasionara un aumento a las ventas y atraerá a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Ana has a 20-year-old daughter, and they run a store that sells products for home use. This business is ten years old. Ana inherited it from her parents, and currently she stocks items needed in homes and has a good number of customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like: sugar, oil, salt, rice and beans. This purchase will be a great help for the business and for Ana because she will offer a greater variety of products, responding to demand.

Her goal is to have her business stocked with merchandise because this will lead to an increase in sales and will attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy products: sugar, oil, salt, rice and beans for her business.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Don Gilberto vive en un lugar muy bonito, en donde las personas son  solo de una religión, y se celebra la fiesta del santo san Andrés  y lo celebran en grande ya que es el patrón  de la comunidad, el vive en unión libre con la señora  Juana y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.
  
   El se dedica a la elaboración de bordados de ropas artesanales y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de materiales que lo son útiles en su actividad, en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos atenido un buen ingresos  en su hogar y para su familia.
 
    Para dedicarse a esta actividad  lo motivo su familia ya que su esposa también se dedica a lo mismo  y decidió apoyarla  con los ingresos  y tener materiales  suficientes para realizar su actividad que es con lo que se  apoya para sostener su familia.
 
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener  un mejor ingreso para mejorar su venta de su negocio y con ello tener lo más necesario para su familia que es lo más importante para él.
texts.en:
Don Gilberto lives in a lovely area where everyone is the same religion and celebrates the festival of San Andres, who is the patron saint of the community. He lives with his partner Sra. Juana and their three children, who are still under their parents' responsibility. 

He earns his living embroidering traditional clothing and is seeking a loan to buy supplies for this work. He notes that his business is doing well and his income supports his household and family.

It is his family who provides the motivation for going to work, especially as his wife also does the same job. He decided to help her earn money and obtain the materials necessary to do the work and support the family.

Gilberto’s greatest wish is that his work will bring in more money so that he can improve the place from which they sell their work, and also obtain all that is necessary for his family, the most important thing in his life.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials, such as thread, needles and cloth.

loans.name: Brima S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, for a loan of 6,300,000 SLL in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amount and paying SMT.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Brima S. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 36-year-old Brima was born in Kailahun, in eastern Sierra Leone. Brima has been in the teaching profession for 11 years now. He is married and has two children. Brima has requested this loan in order to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a family house

loans.name: Ayme

texts.es: Ayme es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 30 años y vive con su conviviente y su hijo. Ayme utilizara su préstamo para su negocio que es la venta de tortas desde su tienda,"Pasteleria Yomi." El nombre Yomi es una combinacion del nombre de su hijo y de su hija que falleció apenas nació. Ayme sufrió mucho con el fallecimiento de su hija y tiene miedo de intentar de tener otro bebe porque los doctores le han dicho que es probable que lo pierda. Mientras tanto ella se mantiene ocupada con su tienda y su hijo. Específicamente ella utilizará su préstamo para comprar harina y azúcar. Cuando no era socia de FINCA Perú Ayme compraba de a pocos ingredientes y ahora compra sacos grandes de harina y azúcar y por lo tanto hace muchas mas tortas que antes. Ayme también vende gaseosas en un puesto pequeño en la tienda. Ya lleva un año y medio con FINCA Perú y lo que lo gusta mas son las charlas y su promotora que siempre la alegra cuando tiene pena. Se desahogan entre las socias. Las charlas y las capacitaciones le han enseñado como tratar a su pareja y su hijo y como manejar el dinero. Ayme dice que hay que invertir en lo que tiene mas salida y no preocuparse de invertir en lo que no tiene potencial. Su meta es tener una tienda mas grande de tortas para variarlo mas. También sueña que su hijo estudie y se haga profesional.
texts.en:
Ayme is a member of the Señor de Huanca communal bank. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and their son.

Ayme will use the loan for her business selling cakes from her shop, "Pasteleria Yomi." (Yomi Bakery). The name Yomi is a combination of the names of her son and of her daughter, who passed away soon after she was born. Ayme suffered greatly because of her daughter's death and is afraid to try to have another baby because the doctors have told her that she would probably lose the child. Meanwhile she keeps busy with her store and her son.

She will use her loan specifically to buy flour and sugar. When she was not a member of FINCA Perú, Ayme bought small amounts of ingredients, and now she buys large sacks of flour and sugar so she makes many more cakes than before. Ayme also sells soft drinks at a small stand in the store.

She has been a member of FINCA Perú for a year and a half, and what she likes best are the talks and her facilitator, who always cheers her up when she feels sad. The members vent their feelings with each other. The talks and training have taught her how to treat her husband and son and how to manage money. Ayme says that she has to invest in whatever has the best prospects and not worry about investing in things that have no potential. Her dream is to have a larger cake shop so she can vary her cakes more. She also dreams of her son studying and becoming a professional.

loans.use: to buy products for making cakes.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas II se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a una de las miembros, quien contactó con una de las asesoras, para informarse sobre el programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el 3° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Sixta se dedica a la venta de ropas, este trabajo la ha ayudado mucho a la hora de mantener su hogar, puesto que gracias a esto genera ingresos y le permite paliar los gastos que surgen. Ella manifiesta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a ella misma. Sueña con algún día tener un puesto donde exhibir sus ropas.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de invierno, ya que se viene la temporada de frió y quiere estar prevenida para lo que los clientes le soliciten.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas II” (United Women II) is known as an excellent group of women from the city of Itá. Thanks to one of its members, who was contacted by one of the advisors, they learned about the Women Entrepreneurs Program. Once the group received the information, they were able to gather 17 women who are now working on their third loan cycle as part of the program.

Sra. Sixta sells clothing. This work has been a great help in maintaining her household. Thanks to the income she generates, Sixta is able to offset the expenses her family accumulates. She says that all of her sacrifice has enabled her and her family to live a better lifestyle. Sixta dreams of having a vending stall where she can display her merchandise.

She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing since the weather is cold. Sixta wants to be prepared for whatever her customers may order.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing.

loans.name: Cintya

texts.en: Cintya is 20 years old and lives in San Gabriel, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their two children, aged three years and two years, respectively. Cintya is a responsible and hardworking person who is very committed to her family. She is seeking this loan to increase her dairy business through the purchase of more milk cows to meet customer demand. She began working in her own business four years ago selling young bulls at every market in the province. She currently works with her parents and her husband. This is Cintya’s third loan from FODEMI. Her past loans have helped her improve her family’s quality of life, especially economically. Cintya’s dream is to continue with her business and eventually obtain her own dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina vive en la  localidad de Ajilho, ella es madre soltera con una hija de cinco meses de edad de nombre Ana Gabriela.
   Ella dedica  a la elaboración de bordados de manta y esta  vez invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta ganado para luego venderlo en la misma localidad en este negocio apenas lleva cinco meses y comenta que le está dando un buen resulto  ya que ha visto un mejor ingreso.
Desde que se casó ella se dedicaba al bordado, sin embargo hace unos meses du esposo la abandono  y decidió  trabajar algo que en realidad le dé buenas ganancias con la que pueda salir adelante, es por ello que ahora quiere invertir en ganado, sin dejaqr de trabajar el bordado de mantas que es con lo que ha esto apoyando en su hogar.
     Lo que desea es que con el préstamo y  su negocio pueda tener una mejor calidad  de vida para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija que aun esta creciendo.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in the town of Ajilho.  She is a single mother and has a 5 month-old daughter called Ana Gabriela.

Cristina embroiders blankets and, on this occasion, she will invest her loan in buying livestock which she will later sell in the same town.  She has been in this business for barely five months but she tells us that it is providing her with good results as she has seen her income improve.

Cristina has been embroidering since she got married.  Some months ago, her husband left her and she decided to work on something that makes her good profits so that she can get ahead in life.  She would like to invest in livestock but without stopping her work embroidering blankets as it is through this work that she has been managing to support her family.

What Cristina would like is, through this loan and her business, to be able to enjoy a better quality of life and get her young daughter, who is still growing, ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy livestock which she will later sell in the same town

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 18 años y vive con sus padres y hermanos. Ella utilizará su préstamo para su negocio de venta de celulares desde su tienda propia. Hace dos años que ella esta en el negocio de celulares. Ella es nueva a FINCA Perú. Su meta es agrandar su negocio para poder ampliar la línea de productos que ella le ofrece a sus clientes. Hace medio año Judith ahorró y compró su local, ahora ella esta ahorrando para poder tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Dice que siente mucho optimismo junto a sus nuevas socias de FINCA Perú.
texts.en: Judith is a member of the communal lender Señor de Huanca, is 18 years old and lives with her family. She seeks this credit to begin selling cell phones from her home, a business that she has been engaged in for two years.  Judith is a new associate of FINCA Perú, and her goal is to grow her business and expand her line of products for clients. Six months ago, Judith purchased her own shop with her savings, and is now planning to open a store of basic goods.  She is very optimistic working with her colleagues of FINCA Perú.

loans.use: to open a store to sell mobile phones

loans.name: Jose Herbert

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su esposa y tienen una hija de 2 años de edad, él trabaja realizando viajes exprés en una moto taxi, lleva tres años en esta actividad, ha logrado mantenerse y mantener a su familia, cubriendo las necesidades más importantes.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas como repuesto para la moto taxi, esta compra le ayudara mucho, pues su fuente de trabajo es la moto taxi por lo tanto debe mantenerla en perfectas condiciones, ofreciendo a los clientes seguridad y comodidad.
Tiene como objetivo que a través de los ingresos de los viajes que realiza, ahorrar para mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José is married and lives with his wife and 2-year old daughter.  He works transporting passengers in a motorized taxi, and has done so for the past 3 years to support himself.  He now seeks a loan to buy spare tires for the taxi, a necessary purchase to provide reliable service and better conditions for his clients.  With his profits, he plans to increase his savings to improve his family's financial well-being.

loans.use: to buy new tires for a motor taxi to transport passengers

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es: Alfonsa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 46 años y esta casada y vive con dos de sus cuatro hijos de 17 y 16 años. Sus dos hijas mayores ya se graduaron de la universidad y una recibió título de profesora y la otra de administración de empresa. La de 17 años acaba de ingresar a la Universidad y esta estudiando Economía. Alfonsa utilizará su préstamo para comprar los materiales para las bolsas artesanales que hace y manda para Cusco. Aparte de eso Alfonsa tambien es dueña de un bar y trabaja en eso con su esposo. Ella dice que su esposo le enseñó todo lo que sabe hacer con artesanía. Hace dos años que ella trabaja con FINCA Perú, y lo que mas le gustan son las capacitaciones. Dice que ella aprendió mucho sobre el abuso en las relaciones románticas y la importancia de valorarse como persona y mujer. La meta de Alfonsa es ponerle un techo a el segundo piso de su casa y poder darle mas a sus hijos, específicamente todo lo que necesitan para que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Alfonsa is 46, married and lives with two of her 4 children, who are 16 and 17 years old. Her two oldest daughters are university graduates and live independently, working respectively as a teacher and administrator.  Alfonsa plans to use her credit to buy materials for weaving decorative bags which are sold in Cusco. Alfonsa also manages a small bar with her husband, who she says taught her to produce handcrafts. She has worked with FINCA Perú for the past two years, and has enjoyed participating in their training sessions. She has also learned much about personal values and patterns of relationship abuse. Alfonsa plans to finish the roof on the 2nd floor of her house and to raise her two children to encourage their professional success.

loans.use: to buy materials to support her business selling handcrafts

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 33 años y vive con su pareja y dos hijos de 11 años y de un mes. Ella utilizará su préstamo para comprar mas ingredientes para su negocio de comida. Ella cocina comida típica criolla, que se varía entre sopas y arroz con patas, y la vende en una feria.  Hace un año ella se hizo socia de FINCA Perú y empezó su negocio de comida. Lo que mas le gusta a Marcelina de la organización son los ahorros, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad. Dice que tambien ha aprendido como tratar a la familia y la importancia de ser sincera y honesta. Aparte de su negocio de comidas Marcelina también ayuda a su novio con su negocio de mecánica de motos. Su meta para prosperar mas es comprar motos para arreglar y vender. Marcelina dice que de vez en cuando los problemas personales pueden afectar el trabajo pero que siempre sigue adelante.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “Senor de Huanca” Communal Bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children, aged 11 years and 1 month respectively. 

She will use her loan to buy more ingredients for her meal-selling business. Marcelina cooks typical creole dishes, varying between soups and rice with potatoes, and she sells her meals at a fair.

Around a year ago Marcelina became a member of FINCA Peru and began her meals business. What she likes most about the organization is the savings accounts, the punctuality, and the responsibility. She says that she has learned how to deal with her family and the importance of being sincere and honest.

Apart from her meals business, Marcelina also helps her fiancé with his motorcycle mechanic business. Her goal for gaining more prosperity is to buy motorcycles to fix up and sell.

Marcelina comments that once in a while personal problems can affect her work but that she keeps on forging ahead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her meal-selling business.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou est créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 28 décembre 2011, il est composé de dix neuf femmes qui sont parentes et  habitent le même village; elles mènent comme activités l'embouche et la restauration; le petit commerce est l'activité dominante.


Madame Mbéne est la responsable, elle est âgée de 51 ans, est mariée, mère de trois enfants et a un enfant en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce de et de transformation d'huile d'arachide, elle a une expérience moyenne dans ce secteur. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou blanc, a noué un foulard noir sur la tête et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achéte l'arachide dans les marchés hebdomadaires, transforme et vend dans son village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter une bonne quantité d'arachide pour la transformation.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices contribuer aux charges de la famille puisqu'elle habite dans une grande concession avec les frères de son mari.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created on the same day the local Village Loan Fund was established, on 28 December 2011. It comprises 19 women who are related and live in the same town; their activities include animal-rearing, food preparation, and small retail businesses, the dominant field.

Ms. Mbéne, the group leaD., is a 51-year-old married mother of three and has one child in her care; she runs a business making, processing, and selling peanut oil, and has gained a fair amount of experience in this field. She is standing on the right in the photo, wearing a white boubou with a black headscarf tied around her head, and has her left hand raised.

She buys peanuts at the weekly market days and converts them to oil, which she then sells in her town.

Her loan will allow her to buy a sizable quantity of peanuts to process.

With her profits, she hopes to help provide for the family, since she lives in a large household with her husband's brothers.

loans.use: To buy and process peanuts for sale.

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.en:
Zoraida lives in a place where people are very happy since the town has two patron saints: Saint Antonio of Padua and Saint Antonio. She is married to Adiel and they have two children who are already married.

Zoraida buys and sells cheese.  She also buys coffee which she later sells in the same town.  She has been in this business for ten years and tells us that it is doing well since she makes a good income for her household.  For this reason, she continues working.  She has the support of her husband who works on the land.

Zoraida was motivated to work by her family.  In order to make a little more income, she had to have a business activity which would enable her to help and continue supporting her children who studied to become teachers.  With the help of God she has achieved this.

What Zoraida would most like is to use this loan so that she can continue working and getting ahead in life since it is through selling her cheese that she supports herself and makes income.

This group is called 'Las Perlas' and has three members.  The other two members are María Elisa, who buys live chickens which she later sells dressed and Oscar Alberto who will invest his loan in buying merchandise to stock his grocery store.

Translated from Spanish:

   La señora Zoraida,  vive en un lugar donde la gente es muy alegre ya que en su localidad hay dos santos San Antonio de Padua, y san Antonio, ella es casada con el señor Adiel y con quien procreo dos hijos quienes  ya están casados 

    Ella se dedica a la compra y elaboración de quesos, como también la compra de café para luego venderlo en el mismo municipio, en esta actividad lleva diez años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso en su hogar y por ello lo sigue trabajando, a u así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo  quien trabajo en el campo.

    Ella lo motivo su familia ya que para tener un poco mas de ingresos, tenía que tener una  actividad en a que  se pueda ayudar y seguir apoyando sus hijos que estudio para maestro y con la ayuda de dios lo ha logrado.

    Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo  pueda seguir trabajando para seguir adelante ya que  con la venta de quesos es con lo que apoya para tener sus ingresos. 

     El grupo se llama las perlas y  se integra de tres personas y estas son los que hacen falta: María Elisa quien se dedica a la compra de pollos de rancho para luego venderlo aliñado y Oscar Alberto quien  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: to buy cheese and coffee.

loans.name: Rosa Catalina

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su familia, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, realizando este negocio desD. hace 11 años, ella ha logrado cubrir todas sus necesidades D. las ventas que realiza a diario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. maíz y leña, ya que estos son los principales materiales que utiliza para preparar la venta D. tortillas, con esta inversión tendrá una mejor disponibilidad D. materia prima para continuar al frente del negocio.
Su objetivo es mejorar cada día su negocio, ya que D. sus ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar, por lo que espera crecer en sus ventas y aumentar el número D. clientes.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her family and she sells tortillas. She has been in business for 11 years. She has managed to cover all of her needs with the earnings from her daily sales. She requests a loan to purchase corn and firewood. These are the primary products that she uses to make her products for sale. With this investment she will have a better amount of products at her disposal to continue forward with her business. Her objective is to improve her business every day especially because her profits cover the household expenses. She hopes to increase her sales and increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Kenny

texts.es: Kenny vende comidas rápidas, frutas y jugos en un vehículo que ubica diariamente a en un sitio estratégico de la ciudad,   sector muy comercial, donde transitan sus actuales y potenciales clientes. Así mismo vende comidas rápidas que sirven como desayuno o refrigerio y muchas veces de cena a habitantes de esta zona. Inicialmente solo vendía comidas rápidas, pero posteriormente agregó frutas, jugos,  y su tradicional Tuti Fruti, aprovechando una oportunidad pues una frutera cerró sus puertas y esto benefició a Kenny.  Hoy entusiasmado quiere continuar creciendo y acude a un credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con ello comprará materias primas e insumos para sus comidas rápidas en mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y poco a poco poder extender su negocio a otros puntos de la ciudad que es su meta más adelante. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente y este es justamente la razón de su apalancamiento financiero, porque en su negocio maneja una rotación de cuentas por de dos días y sus inventarios cada 3, lo cual está relacionado con la frecuencia en que debe realizar sus compras y quiere mejorar,  porque los gastos de transporte aumentan su precio de ventas y con un capital de trabajo disponible puede disminuir su frecuencia.
texts.en: Kenny sells fast foods, fruits, and juices from a cart that he places every day in a strategic location in the city. The sector is highly commercial and is frequently traveled by current and potential clients. He also sells fast foods served for breakfast or as refreshments, and often he also serves dinner to the inhabitants of the region. He started out only selling fast foods but later he started selling fruits, juices, and a traditional tutti fruiti. To his favor, Kenny took advantage of the opportunity when a fruit store closed its doors. He is excited to continue growing and he requests a Kiva loan. It is the first loan that he requests through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it he will purchase greater quantities of products and ingredients he needs to make fast foods, thereby earning discounts. His goal for the future is to gradually extend his business to other locations in the city. His greatest challenge is an insufficient working capital and this is exactly the reason why he requests financial support. He manages his business on an 2-day rotation of accounts and he acquires is inventory every 3 days. This depends on the frequency that he needs to make his purchases. He wants to make improvements especially because the transportation expenses are increasing the price of his sales. With a working capital at his disposal he will be able to decrease the frequency of his trips.

loans.use: to purchase products and ingredients he needs to make fast foods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuyes y también la socia se dedica al trabajo de profesora en el nivel inicial en el distrito de Urubamba, y el negocio de venta de cuyes lo realiza en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia por medio de este negocio y trabajo sacan adelante a sus hijos, al socia quiere ampliar le negocio de venta de cuyes y mejorar en su trabajo como profesora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Torrechayoc". It is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling guinea pigs and she also works as a primary school teacher in the district of Urubamba. She carries out her sale of guinea pigs itinerantly at the different fairs that happen in the district of Urubamba. It is through this business and her employment that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her business selling guinea pigs and to improve her employment as a teacher. She requests a loan to purchase guinea pigs and feed for guinea pigs.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and their feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Victoriosas es un comité de 10 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica. Se reúnen mensualmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda las unas a las otras en su esfuerzos a mejorar su situación económica.
La Sra. Miguelina es artesana, ella se dedica a esto desde pequeña ya que su madre le había trasmitido los conocimientos sobre esta profesión. Por medio de su dedicado trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y brindarle una vida decorosa y digna a su familia. Comenta que todo sacrificio es poco para lograr lo que uno quiere. Sueña con algún día poder tener un local donde exponer sus artesanías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, bastidores, agujas y demás para la elaboración de artesanías.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Victoriosas” (Victorious Women) Group is a committee of 10 women who are well organized, united, hard workers with much solidarity, one with the other. These women are from the city of Villarica. They meet monthly to offer aid and support to one another in their efforts to improve their economic situation.

Miguelina is an artisan. She has done this work since she was a small child, when her mother transmitted her own knowledge concerning this profession. Due to her dedicated work, she has been able to get ahead and offer a decorous and dignified life to her family. Miguelina comments that all her sacrifice amounts to little compared with gaining what she wishes. She dreams of one day being able to have a shop where she can display her artisan crafts.

Miguelina request a loan to buy cloth, thread, stretchers, needles and other items for elaborating her artisan crafts.

loans.use: buy cloth, thread, stretchers, and needles for making artisan crafts.

loans.name: Morelia Group

texts.es:
La señora  Bertha, es casada con el señor  Silvano y con quien procreo cinco hijos que aunque ya son independientes vive en la misma casa y son: María Miguelita de veinticuatro año de edad, Corazón de María  de veintidós años de edad, Lucia de veinte años de edad y Abisai de diecisiete años de edad, y las más pequeña es Mariela de catorce años de edad.
    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva siete meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso en su hogar, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
    Su inspiración por esta actividad  fue su familia ya que también quiere aportar con los ingresos de la  casa, en ello decidió poner la tienda de abarrotes para mejorar sus ingresos y así poder aportar.
    Lo que más desea es que la sigan apoyando para que así pueda agrandar mas su actividad y mejores sean sus  ingresos, aun así también desea tener sus propios ahorros para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Bertha pertenece al grupo Morelia, quienes pidieron un préstamo a Fundación Realidad, los demás integrantes del grupo son: Norma Esperanza quien invertirá el presta en la compra de material para  costurar ropas y por último María Miguelita quien también invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de ropas.
texts.en:
Bertha is married with Silvano and they have five children together. Although they are already independent they live at home together. They are: Maria Miguelita, twenty-four years old; Corazon de Maria, twenty-two years old; Lucia, twenty years old; Abisai, seventeen years old; and, the youngest is Mariela who is fourteen years old.

She requested a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store. She has been in business for seven months and she mentions that it is going well. She has been able to earn a better income for her home and she still enjoys her husband's support. 

Her inspiration for her business is her family because she also wants to bring an income into the home. She decided to set up a grocery store to improve her income and to bring home more money.

What she most wants is to continue to have your support to increase her business and to earn an improved income. She also wants to have her own savings to improve the quality of her life.

Bertha belongs to the group named "Morelia" and they requested a loan from Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner). The other members of the group are: Norma Esperanza - she will invest her loan in the purchase of textiles to make clothing; and, Maria Miguelita - she will also invest in the purchase of textiles to make clothing.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Cesar Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar es un cliente antiguo, vive en la zona el Tejar vive en la casa de  su madre en la misma dirección tiene su taller de soldar escapes don cesar esta muy contento de  haber sido  aprobado su crédito El Sr. cesar esta  casado con la señora Noemí que también tiene su propia actividad  ella vende café tiene un puesto en la misma avenida. El crédito necesita para comprar un oxigeno para soldar. Lo cual le será de mucha utilidad ya que  tiene mucha demanda de clientes y no pude abastecer  con lo que tiene por el momento, cesar es  muy trabajador se levanta desde muy temprano para seguir adelante  de esta manera solventarse económicamente.
texts.en: Cesar is a long-time client. He lives in the region of Tejar and he lives in his mother's house. He has a soldering shop at the same address. Cesar is very happy to have been approved to receive a loan. Cesar is married with Noemi. She also has her own business. She sells coffee from a stand located on the same street. He needs the loan to purchase a cylinder of oxygen used for soldering. It will be of great help especially because he has much demand from his clients and he cannot keep up with what he currently has. Cesar is a very hardworking man who starts his days very early in the morning to keep earning an income.

loans.use: to purchase a cylinder of oxygen used for soldering.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 55 años de edad se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de vehículos y a la venta de partes en un taller ubicado al suroccidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposa.  El emprendió su aventura de negocio una vez quedó sin empleo y con su conocimiento de mecánica,  inició un taller donde sus amigos fueron los primeros clientes y gradualmente recomendados por ellos llegaron nuevos compradores de sus productos  y con su buen servicio, fue agregando más clientes, incrementando sus ingresos cuando adicionó las partes de vehículos y repuestos para ofrecer el servicio de venta que tanto hacía falta a su clientela. 
Su credikiva es el  primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará partes de vehículos, que son las que son los elementos que  más rotan en su taller y con ello planea aumentar el volumen de sus ventas.
Su sueño es separar el taller de su espacio familiar y tener diversidad de productos en su oferta, pues no todo el tiempo sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan y esto es un  gran  desafío porque  no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para responderles oportunamente. Justamente esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva,  pues gradualmente planea incrementarlo para poder poco a poco lograr cumplir su sueño.  Mientras esto ocurre maneja una rentabilidad  sobre las ventas no menor del 18%, rota sus cuentas por cobrar cada 6 días y sus inventarios cada  12 y  con ello continúa al lado de su esposa construyendo futuro.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 55, performs maintenance and repairs vehicles.  He also sells parts in a workshop to the southwest of the city of Barranquilla, where he lives with his wife.  He undertook this business venture when he was once left without employment.  With his knowledge of mechanics he started a shop where his frineds were his first customers.  

Gradually, with recommendations from his friends, he got new buyers for his products.  With his good service, he was getting more customers.  As his income was increasing, he added the sale of vehicle parts and replacement parts that his customers really needed.

His Kiva loan is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will buy parts for vehicles, which are the items that turn around the most in his shop.  This way he plans on increasing his sales volume.

His dream is to separate his shop from his family space.  He also dreams of having diverse products to sell because his customers cannot always find what they need.  This is a big challenge because he does not have enough working capital to fill their needs in a timely fashion.

That is the exact reason the he turned to a Kiva loan.  He plans to gradually increase his business in order to be able to, little by little, fulfill his dreams.  While this is happening, he manages a sales profitability of no less than 18%.  Accounts receivable turn over every six days, and his inventory turns over every twelve days.  With his wife by his side he continues building his future.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts which have the biggest turnover in his shop.

loans.name: Kamchibek

texts.en:
Kamchibek is 58 years old. He has three grown children – two sons and one daughter. 
In his area of the country, farming is one of the main activities, so Kamchibek decided to do this. He started his business in 2001 and managed to expand by renting land where he planted wheat. To broaden his business activities by breeding cattle, in 2009 he obtained his first loan of 80.000 KGS which was repaid without any delays. Today his farm has 35 sheep, 6 cows and one horse. 

Kamchibek plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase more cattle. With the revenue, he wants to broaden his business activities. Kamchibek is a very positive and hard-working person who believes that his efforts will lead his family to a prosperous future. 


About Bai-Tushum:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: José Serafín

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Serafín  le esta haciendo falta la construcción de la barda al rededor de su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, varilla y para pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la contracción de la barda. 
Le esta preocupando la seguridad de su familia ya que el trabaja todo el día, como camarógrafo de una televisora.
Con una parte del ingreso que reciba de su trabajo pagara el crédito ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en: José Serafín needs to build a wall around his house.  He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies: concrete blocks, cement and iron rods, and also to pay labor costs to the person who will build the wall.  He is concerned about his family’s safety because he works all day as a cameraman for a television station.  He will use part of his salary from work to repay the loan since this is his family’s source of income.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, es padre de dos hijos y vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, él tiene 10 años de ser agricultor, sembrando tomates, pepinos, chiles en un espacio de terreno de tres manzanas, las cosechas que recibe son parte para consumo y otra parte para comercializar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, estos materiales sirven para fortalecer la plantación, dando buenos resultados al final de la siembra.
Él tiene por objetivo cuidar del presente cultivo, dedicarle el tiempo y los cuidados necesarios, pues comercializa una parte, y con esperanza que la cosecha sea abundante y sana, además de ofrecer a su familia una vida confortable.
texts.en:
José’s a farmer.  He grows vegetables.  He’s the father of two children and he lives with his wife in his own house.   He’s been farming for ten years growing tomatoes, cucumbers and chilies on a three manzana (Central American land measure) plot of land.  The harvests he receives are used partly for home consumption and partly to sell. 

He is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  These supplies help to strengthen the plants giving good results at the end of the growing period.

His goal is to care for the present crops giving them the necessary time and attention because he will sell part of it and he hopes that the harvest will be abundant and healthy so that he can offer his family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal De Confianza Los Cerritos iniciará su tercer ciclo está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigido por la señora Dominga Yanett. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan son variados entre ellos tenemos Pulpería, venta de leche, venta de pan, nacatamales y recargas telefónicas, venta de raspadita, venta de recarga, venta de tortilla y cosa de horno, venta de recargas y venta de pan.Dominga empezó indica que desde hace tiempo trabaja en con Fundación León 2000 y que integro el grupo que ahora conforma. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio que es una pulpería, negocio que trabaja todos los días desde hace  30 años. El crédito que ahora solicita es para comprar granos básicos, leches, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, fósforos, sal, sopas y enlatados. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene una familia que velar.
texts.en: The De Confianza Los Cerritos communal bank will start its third cycle.  It is made up of nine members and is directed by Dominga Yanett.  The members run a variety of businesses.  Among them we have a general store, milk sales, bread sales, Nicaraguan tamales and cell phone minutes sales, scratch-off lottery ticket sales, cell phone minutes sales, tortilla and cosa de horno (sweet cornbread) sales, cell phone minutes sales, and bread sales.  Dominga started it and indicates that she has been working with Fundación León 2000 for awhile and formed the group that has now taken shape. Currently she has a general store, a business at which she has worked daily for 30 years.  The loan she is asking for now is to buy staple grains, milk, sweets, soft drinks, juices, matches, salt, soups, and canned goods.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to suport her family, since she is married and has a family to look after.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, milk, sweets, soft drinks, juices, matches, salt, soups, and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 61 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza y venta de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos y ovejas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en el mercado del distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y alimentos para los animales.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District that belongs to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 61 years old, married and has 7 children.  She alternates her daily chores with raising small farm animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep.  She fattens them up so that they’ll grow and then sells them in the Urubamba district market.  She supports her children through this business.  She wants to expand the animal sales business and is asking for a loan to buy more animals and animal feed.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también trabaja en una empresa de venta de materiales de construcción y el negocio de venta de ropa lo realiza junto con su esposa y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas, blusas, casacas y polos al por mayor.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He is 42 years old, married and has two children.  He alternates his daily chores with selling clothes; he also works in a firm selling building materials.  The clothing sales business is a joint effort with his wife and together they support their children.  He wants to expand the clothing sales business and continue improving in his work.  He is asking for a loan to buy pants, jackets, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts at wholesale.

He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, es ama D. casa, tiene vivienda propia, vive con su familia; Ella se dedica a la agricultura y crianza D. ganado, es una mujer D. campo,  su familia le apoya en las distintas actividades, pues sus ingresos dependen D. estas labores agrícolas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ganado y en la reparación del corral, comprando los postes D. madera, alambre, para reforzarlo y que el ganado este más seguro.
Este préstamo le ayudara mucho, pues aumentara el ganado, estarán en un lugar más seguro, lo que le brindara una mayor ganancia en el trabajo.
texts.en:
María is a housewife.  She has a house of her own and lives with her family.  She’s a farmer and also raises cattle.  She is a woman of the countrysiD..  Her family supports her efforts in the different activities because her income depends on these agricultural chores.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy cattle and to repair the corral.  She will buy wood posts and wire to strengthen it so that the cattle will be more secure.

This loan will help her a lot because she will increase her herd size, they will be in safer surroundings and this will produce higher profits from work.

loans.use: to buy livestock and repair the corral.

loans.name: Shakira Del Carmen

texts.es: Shakira de 33 años es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, con el que sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitoso y esta es su gran motor para que cada día se despierte con una mayor  fuerza de trabajo y  fortalecer su bienestar en unión de su esposo. Ella tiene un negocio de miscelánea donde vende de contado y a crédito, mercancía variada como cosméticos, accesorios, prendas de vestir etc, a sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y referidos  que cada día crecen y con los cuales debe ser oportuna en su respuesta. Su sueño más adelante es tener un almacén bien posicionado, pero su gran desafío para lograrlo es su pequeño capital de trabajo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva que es su primer financiamiento con el cual comprará nuevas líneas de cosméticos perfumes, prendas de vestir femenina en mayor volumen, porque mediante este sistema de compra de contado y al por mayor estaría ahorrando y fortaleciendo su competitividad en el mercado.  Mientras Shakira trabaja para lograr sus sueños, maneja en su negocio una rentabilidad no menor del 28% y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días.
texts.en:
Shakira, 33, is a married woman; she has a two-year-old son that she dreams seeing become a successful professional.  This is the motivating force that impels her daily to wake up with stronger will to work and to strengthen his wellbeing alongside her husband.  

She has a business selling miscellany for cash and on credit.  She sells assorted merchandise like cosmetics, accessories, clothing, etc. to neighbors, friends, relatives and referred customers who every day are more numerous and who must receive prompt service.  Her dream for later on is to have a well-positioned store but the great challenge she faces is her small amount of working capital.

This is the reason behind her request for a Kiva loan which will be her first loan.  She will use it to buy new lines of cosmetics and larger amounts of women’s clothing because by paying cash and buying wholesale she saves and becomes more competitive in the marketplace.  While Shakira works toward attaining her dreams, she manages a profit margin of no less than 28% and an 18-day lag in accounts receivable.

loans.use: to buy new brands of cosmetics and women's clothes.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Las Palomas está conformado por Juana, Tomasa, Leseyda, Oscar Danilo, Adán Emilio, Blanca, Emiliana, Marcia, Maria y Sonia. Sonia es la coordinadora del banco se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 1 año que tiene este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan gran variedad de productos. Sale todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, ha sido una mujer muy luchadora a sus 23 años le ha proporcionado a su familia el alimento diario. El crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, polvos, perfumes, pintura de uñas, cremas, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en: The community bank "Las Palomas" (The Doves) is made up of Juana, Tomasa, Leseyda, Oscar Danilo, Adán Emilio, Blanca, Emiliana, Marcia, Maria and Sonia. Sonia is the coordinator of the bank. She has run a business selling cosmetics for over a year. Most of her customers request a great variety of products, so she works every day from 8am to 7pm. At 23 she is a born fighter, putting food on the table for her family on a daily basis. This loan is to purchase lipsticks, powder, perfume, nail polish, creams and treatments.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, powder, perfume, nail polish, creams and treatments

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es:
Yda es participante D. la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto” la cual la integran 13 mujeres responsables y unidas.
Yda es D. Huánuco pero radica en Lima hace mas D. 40 años es casada y tiene 4 hijos que son independientes. Yda se dedica a la producción D. tejidos D. accesorios  con  hilo y lana, su negocio surgió ya que tuvo la oportunidad D. aprender gracias a unas conocidas que le enseñaron a tejer, en la actualidad nos cuenta que dos veces a la semana  da clases D. tejido en su vivienda. Yda con su esfuerzo a podido dar educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda. El deseo D. Yda es D. terminar D. construir su casa para que pueda alquilar cuartos y habilitar un espacio donD. pueda utilizar para la producción D. sus tejidos. Con el préstamo solicitado ella piensa comprar hilo y lana en mayor cantidad ya que le sale a menos precio.  Yda junto a la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto” están muy contentos con el Programa- Prosperidad. En la fotografía podemos ver a la  señora Yda ella está con chompa con rayas verdes.
texts.en:
Yda is a member of the "Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto" community bank.  This bank is maD. up of 13 responsible and united women.

Yda is from Huánuco but has lived in Lima for more than 40 years.  She is married and has four children who live independently.  Yda's business is weaving accessories with thread and yarn.  Her business came about as she had the opportunity to learn thanks to some acquaintances who taught her how to weave.  Now she tells us that twice a week she gives weaving classes in her home.  Through her efforts, Yda has been able to proviD. her children with an education and improve her home.  Yda's wish is to finish building her home so that she can rent out rooms and fit out a space in which she can carry out her weaving.

With this loan, Yda is planning to buy thread and yarn in larger quantities as it works out cheaper that way.  Yda and her "Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto" community bank are very happy with the Prosperidad Program.  In the photo, Yda is the lady wearing the green-striped sweater.

loans.use: to buy thread and yarn

loans.name: Bockarie B.'s Group

texts.en:
These borrowers are secondary school teachers in Kenema city. The school was founded in September 2002 to improve education in the community. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of this school have recevied from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do.

Bockarie is the leader of the group. Bockarie is thirty-three. He was born in a place call Koya. Bockarie is married and has two children – one in primary school and the other is not of school age. He has been in the teaching profession for nine years now. He has requested this loan to pay his mother’s medical bills and to buy some household items.

loans.use: to pay his mother’s medical bills and buy some household items

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Brenda, es comerciante de cosméticos, es soltera, vive con su madre, su puesto de venta lo tiene instalado en el parque de la ciudad, vende todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, más que todo productos de belleza como maquillaje, labiales, cremas, prendedores de cabello, esta inversión será un gran apoyo para Brenda, quien se dedica cada día a ofrecer a los clientes buena mercadería.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, manteniendo variedad de productos de belleza, que le permitan mantener la clientela y aumentarla cada vez que sea posible, generando mayores ventas y ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Brenda is a cosmetics merchant.  She’s single living with her mother.  Her sales stand is installed in the city park and she’s open for business every day of the week.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise, above all, beauty products like make-up, lipsticks, creams and hair clips.  This investment will be of great help for Brenda who is dedicated to offer her customers good merchandise every day.

Her goal is to grown in the business having a variety of beauty products on hand that will allow her to keep her customers and increase their numbers on every possible occasion generating higher sales and profits to meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy make-up, lipstick, creams, hair clips.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de colchones, frazadas y colchas, ella es propietaria de una tienda donde vende la mercadería, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de colchas, frazadas y colchones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC communal bank. This bank is located in the Urubamba district and province and in the Cusco department.

This partner is 62 years old. The member is married and has three children.  This member alternates the daily activities with the sale of mattresses, blankets and bedspreads. The partner is the owner of a store where this merchandise is sold. The member works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The member wants to increase and improve the sales of the mattresses, blankets and bedspreads. The partner is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for the store. 

This partner is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for the store.

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Candelaria, se encuentra localizado en Jumiltepec, Mexico, esta conformado por la señora Victoria que va a comprar con su prestamo maiz y hojas para elaborar tamales, las señoras Aleja y Edna Yazmin que van a comprar frutas de temporada aguacate, granada, durazno, la señora Minerva que va a comprar lechones para engordar, la señora Luisa va a comprar harina, azucar y levadura. 
La señora Luisa tiene 55 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 2º. año de primaria, ella es casada tiene 9 hijos todos son casados e independientes, ella vende pan y solicito su prestamo para comprar harina, azucar, manteca, leña, huevo, mantequilla y levadura, ella ofrece a sus clientes pan de dulce, teleras y bolillos. 
Ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años por necesidad y por la pobreza, ya que tenia a sus hijos pequeños, su suegra le enseño a elaborar el pan, ella le ayudaba a elaborar el pan, ella comenzó haciendo poquito pan y fue creciendo poco a poco, ahora ya vende mas, con lo que ganaba su esposo trabajando en el campo compró la materia prima para iniciar el negocio, ahora su esposo y su hijo le ayudan a elaborar el pan y ella va a vender el pan en el centro de Jumiltepec donde pone su puesto.
Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades y para la comida, ella esta orgullosa de tener muchos clientes que le compran pan porque les gusta el sabor del pan que ellos elaboran con mucho gusto. Los desafios que enfrenta el negocio son el costo elevado en los insumos, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para la comida, para los pagos del prestamo y una parte para ir ahorrando. Ella esta contenta y feliz con este prestamo que va a recibir va a comprar los insumos para elaborar el pan le va a dar fuerza a su negocio, sus sueños y esperanzas son segur trabajando elaborando y vendiendo pan y que sus hijos tengan todo lo bueno en esta vida. Jumiltepec es un pueblo bonito de clima templado, hay mucha vegetacion, se da la fruta como el aguacate, durazno, peras, vainas, capulines, los habitantes celebran el 2 de Febrero a la Virgen de la Candelaria, hay comida para todos los peregrinos, suben al cerro donde esta la capilla de la Virgen de la Candelaria, hay misa, y bajan en procesion con la Virgen a la iglecia del centro, hay juegos artificiales. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "les damos las gracias y estamos contentos con sus prestamos nos van a ser utiles para salir adelante en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Candelaria” and is located in Jumiltepec, México.  Its members are Victoria, who will use the loan to buy corn and corn husks to make tamales, Aleja and Edna who will buy seasonal fruit like avocadoes, pomegranates and peaches, Minerva who will buy piglets to fatten up and Luisa who will buy flour, sugar and yeast.

Luisa is 55 years old.  She completed second grade.  She’s married and has 9 children, all married and independent.  She sells bread and is asking for the loan to buy flour, sugar, shortening, firewood, eggs, butter and yeast.  She offers her customers sweet bread, “teleras” (rolls used to make tortas) and “bolillos” (French rolls).

She started her business 30 years ago because of need and poverty.  She already had little children and her mother-in-law taught her how to make bread.  She used to help her make it and she stared little by little to make bread and gradually grew.  Now, she sells more.  With money earned by her husband working in the fields she bought raw materials to start the business.  Now her husband and son help her make the bread and she goes to downtown Jumiltepec to set up her sales stand to sell it.

Her business is important because she gets income to cover needs and for food.  She is proud because she has many customers that buy her bread because they like the flavor of the bread they make with such joy.

The challenges she faces are the high price of ingredients.  She uses profits from the business for food, to pay back the loan and part as savings.  

She is happy with the loan that she’ll get that she’ll use to buy ingredients to make bread.  It will strengthen her business.  Her dreams and hopes are to stay in business making and selling bread and that her children have everything good that life has to offer.

Jumiltepec is a pretty town with mild temperature.  There is a lot of vegetation.  Fruits like avocadoes, peaches, pears, vines, ‘capulines’ (similar to sour cherries) abound.  Residents celebrate February 2 as “Our Lady of Candlemas” day.  Food is prepared for all the pilgrims who climb the hill where the Virgin of Candlemas chapel es located.  Mass is celebrated and they descend in procession carrying the Virgin to the church downtown.  There are fireworks.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “We thank you and are very happy with the loans.  They are going to be very useful for us to succeed with our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, shortning, firewood, eggs, butter and yeast.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar le negocio de tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC” community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

The borrower is 62 years old, married, and has four children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his grocery store business.  He sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc.  He works from 5.00am to 7.00pm and, through this business, he gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to expand his grocery store business and is requesting this loan to buy products to stock his store.

The borrower is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his grocery store

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama 5 de mayo, se localiza en la comunidad de Ocuituco, Mexico, esta conformado por la señora Isabel va a comprar con su prestamo botes de durazno, la señora Maria del Carmen va a comprar arroz, queso, aceite, papel, bolsas para preparar la comida para los antojitos, la señora Eufrocina va a comprar huevo, azucar,jabon, aceite para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Yecenia va a comprar alimento para engordar cerdos, la señora Victorina va a comprar toneles,garrafas y botes. La señora Victorina tiene 22 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su esposo ellos tiene 2 hijos Milton de 6 años de edad y Tony de 1 año de edad, ella solicito su prestamo para comprar material de plastico botes, garrafas y tambos para vender, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años es herencia de sus suegros, ellos le enseñaron a trabajar en este negocio, su esposo salen a los pueblos vecinos a vender sus productos con los campesinos, su negocio es importante porque de ahi sale para la alimentacion de sus hijos y para vestirlos, ella esta orgullosa por la preferencia de los clientes que son los campesinos y de viajar y conocer otros pueblos. Ocuituco es un pueblo bonito, tranquilo de clima templado, hay mucha vegetacion, arboles frutales se da el aguacate, celebran el 25 de julio a Santiago Apostol hay misas, juegos pirotecnicos. Ella tiene la esperanza de tener su casa propia, hacer mas grande su negocio para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "les damos las gracias por su apoyo y la confianza que nos dan y que sigan ayudando a mas personas".
texts.en:
This group is called “5 de Mayo” and is located in the community of Ocuituco, México.  Its members are Isabel who will use the loan to buy cans of peaches, María del Carmen who will buy rice, cheese, oil, paper and bags to prepare fast food snacks, Eufrocina who will buy eggs, sugar, soap and oil to stock her grocery store, Yecenia who will buy feed to fatten up pigs and Victorina who will buy drums, jugs and cans.

Victorina is 22 years old and lives in common law relationship with her husband.  They have two children: Milton, 6, and Tony, 1. She asked for her loan to buy plastic items: drums, cans and jugs to sell.  She started the business 7 years ago; it was an inheritance from her in-laws.  They taught her the business.  Her husband goes out to adjacent towns to sell the items to the people in the countryside.  Her business is important because that’s where she gets what she needs to feed and clothe her children.  She is proud that her customers, who are the country folk, prefer her and she enjoys going out to get to know other towns.

Ocuituco is a pretty town.  It has a mild climate, much vegetation and fruit trees. Avocadoes are abundant.  The 25th of July is celebrated as St. James the Apostle Feast Day.  Masses are celebrated and there are fireworks displays.

She hopes to have her own house and to enlarge the business to be able to provide her children with better quality of life.  

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “We thank you for your support and for the trust you’ve place in us and keep helping other people.”

loans.use: to buy plastic cans, jugs and drums.

loans.name: Elmer Alfredo

texts.es:
Elmer, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas, aprendió a sembrar con su abuelo hace 20 años, actualmente este trabajo es el que le permite llevar la alimentación a su familia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, pues está sembrando hortalizas para lo que solicita un financiamiento que cubra los gastos del tratamiento para el cultivo.
Su aspiración es tener una buena siembra, que de buenos frutos, que sea abundante, y que le ayude para comercializar a buen precio la producción.
texts.en:
Elmer is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and their children.  He grows vegetables.  He learned how to do this from his grandfather 20 years ago.  This work is now what allows him to feed his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.  He is planting vegetables, and he is requesting a loan to cover the expenses of treatment for his crops.

His aspiration is to have a good harvest with good, abundant fruits that help him sell his production for a good price.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr:
Akua est une femme  de 25 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Akua travaille comme revendeuse de produits alimentaires (tomate, légumes, oignons, piment) depuis 2000. Elle vend à toutes personnes  à la devanture de sa maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé Akua a requis son quatrième cycle de  crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des bidon d’huile, du riz, du sucre.
texts.en: Akua is a 25-year-old woman. She is married to a soldier and has two children. She has been working as a retailer of grocery items (tomatoes, legumes, onions, chili peppers) since 2000. She sells to anyone from the front of her house. She makes her purchases in Lomé. Akua has requested her fourth loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy containers of oil, some rice, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 72 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, prepara todo tipo D. paltos típicos como cuy al horno, pollo al horno y sopas, la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere implementar el restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ollas, vajillas, sillas y comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y verduras.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Señor D. Torrechayoc Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

This member is 72 years old, married, and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  She makes all types of typical dishes like oven roasted guinea pig, roasted chicken, and soups.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She gets her children ahead through this business.

She wants to stock her restaurant.  She is requesting the loan to buy pots, dishes, and chairs.  She will buy food to cook with like rice, meat, and vegetables.

The member is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, and chairs and to buy food to cook with like rice, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en: Joyce (with her hand raised) is the leader of a six member group at Ankyernyin, Takoradi, in the Western Region of Ghana. She is married and has five children. Her husband is an electrician. She has received senior high level of education. Joyce has been selling provisions such as milo, milk and sugar  for 15 years. She uses her income to assist her partner in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Joyce will use the loan to purchase stock (provisions) for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase stock (provisions) for resale.

loans.name: Dinora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dinora, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo trabajan la agricultura, sembrando hortalizas desde hace 8 años, siembran pipián, ejotes, chiles y tomates.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pesticidas, esta inversión le ayudara para dar los cuidos necesarios con la intención de recibir una buena cosecha y abundante producción.
Su aspiración es cosechar buenos frutos y poder comercializar para tener buenos ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora lives with her husband and their three children; ages 18, 15, and 12.  She and her husband are farmers, and they have been growing vegetables for eight years.  They grow squash, beans, chili peppers, and tomatoes.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and pesticides.  This investment will help her to provide the necessary care in order to have a good harvest and an abundant production.

Her aspiration is to have a good harvest in order to be able to sell and have good income for her family

loans.use: to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como profesor del nivel primario, el trabaja en la provincia de Urubamba desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio desea salir adelante, el socio quiere ahorrar para que estudie y así mejorar profesionalmente. El  socio solicita el préstamo para pagar la mensualidad de su estudio.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He belongs to the communal bank "Senor de Torrechayoc". It is located in the district of Urubamba which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 

He is 34 years old and he is single. He alternates his daily activities with his employment as a primary school teacher. He works in the province of Urubamba and he works from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m.. He wants to move forward through this work. He wants to save money to go to school and to advance professionally.  He requests a loan to make his monthly tuition payment. 

He is happy for this loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to make his monthly tuition payment.

loans.name: Anonymous
