loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughters.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benita; la socia tiene 47 años; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya son independientes y el menor de sus hijos tiene 11 años de edad;  La socia se  dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, también la socia cría animales menores, tales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos, ovejas, vacas, gallinas. La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y ganados a la par que se dedica  a la administración,  siembra, cosecha y venta de maíz; así también a la cventa de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para aumentarlos pocos que le quedan y comprar ovejitas también.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI” community bank which is located in Yungaqui district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Benita is 47 years old, married, and has five children.  Three of her children live independently and her youngest is 11 years old.  Benita mainly works in agriculture.  She has farmland sown with corn and also raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, cows and hens.  She raises small animals and livestock at the same time as she sows, harvests and sells corn.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying small animals to increase the small number that she has remaining.  She will also buy some lambs.

Benita is very happy with and grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying small animals and some lambs

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos (uno independiente).  Sabina no tiene grado D. instrucción.
DesD. hace nueve años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, medias  y ropa interior.
Con su nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cien docenas D. medias D. todo tamaño y otras prendas D. vestir.  Nos cuenta que sus productos los compran en Desaguadero, Bolivia y lo venD. en el mercado D. Yunguyo.  Su esposo trabaja en la chacra y eventualmente tiene trabajos como albañil.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el compañerismo.
texts.en:
Sabina es a member of the “Niño Jesús D. Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 53 years old, married and has three children (one independent).  Sabina never went to school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 9 years.  Her previous loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her business.  She sells clothing, stockings and underwear.

She will use the new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy 100 dozen stockings in all sizes and some other articles of clothing.  She tells us that she buys her products in Desaguadero, Bolivia and sells them in the Yunguyo market.  Her husband is a farmer and sometimes gets bricklaying jobs.

Her dream is to improve the business to thus improve her income.  What she likes about the communal bank is the companionship and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 100 dozen stockings in assorted sizes and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 70 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación y venta de helados, ella tiene una tienda donde vende helados, barquillos y también distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que existe en la provincia de Urubamba, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los helados y los barquillos como frutas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She is 70 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business making ice-cream to sell.  She has a store where she sells frozen treats and ice-cream cones.  She also distributes to various stores in Urubamba province.  She supports her children through this business.  She wants to expand and improve the ice-cream business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make the frozen treats and ice-cream, like fruit.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream making supplies.

loans.name: Duclida

texts.es:
Duclida es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos aún estudiando.  Cuenta con educación superior.
Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, plastiqueria y venta de gas.  Su primer crédito fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles,  la señora invertirá en la compra de ocho balones de gas y comprará más productos para su tienda de plastiquería.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien es profesor.
Su sueño es tener su depósito de gas que le permita la venta al por mayor, de esa manera tendría más ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la organización.
texts.en:
Ducilda is a member of the “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) communal bank located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 44 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.  She completed higher education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last two years.  She sells groceries, plastic ware and gas.  Her first loan was for 500 new soles that she invested in her store.

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 8 gas tanks and she will also buy more plastic ware for the store.  Her children and her husband, who is a teacher, help her with the business.

Her dream is to have her own gas depot so that she can sell it at wholesale thus having more profits.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan and the organization.

loans.use: to buy 8 gas tanks and plastic items.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Centro Group

texts.es: El nombre D. este grupo es "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS CENTRO", debido a que son mujeres que buscan nuevas alternativas D. crecimiento. El grupo esta conformado por 7 integrantes, estan ubicadas en el estado D. Puebla, en México. La señora es Maria es la tesorera del grupo, ella tiene 37 años D. edad, estudio una carrera tecnica y es soltera. Se dedica a la venta D. ropa; es conocida por sus compañeras por ser una persona responsable, emprendedora y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria D. esta comunidad ha progresado constantemente, el prestamo lo requiere para comprar ropa D. temporada para su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y tener un respaldo para cualquier emergencia. Tambien quiere apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Emprendedoras Centro” (Downtown Enterprising Women) because they are women seeking alternative ways to grow.  The group has 7 members and is located in the Mexican state of Puebla.

María is group Treasurer.  She’s 37 years old and studied a technical career; she’s single.  She sells clothes and is known by her fellow members as being a responsible, enterprising person who has overcome adversity.  She is from this community and has been constantly making progress.  She needs the loan to buy seasonal clothing for her business and increase income.  Profits she earns she wants to save to continue investing in her business and have something to fall back on in an emergency.  She also wants to help her family with expenses.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Tlaltepango Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "Las Estrellas de Tlaltepango", este nombre fue adoptado porque asi se llama el el barrio donde se reunen, ellas se consideran unas estrellas. El grupo se ubica en Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora JAZMIN es la Tesorera del grupo, ella tiene 19 años de edad y estudio unicamente la primaria. Vende Pollo de engorda. La señora es reconocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha ido progresando desde hace 3 años, el prestamo lo requiere para invertir mas en su negocio de venta de pollos. Con el prestamo va a comprar alimentos y productos de limpieza para la crianza y engorda de sus aves. Con las ganancias continuará invirtiendo en su negocio ya que sus aves necesitan dedicarle mucho tiempo para posteriormente venderlos, tambien quiere seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos economicos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group’s name is “Las Estrellas de Tlaltepango” (Stars of Tlaltepango).  The name was chosen because that’s the name of the neighborhood they meet in and they consider themselves stars.  The group is located in Puebla, México and it has 10 members.  This is their first loan request.
Jazmín is group Treasurer.  She is 19 years old and only went to elementary school.  She sells chickens she raised.  She is known by her fellow members for being a responsible person who has managed to get ahead.  She’s from this community and has been making progress for the last three years.  She wants the loan to invest in her chicken raising business.

She will use the loan to buy feed and cleaning supplies to use in the care and feeding of her fowl.  With profits she will continue investing in her business because the fowl require time for subsequent sale.  She also wants to continue helping her family with expenses and offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Venancio

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 28 y 22 años de edad, tiene casa propia, él se dedica a la siembra de sandia y hortalizas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años y lo aprendió por su patrón, para quien prestó muchos años de servicio.
Por el momento Carlos ha iniciado sus labores sobre el cultivo de sandia y hortalizas como pipián, chile y tomate, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de abono y pesticidas, con este financiamiento podrá tener lo necesario para mejorar la cosecha y los ingresos por la comercialización de la misma.
Su objetivo es mejorar las cosechas para poder venderla, pues su familia depende de él y sus hijos le colaboran para ser parte del éxito de la siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and their two children, 28 and 22 years old. He has his own house, and he works growing watermelon and vegetables. He has been doing this for 10 years, and he learned it from his boss, for whom he worked for many years.

For the moment Carlos has begun his work growing watermelon and vegetables like pipián squash, chiles and tomatoes. To do this he needs a loan to cover the cost of manure and pesticides. With this loan he will be able to have what he needs to improve his harvest and the income from selling it.

His goal is to improve his harvests so he can sell them, since his family depends on him and his children work together with him to be part of the success of the farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing pipian squash, chiles and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 57 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, galletas entre otros productos, la socia también tiene un negocio de dar almuerzo para los profesores, ella prepara diferentes platos y da como una pensión en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de dar almuerzos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, arroz, carne y verduras y también para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas y aceite.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Señor de Torrechayoc" communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She is 57 years old and is single. She has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells sugar, rice, milk, oil and cookies, among other products. This member also has a business making lunch for the teachers. She prepares several dishes and has something like a boarding house in Urubamba District. She wants to expand and improve the grocery store and lunch businesses.

This member is asking for the loan to buy products to cook like chicken, rice, meat and vegetables and also to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, cookies and oil.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking like chicken, rice, meat and vegetables as well as buying merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, cookies and oil.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR D. CCOYLLORITY D. YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Yungaqui, Provincia D. Anta, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maxima; la socia tiene 63 años; la socia es viuda;  La socia se  dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene su terreno D. cultivo D. maíz y verduras;la socia también se dedica a la crianza D.  animales menores, como gallinas, vacas, cuyes. La socia se desea el crédito para comprar abones, pagar el tractor D. la nueva siembra, y comprar animales menores como gallinas para la crianza y la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en al compra D. animales menores especialmente gallinas al por mayor y el pago que traerá el alquiler del tractor, la compra D. abono para el cultivo nuevo.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Taytacha Señor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui" Communal Bank. The bank is in Yungayi District, Anta Province, Cusco Department.

This member is Maxima. She is 63 years old. She is a widow. She works mainly in agriculture, and she has a field for growing corn and vegetables. She also raises small animals like chickens, cows and guinea pigs. Maximilia wants the loan to buy manure, pay the tractor for the latest planting, and buy small animals like chickens to raise and sell. She is asking for the loan to buy small animals, especially chickens, wholesale and to pay the rental fee for the tractor and buy manure for the new crop.

She is very satisfied and grateful for the support offered to her through this medium, and she promises to pay her debts on schedule.

loans.use: to buy small animals, especially chickens, wholesale and to pay the rental fee for the tractor and buy manure for the new crop.

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en: In the picture above Beatrice is in red trousers and a sleeveles top. She is the leader of this group called Nyame Wo Yenho do (literally means God loves us). She sells rice at Talkoradi. Beatrice has been through junior high school. She is single and has two children. Her business is just 2 years old and so she wants to increase her sales volume. A loan will help buy bags of rice in bulk to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop and to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan Bautista; el socio tiene 42 años; el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos,  de 17, 14 y 2 años de edad, La socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal actividad; también a la crianza de cuyes, el socio tiene una granja y tiene en especial animales como  cuyes al por mayor mas de 100, el socio desea a futuro poder tener un camal en el cual todo el poblado ya a comprar cuyes de calidad y también hay los prepararan para la venta. El socio solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de cuyes que por el momento el lleva a vender a las diferentes ferias de la región. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en al compra de cuyes al por mayor todo lo que le alcance comprar y mas el alimento para sus cuyes en la granja.
 
El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui" Communal Bank. The bank is in Yungayi District, Anta Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Juan Bautista; he is 42 years old, has a live-in partner and has three children who are 17, 14 and 2 years old. He works in agriculture as his primary activity; he also raises guinea pigs. Juan has a farm and has especially animals like guinea pigs for wholesale (more than 100). For the future, he wants to be able to have a slaughterhouse where all the townspeople will come to buy high-quality guinea pigs, and they will also prepare the guinea pigs for sale there.

He is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs since at the moment he is bringing them to sell at several markets in the region. He is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs wholesale, as many as he can buy, plus feed for his guinea pigs on the farm.

Juan is very satisfied and grateful for the support offered to him through this medium, and he promises to pay his debts on schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs wholesale, as many as he can buy, plus feed for his guinea pigs on the farm.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos en estudios. Faustina cuenta con  educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne vacuna y porcina.  Trabaja  con Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 10 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta carne.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de quince corderos bien gorditos, cuenta que los compra vivo y luego lo carnea poco a poco la vende al menudeo en un mercado de la zona en Yunguyo.
Su sueño es poner un emporio y así incrementar considerablemente sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las bromas de las socias y la solidaridad entre ellas.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the "Niño Jesús de Praga" (Infant Jesus of Prague) Communal Bank, located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department. She is 38 years old, married and has four children who go to school. Faustina has a secondary level education.

Together with her husband she sells beef and pork. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela R. for ten years, and her first loan was for 300 new soles, which increased her capital for her beef sales business.

With this new loan of 3000 new soles, Faustina will invest in fifteen nice fat sheep. She says that she buys them live and butchers them later. Little by little she sells them retail in a local market in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to set up a large store and thus considerably increase her earnings. What Faustina likes about the Communal Bank are the members' jokes and the solidarity among them.

loans.use: to buy fifteen sheep

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa, vive con sus dos hijos, en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos y cultiva pipián, la venta de mariscos la inicio hace 7 años aproximadamente, y también la siembra de pipianes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos (pescado, camarón, langosta), también compra de abono y fertilizantes para tratar la nueva siembra de pipián, este préstamo le ayudara a tener suficientes productos para ofrecer a los clientes, también insumos para realizar la siembra de pipián.
Su objetivo como comerciante es mantener lo necesario para ofrecer a los clientes, con el fin de mantener la clientela y mejorar las ventas, ya que esto le permite ofrecer a su familia una vida digna.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives with her two children in her own house. She sells seafood and grows pipián squash. She began selling seafood and planting squash approximately seven years ago.

Tomasa is currently asking for a loan to buy seafood (fish, shrimp, lobster) and also to buy organic and chemical fertilizers for treating the latest crop of pipián. This loan will help her to have enough products to offer her customers, as well as supplies for sowing pipián.

Her objective as a businesswoman is to have what is necessary to offer her customers, with the goal of maintaining her customer base and improving her sales, since that will allow her to offer her family a life of dignity.

loans.use: to buy seafood (fish, shrimp,lobster).

loans.name: Elia Nancy Eulalia

texts.es:
Elia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos aún estudiando.  Cuenta con educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, desde hace dos años trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer  préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles comprará mercaderías como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.  En el negocio  le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y obtener más ganancia para sostener a su familia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el bajo interés.
texts.en:
Elia is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" (Miraculous Medal) Communal Bank, located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 49 years old, is a single mother and has two children who are still in school. She has received higher education.

This lady works selling groceries. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years, and her first loan was for 300 new soles, which increased her business capital.

With this new loan of 500 new soles, she will buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. Her children help her with the business. Her dream is to continue working and earn more income to support her family.

What Elia likes about the Communal Bank are the easy loan terms and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en un luagar muy bonita, en donde las personas se dedican todo tipo de negocios con lo que se pueda a oyar cons sus ingresos,  ella es casada con el señor Wilfrido y con quien procreo cuatro  hijos quienes aun están a su responsabilidad.

     Ella es ama de casa y solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos naturales, en donde lleva un año practicando esta actividad, para que con ello tenga sus propios ingresos y pueda solventar sus gastos que se generan en su hogar.

    Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad  fue su familia aun que pequeña quiere darle lo más necesario y así juntos con su esposo los saquen adelante y estén muy orgullosos de cada uno de ellos.

      Su más grande deseo es tener su propio negocio para que con ello pueda seguir apoyando su familia con su educación que es  lo más importante para ellos que logren tener una profesión.
texts.en:
Juana lives in a very beautiful place where people work in all kinds of businesses. She is married to Wilfrido, with whom she had four children who still live with her. 

She is a housewife and asked for the loan to invest in buying natural products. She has been doing this work for a year so that with it she can have her own income and can cover the expenses generated in her home.

What motivated her to start this work was her family. Although they are small, she wants to meet their needs, and so together with her husband they help them move forward, and they are very proud of each one of them.

Juana's greatest dream is to have her own business so that she can continue supporting her family with their education, which is the most important thing for them so that they can have a profession.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en: Dorothy is married and has two children. She sells fish and rice at Talkoradi. Dorothy uses her income to assist her spouse in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will add the loan she hopes to receive to her initial capital to buy raw rice and fresh fish in a large quantity, to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth. In the picture above, Dorothy has her hand raised.

loans.use: to buy raw rice and fresh fish in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
En la comunidad de Papel Pata distrito de Echarate (La Convención, Cusco, Perú) conocimos a la señora Francisca y nos cuenta que ella nació en la ciudad de Echarate y que tiene 48 años de edad, ella tiene una unión no matrimonial y de esta relación tiene dos hijas. Actualmente, Francisca  vive en la comunidad de Papel Pata a unos 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. 

Francisca  se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café y cacao, ella lleva sus productos todos los días  a la ciudad de Quillabamba y vende a las personas que se encargan de negociar café y cacao. Desde joven aprendió el oficio pues sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de la agricultura. Ya son 7 años que se dedica al negocio  y le va muy bien. Francisca  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para pagar sus gastos de la universidad de sus dos hijas.

El banco comunal “Caminando Juntos” pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la comunidad de Papel Pata del distrito de Echarate provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
In the Papel Pata community in Echarate District (La Convención, Cusco, Peru) we met Francisca, and she told us that she was born in the city of Echarate and that she is 48 years old. She has a non-marital relationship, and she has two daughters from this relationship. Currently Francisca lives in the community of Papel Pata, which is about 45 minutes away from the city of Quillabamba and where she carries out her economic activity. 

Francisca works in agriculture, specifically farming coffee and cacao beans. Everyday she brings her products to the city of Quillabamba and sells them to people who deal in coffee and cacao. When she was young she learned the trade because her parents taught her agricultural work. She has been working in this business for seven years now, and it is going very well for her. At the moment Francisca needs the loan for personal use, in other words to pay university expenses for her two daughters.

The "Caminando Juntos" (Walking Together) communal bank belongs to Asociación Arariwa, and the members' meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Papel Pata, Echarate District, La Convención Province, Cusco Department.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her two daughters.

loans.name: Elsa Emiliana

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.   Elsa cuenta con educación superior.
La señora trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años,  su primer préstamo fue por S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio. Ella se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes.  Paralelamente realiza confecciones  de delantales.
La señora requerirá de un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles,  préstamo que utilizará para comprar cinco rollos de telas de diferentes colores para la confección de más delantales.  En el negocio le ayuda su mamá.  Su esposo es policiía.
Su sueño es tener una micro empresa bien constituida y así poder atender pedidos al por mayor.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la solidaridad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" (Miraculous Medal) Communal Bank, located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-age children. Elsa has received higher education.

This lady has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years, and her first loan was for 300 new soles, which increased her business capital. She sells groceries. She also makes aprons.

Elsa will need a new loan for 1500 new soles, which she will use to buy five rolls of fabric in different colors to make more aprons. Her mother helps her with the business. Her husband is a police officer.

Her dream is to have a well-established small business so she can take wholesale orders. What Elsa likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings and the solidarity of the members.

loans.use: to buy five rolls of fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Doña Hazel comerciante de ropa usada y alquiler de cuarto, tiene tres años de haber establecido su negocio, el cual inicio con su liquidacion, ya que por muchos años, laboro como conserje.
Hoy en dia su objetivo es mejorar su vivienda en donde ha venido mejorando la infraestructura atraves de la ganancias. Con este financiamiento  hara cambio de techo al poner perlines ya que es de madera y cambiar laminas de zinc ya que algunas estan en mal estado, dando mejor refuerzo al techo y seguridad a su familia. esta contenta ya que con el credito anterior logro el aumento de la inversion y ahora la mejora de su casa que solo atravez de Afodenic se le hizo posible.
texts.en:
Ms. Hazel is a trader of used clothing and rents out a room.  She has had an established business for three years, which started with its liquidation and for many years she worked as a janitor.

Currently her goal is to improve her housing where through her profits she has come to improve the infrastructure.  With this financing she will change the roof and put purlines and replace the wood with zinc sheets since many are in poor condition, giving better reinforcement to the roof and security to her family.

She is happy because with the previous loan she achieved increased investment and now she is improving her house all because of Afodenic was made it possible for her.

loans.use: To buy purlines, zinc metal sheets, screws, and welding to change the roof.

loans.name: Esperanza Aurora

texts.es:
Esperanza  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, dos de ellos aúnestudiando y los otros 3 ya son independientes.  Esperanza cuenta con educación primaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos desde  hace ocho años,  su primer préstamo fue  de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de confitería  y panadería.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de diez sacos de harina, dos cajas de manteca, azúcar, sal y leña, todo ello para la producción de pan.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien también es albañil.  Nos cuenta que vende sus productos en las ferias de la localidad.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Community Bank “Medalla Milagrosa”, located in the Pomata district, and Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 53 years old and married with 5 children, two of them are still studying and the other three are independent. Esperanza has a primary education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years.  Her first loan was 300 soles, money that increased business capital from the sale of products in her bakery and cake shop. 

With the new loan of 1300 soles, she will invest in buying ten sacks of flour, two boxes of butter, sugar, salt and firewood, all for the production of bread.
In the business her children help her and her husband who also is a builder.  She tells us that she sells her products in the street market.  

Her dream is to have a good house and for her children to become professionals.  What she likes most about the Community Bank is the ease of the loan and the timeliness.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of flour, two boxes of butter, sugar, salt and firewood

loans.name: Nyame Wo Yenho Do(Ankyernyin) Group

texts.en:
Belinda sells secondhand clothes at Takoradi. Belinda has attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has two children.  Her husband is a court clerk. Belinda has been selling secondhand clothes for five years. She supports her spouse by providing the basic needs of her home. Her loan will be used to buy stock (secondhand clothes) in large quantity for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a shop. 

In the photograph above is a seven-member solidarity group of which Belinda is the leader. She has her hand raised and is the first person counting from the left.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes in large quantity for resale.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rufino; el socio tiene 59 años; el socio es casado y tiene 4 hijos,  de los cuales todos son independientes, El socio se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, el socio es curandero y ejerce esta labor desde hace 40 años atrás y el mismo prepara  abase de hierbas naturales y otras raíces los medicamentos naturales para diferentes tipos de malestares, el socio es muy conocido en toda la región y es por esa razón que el desea el crédito para invertir al por mayor en la compra de cebos de animales y hierbas al por mayor porque desea el crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes para elaborar las pomadas y medicinas naturales para la venta ya que tiene un pedido grande y especial para el mes de agosto, el socio también reparte a domicilio sus pomadas cuando la gente que ya lo conoce le hace el pedido. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de hierbas y cebos de animales para la elaboración de la misma.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Community Bank “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”.  This bank belongs to the Yungaqui district, Anta province, and department of Cusco.

This member is Mr. Rufino.  He is 59 years old and married with 4 children, all of whom are independent.  He sells natural medicine.  He is a healer and has done this work for 40 years.  He prepares natural herbs and other natural roots for different types of ailments. 

He is very known in the area and it is for this reason that he wants a loan to invest in wholesale herbs and cebos (animal bait/feed).  He wants the loan to be able to buy all of the ingredients to make ointments and natural medicines to sell as he has a large order and special in the month of August.  He also delivers ointments to homes when people he knows place orders.

He is requesting a loan to invest in buying herbs and cebos (bait/feed) to make the medicines.

He is very satisfied and grateful for the support that is provided through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of his debts on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying herbs and cebos (animal feed/bait) to make medicines.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace cinco años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo solicitado fue por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas.  Paralelamente se dedica  a la venta de pan.
Hermelinda solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar ocho sacos de harina, leña y transporte para el traslado de los insumos.  Nos cuenta que realiza sus ventas en la localidad de Desaguadero, Ilave y Juli.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja  en el Municipio.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y así dar comodidades a su familia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es ahorrar y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Community Bank “Medalla Milagrosa”, located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province and the department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and has 5 school-age children.  She studied through secondary school. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years, her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in her business selling food. She also sells bread.   

Hermelinda is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles, money that she will use to buy 8 sacks of flour, firewood and transportation for the transfer of goods.  She tells us that she makes her sales in the town of Desaguadero, Llave and Juli.  In the business her children help her and her husband, who works in the Municipality.

Her dream is to have her own house and thus give comfort to her family.  What she likes about the Community Bank is earning and saving money.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of flour, firewood and transportation for the transfer of goods.

loans.name: Libertadoras 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LIBERTADORAS 1" porque para el grupo el llamarse asi lo relacionan con la igualdad de generos y obtener sus propios ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. Esta ubicado en en el Estado de Mexico. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Florentina tiene 24 años, estudio hasta la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 3 hijos (una mujer y dos varones). Ella tiene una tortilleria desde hace aproximadamente 2 años, por lo cual piensa invertir en materia prima (maiz) y en algunas refacciones para su maquina de tortillas. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al prestamo piensa hacer crecer su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia. Debido a la gran demanda que tiene en su tortilleria quiere más adelante ampliar su local y mejorar su servicio.
texts.en:
This group is called Libertadoras 1 because the name reflects the equality of mankind. It also shows that the women are free to obtain income of their own so they can provide a better standard of living for their families. The 9-member group is located in Mexico state.

24-year old Sra. Florentina has primary-level education and is a businesswoman. She has a daughter and two sons. She has run a tortilla-making business for about two years, and she would now like to obtain more capital to buy basic ingredients such as corn and some spare parts for her tortilla machine.

Florentina is excited about the loan because it means she can expand her business and start to earn more money so she and her family can have a better quality of life. Because of the high demand for her tortillas, in the future she wants to enlarge her stall and improve service.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients such as corn and some spare parts for her tortilla machine.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida lives in a very pretty place, where everyone from the oldest to the youngest speak the "tzotzil" language. She is married to Pedro and the couple have five children who are all now married.

This is the first time that Zenaida has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She hopes to invest her money in buying clothes to sell in her town.  She has been working for two years and tells us that her business is doing well and has made her good income.

It was Zenaida's family who motivated her to start her business as it would enable her to improve her income and support her household.  Although she has the support of her children and her husband, Zenaida would also like to work.

What Zenaida would like is to use this loan to grow her business, buying better-quality clothes, and for her customers to become interested in the merchandise that she sells so that she can improve her profits.

Translated from Spanish:

       La señora Zenaida  vive en una localidad  muy bonita, en donde las personas hablan la lengua tzotzil, desde el más grande y los  pequeños también lo practican, ella es casada, con el señor Pedro y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes ya todos están casados.
    
      Ella es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en  fundación realidad y espera invertirlo en compra de ropa para luego venderlo en la misma localidad en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello lleva practicando dos años y comenta que le va bien pues con esto ha tenido unos buenos ingresos.

     Quien lo motivo ha este trabajo fue su familia ya que con ello sería mejor sus ingresos y se poyaría  con lo que le haga falta en su hogar  aun que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo también quiere trabajar.

     Lo que desea es que con el préstamo pueda agrandar su negocio comprando ropas de mejor calidad y su clientes se interesen en su mercancía que ella vende, para que mejor se  sus  ganancias.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina is married to Jesús and the couple have three children who are still under their care. They live in a very beautiful place where there is a lot of vegetation and many people work making traditional crafts. 

Catarina looks after her home and she requested this loan to invest in buying school supplies.  She has been in this business for six years and says that it is doing well.  Her business is growing every day.  One of her sisters supplies her with merchandise and things are going well.

It was Catarina's sister, who worked in a stationery store, who inspired her to start her business.  As there is a high school nearby, she told her that she should set up a stationery store as it would be a good business that would make her profits.

What Catarina would like is for this business to make her better income so that she can get her family ahead in life.  The most important thing for her is to provide her family with what they most need.

Translated from Spanish:
      La señora Catarina es casada  con el señor  Jesús y con quien procreo tres hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad, en donde ella vive es un lugar muy bonito donde hay mucha vegetación y las personas se dedican a  la artesanía.

Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares ya que se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares desde hace seis años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello esta aumentando día con día, ya que una de sus hermanas es la que le surte con la mercancía.

La que la inspiro fue su hermana quien trabajaba en una papelería y es quien le dijo que sería buena idea abrir una papeleria ya que cerca de la casa de la señora Catarina hay una escuela secundaria y así tendría buenas ganancias.

Lo que desea con esta actividad es que pueda  tener un mejor ingreso y con ello salga a delante con su familia que es lo más importante para ella darle lo más necesario.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stock her stationery store.

loans.name: Marilu Eneida

texts.en:
Marilú Eneida is single and lives in a very beautiful place where the people are very caring and work making traditional crafts. She is very proud to belong to this community.  

This is the first time that Marilú has requested a loan and she will invest it in buying medicines.  She has been in this business for barely four months but she tells us that things are going very well as she is achieving good results and making profits.

It was Marilú's dad who encouraged her to start out in this line of work (he is in the same business).  As she sees that he achieves good results from his business, she decided to accept so that she could make her own money to support herself.  Even though she lives with her mom and dad, she would like to contribute some money.

What Marilú would like is to use this loan to increase her business so that she can continue working.  She would also like to save up so that she can continue her studies.  What she would most like is to finish a degree.

Translated from Spanish:

Marilú Eneida es soltera y vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde  la gente es muy cariñosa y se dedican a la artesanía y se siente muy orgullosa al pertenecer a esa localidad.

Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y será para invertirlo en la compra de productos medicinales, en donde lleva apenas cuatro meses y comenta que le va bien ya que está viendo un buen resultado  que le está dejando ganancias.

A Marilú su papá la animo a dedicarse a la venta de productos medicinales ya que él se dedica a lo mismo y como veía que a su papá le daba buenos resultados, decidió aceptar y así tener su propio dinero para sostenerse, aunque ella vive con sus papas quiere aportar con algo de dinero a los gastos del hogar.

Lo que desea es que con el préstamo pueda aumentar su actividad para y así seguir trabajando, ahorrar para continuar estudiando ya que lo que más quiere es terminar su carrera.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas se llama el comité formado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, las cuales se unieron con el objetivo principal del crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Lo destacable de ellas es la forma unida en la que trabajan, todo esto en consecución a los fines propuestos.
La Sra. Cipriana se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido generar un poco de ingresos que le ayuda a solventar todos los gastos de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y de todos quienes dependen de ella. Sueña con un día poder abrir una mercería donde vender sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de cosméticos, que le servirá para abastecerse. Da las gracias a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is the name of the committee made up of 15 women from the city of San Lorenzo. Their main aim is to grow both socially and economically. The women are well known in their community for being very hardworking and having a fighting spirit. What stands out most about them is the way their work together as a team to reach the goals they have set for themselves. 

Thanks to her business selling cosmetics, Cipriana has been able to generate some income which has helped her to take care of her home expenses. Cipriana describes herself as a hardworking and enterprising woman. She tells us that everything she does is for the good of her family and everyone who depends on her. She dreams of one day opening a market where she could sell her products.

Cipriana is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics to stock up her current supply. She gives thanks to the Foundation for the opportunity that they have provided her with.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is married to Manuela and the couple have four children. He lives in a very beautiful place where the people speak two languages, which makes it an interesting place for people who visit the town.

Jorge has been buying and selling natural products for five years.  He requested this loan to buy more merchandise to put his business in a good position.  He also sells records in neighboring communities and says that the business is doing well.  He is achieving good results from his two business activities.

It was a friend who sells natural medicines who motivated Jorge to start out in this business.  He encouraged him to sell with him as this would make his delivery easier and he would support him in making his sales.  Jorge then decided to buy his own products to sell and he is now achieving better results.

What Jorge would most like is, through this loan and the effort he puts into his work, to be able to expand his business.  People buy from him because of the quality of the goods he offers.  He would like to be able to save so that he can rent premises in which he could display his products.

Translated from Spanish:
   Don Jorge es casado con la señora Manuela y con quien procreo cuatro hijos, el vive en una localidad muy bonita en donde la gente habla dos idiomas, que es la que llama la atención a las personas  que visitan al pueblo. 

El se dedica  desde hace cinco años  a la compra y venta de productos naturales y solcito el préstamo para comprar mas mercancía  para que su negocio este en buen estado, aun así también el vende discos en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad y comenta que le va bien ya que con estas dos actividades a tenido un buen resultado.

Lo que lo motivo a este tipo de trabajo fue un amigo quien vende productos medicinales  y quien lo animo a vender con él, ya que le facilitaría la entrega y lo apoyaría a vender, después Jorge decidió comprar para él y después venderlo por su parte y así inicio su propio negocio.

Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y esfuerzo de trabajo pueda tener más grande su negocio ya que las personas le compran por la calidad que el venden, aun así desea que con ellos pueda a horrar para rentar un local en el cual pueda exhibir su producto.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro oriundo de la torre de Chuquisaca, no es casado pero convive con la señora Rossilda tienen un hijo pequeño, su actividad es de albañil constructor, esta prestando su servicio en la zona del torno y el transportarse para el es dificultoso por tal motivo solicita el, crédito para poder comprarse una moto y a si tener su propio medio de transporte, es una persona muy responsable, y con ganas de superación,  el sr. Pedro esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una moto y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Pedro is a native of La Torre, Chuquisaca.  He is not married but lives in a common law relationship with Señora Rossilda.  They have one small child.  He works as a mason and offers his services in the surrounding area.  Getting around is difficult for him so he is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike so that he can have his own transportation.  He is a very responsible person, who is eager to excel.  Señor Pedro is grateful to our organization for having confidence in him and giving him support so that he can buy a motorbike and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Futuro Group

texts.es:
Doña Marisol vive en la comunidad de San Pablo Tlalchichilpa, su comunidad en territorio es grande, pero en poblacion no lo es tanto, es una comunidad donde la gente ya es mas preparada en comparacion de otros lugares, por ejemplo la mayoria de los jovenes estan estudiando se preparan y asisten a la escuela, tambien es un lugar que conserva mucho sus costumbres desde un simple saludo hasta fiestas del mismo pueblo, aqui doña Marisol ha vivido toda su vida en la actualidad se dedica hacer  manualidades, fabrica servilletas, bordados y sweteres para venderlos, ya tiene largos años de experiencia haciendo manualidades pero en si lleva 2 años que  esta vendiendo sus servilletas, ella solicito un credito para poder comprar material en este caso desea comprar hilo, busca una marca especifica de buena calidad para poder tener una costura mas fina y de mejor calidad, los desafios que enfrenta la señora son varios dentro los primeros menciona que es tener que dejar sus costuras en pagos a sus clientes y depues  anda cobrando con riesgos de que no le paguen, tambien menciona que hay marcas de hilo que no encuentra facilmente y esto le ocasiona tener que salir del pueblo y buscar en la ciudad lo que no encuentra, porque si borda con hilos comunes el bordado y el tejido queda un poco grueso y eso se ve feo.El credito le va ayudar a la señora Marisol para poder comprar el maeterial en volumen, de esta forma es como decir que es mas barato por docena, le va ayudar en tener mas ingresos que es lo que esta buscando y cumplir una de sus metas que es tener un local para vender sus manualidades y mostrar a la gente lo que sabe hacer y fabricar. Doña Marisol tiene 28 años y lleva 9 años de casada, tiene 3 hijos pequeños 1 es un bebe y 2 hijos mas se encuentran estudiando, su esposo es empleado en una farmacia y viven en casa propia, El grupo de doña Marisol lo conforman 7 mujures de igual forma saben hacer servilletas y bordados, las 7 mujures se hacen llamar "Mujeres con Futuro" tienen 3 ciclos trabajando con la institución pero el nombre significa que en su negocio van a mejorar es la razón de llamarse de esta manera, las demas mujeres dentro de este grupo son las siguientes
1.- Margarita que vende guajolotes, crian y vende estos animales

2.-Veronica vende zapatos por catalogos
3.-Gilberta hace manteles para mesas o decoraciones
4.-Karina, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y su prestamo lo va invertir en mercancia
5.-Natalia vende cosmeticos por catalogo y de igaula manera el credito lo piensa invertir
6.-Maridalia vende ropa nueva, este es el grupo de Mujeres con Futuro, las 7 integrante son de la comunidad de San Pablo Tlachichilpa, son vecinas y se conocen desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the San Pablo Tlalchichilpa community.  Her community has a lot of land, but not so many inhabitants.  The people in this community are more prepared in comparison to other places.  For example, the majority of the children are studying, preparing, and going to school.  Also, it is a place that preserves many of their customs from a simple greeting to festivities in the same town.

Marisol has lived here her whole life.  She currently devotes herself to making handicrafts, making napkins, embroideries, and sweaters that she sells.  She has many years of experience making handicrafts.  She has been selling her napkins for two years.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy material.  In this case she wishes to buy thread.  She is looking for a specific good quality brand in order to be able to make her needlework finer and of a better quality.  She faces various challenges.  

She says that one of the primary ones is having to leave her needlework with her customers on a payment plan.  Later, when she collects, she runs the risk that she will not be paid.  She also mentions that there are brands of thread that are not easy to find.  This makes her have to leave her town and look in the city for what she cannot find.  If she embroiders with everyday thread her work is a bit thick, and that looks ugly.

The loan will help Marisol to be able to buy material in volume.  This way is, as they say, cheaper by the dozen.  It will help her have more income, which is what she is seeking.  It will also help her fulfill one of her goals, which is to have a place to sell her handicrafts.  Then she will show the people what she knows how to do and what she makes.

Marisol is 28 years old, and she has been married for nine years.  She has three young children.  One is a baby, and the two others are in school.  Her husband works for a pharmacy, and they live in their own house.

Marisol’s group is comprised of seven women.  Like her, they know how to make napkins and embroideries.  The seven women are called “Mujeres con Futuro” (Women with a Future).  They have been working with the institution for three cycles.  Their name means that they are going to improve in their businesses.  That is why they named the group this way.  

The rest of the women in this group are as follows:

2.-Veronica:  Sells shoes by catalog
3.-Gilberta:  Makes tableclothes for tables or decorations.
4.-Karina:  Has a grocery store and will use the loan to buy merchandise 
5.-Natalia:  Sells cosmetics by catalog and plans to invest the same way
6.-Maridalia:  Sells new clothes

This is the Mujeres con Futuro group.  The seven members are from the San Pablo Tlachichilpa community.  They are neighbors, and they have known each other for several years.

loans.use: to buy brand name thread for needlework.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: El señor Primitivo es agricultor,  casado con la señora Eloida la cual se dedica a labores del hogar, Tienen  5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. Primitivo nació en Potosí, hoy vive en Limones a 25 km del Torno se vino a Santa Cruz a buscar mejores condiciones de vida, donde trabaja juntamente con su familia siembran maíz, arroz, yuca y también se dedica a sacar madera para las carpinterías,  Es con la única entidad financiera que el trabaja ya que es la que le da apoyo financiero, el destino del crédito es para preparar el terreno y sembrar arroz, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Primitivo is a farmer.  He is married to Señora Eloida who devotes herself to the household chores.  They have 5 school age children.  Señor Primitivo was born in Potosí.  Today, he lives in Limones, 25 km from El Torno.  He came to Santa Cruz looking for better living conditions.  He works with his family growing corn, rice, and yucca as well logging for carpenters.  This is the only financial institution that he works with since they give him financial support.  He will use the loan to prepare the land and to plant rice.  He is a hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have granted him.

loans.use: prepare the land and plant rice.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
Rosalinda es parte del grupo llamado “Las Divinas”, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo debido a una novela que salía en la televisión y por que ella se consideran unas mujeres muy divinas y sobre todo muy trabajadoras.  Ella tiene 24 años ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, esta casada con el señor Saúl el cual es jornalero, ellos aun no tienen hijos. Rosy como de cariño le dicen en su comunidad se dedica a la venta de cremas y medicamentos naturistas para su venta tiene con esta actividad aproximadamente 5 años y surte sus productos en la población de Huetamo Michoacán por que le dan un buen precio y los vende en su localidad y poblaciones aledañas a su localidad. Comenta que emprendió este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que el gana muy poco. El deseo que tiene Rosy es salir adelante tener una casa propia ya que vive con sus suegros y quiere poner una tienda naturista en su localidad.
Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Maria Guadalupe, Dora Elia y Victoria ellas usaran sus créditos para invertirlos en sus negocios como en bordados de prendas artesanales, venta de cosméticos, zapatos, ropa por catalogo y en un molino de maíz.
texts.en: Rosalind is part of the group named “Las Divinas” (The Divine Women).  She says that they chose this name because of a telenovela on television and because they consider themselves to be very divine and hard-working women.  She is 24-years-old and is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  She is married to Saúl who is a laborer.  They still do not have children.  Rosy, as she is lovingly called in her community, works selling natural creams and medicines.  She has worked selling them for approximately five years and produces her products in the commuity of Huetamo, Michoacán because they give her a good price.  She sells them in her community and neighboring towns.  She comented that she began this business to help her husband with the household expenses as he earns very little.  Her hope is to get ahead and have her own house as she lives with her mother and father-in-law.  She would like to open a natural store in her area.  The other members of the group are Maria Guadalupe, Dora Elia, and Victoria.  They use their loans to invest in their businesses, such as embroidery of artisanal clothing, cosmetic sales, shoes sales, selling clothing by catalog, and in a corn grinding mill.

loans.use: to sell natural creams and medicines.

loans.name: Tututepec Las Gardenias Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama   Tututepec las gardenias  sus integrantes  decidieron ponerles a si por que  es la calle por donde viven ya que  todas las integrantes de este grupo son vecinas y familiares.
La  representante del grupo se llama   Francisca Graciela , estudio hasta la primaria terminada ,y tiene en total  cuatro hijas  .Ella se dedica a  vender  ropa por catalogo  y necesita  el préstamo para comparar mas ropa ya que  aparte de vender ropa también quiere vender calzado.
Sus  clientes  también quiere que ponga su local por que   a veces , tiene que salir a recoger su mercancía y van sus clientes y no está  solamente su nieta pero  ella no puede tomar los pedidos , también quiere  poner su local para que su mercancía este exhibida y a sus clientes le den ganas de llevarse algo mas.
La señora  Francisca  desea el préstamo para aumentar su negocio ,para sacarle mas ganancias para poder  comprar mas mercancía y  mostrarle ropa  diferente  a sus clientes.
 Otra integrante es la señora   Bertha    también esta en el  grupo tututec las  gardenias .
Ella estudio hasta  la primaria  terminada  tiene un total de dos hijos ,una mujer y un varón 
 Se dedica ala  venta de perfumes y calzado por catalogo  y necesita el préstamo  para  comparar mas  perfumes   ya que   es lo  mas  vende.
Sus clientes le recomienda que ponga su local para que las persona que vayan a visitar     al pueblo  puedan ver sus productos y  le compren.
La señora  desea  de  este préstamo poner un local para  que sus perfumes y sus  zapatos  se vendan mejor y poner una tienda de regalos que es lo que mas se compra en Tututepec.
Las otras  ocho integrantes se llaman:
Alejandra – se  dedica ala venta de quesos.
Sandra _ se dedica  al venta de tamales.
Reyna- se dedica ala venta de artículos de papelería.
Soledad- se dedica ala venta de  quesos.
Zuli- se dedica  ala venta de  totopos.
Maria –venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Cristiano- se dedica ala venta de  abarrotes.
Carmina- a la venta de totopos.

Gracias a  fundación   realidad  por el apoyo que les ha dado  para salir adelante con sus  negocios.
texts.en:
This group of neighbours and friends is called Tututepec Las Gardenias. They named themselves after the street where they live. One representative of the group is named Francisca Graciela. She completed primary school and has four children. Graciela sells clothing from a catalogue and requires a loan to buy more. Besides selling clothing, she also wants to sell shoes. 

Graciela's customers want her to open a storefront. When she is out picking up orders and visiting customers, she leaves things in the hands of her granddaughter, who can't place orders. She also wants  a storefront so that she can create displays of her merchandise and encourage her customers to buy a bit more. Graciela wants a loan so that she can improve her business, earn more money, buy more merchandise, and present a better variety of clothing to her customers. 

Another member of Tututepec Las Gardenias is Bertha. She completed primary school and has two children: a girl and a boy. She sells perfume and shoes via catalogue, and needs a loan so that she can buy more perfume; it's the most popular thing she sells. Her customers have suggested she set up a storefront so that they can visit her, see her products, and buy them without placing orders. 

Bertha wants a loan so that she can put up a storefront. It will help her perfumes and shoes sell better. She would also like to set up a gift shop in the busiest shopping district in Tututepec.

Tututepec Las Gardenias includes several other members. Alejandra and Soledad each sell cheese. Sandra sells tamales. Reyna sells stationery. Zuli and Carmina each sell corn chips. Maria sells Mexican snacks and treats, and Cristiano sells groceries.

Many thanks to the Fundacion Realidad for the support, which will help this group make their businesses successful.

loans.use: buy and sell perfumes.

loans.name: Mirian Encarnacion

texts.es: La Sra. Mirian se dedica  a la elaboración D. repostería, realiza panes, galletas queques y tortas, quien debe despertar a muy tempranas horas para poder realizar la elaboración D. su masa para pan y empanadas, tiene una experiencia D. 12 años aproximadamente, necesita el dinero para poder comprar un horno ya que el que tiene se encuentra muy usado, es una persona que tiene ya muchos clientes, entregas sus productos a las distintas zonas y también tiene un puesto donD. pone a la ventas sus riquísimas empanadas, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirian works in a pastry shop where she makes bread, cookies, muffins, and cakes. She wakes up in the early morning hours so that she can make the dough used for bread and empanadas. Mirian has approximately 12 years of experience.

She needs money so that she can buy an oven since the one she currently has is heavily used. Mirian already has many customers. She delivers her products to different areas and also has a vending post where she sells her delicious empanadas. Mirian is a hardworking person and appreciates the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Del Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las Sras del comité Las Tejedoras de Ñanduti, son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día luchan por procurar el sustento de sus familias.
La Sra. Blanca vive con su marido e hijos, en su casa propia, ella se dedica a tejer Ñanduti. Por medio de este oficio y también con la ayuda de su marido ella logra mantener a su familia e hijos. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que no solo es una profesión sino que también logra fomentar la cultura del país enseñando a sus hijos como tejer. El sueño de ella, y el motivo de su sacrificio con sus hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas y demás artículos necesarios para hacer el Ñanduti.
texts.en:
The women of the "Las Tejedoras de Ñanduti" committee (The Ñanduti Weavers) come from the city of Caacupé. They are very hardworking and determined, fighing day by day to provide sustenance for their families.

Blanca lives with her husband and children in their own home and works weaving Ñanduti, a traditional Paraguayan embroidered lace. Through this work and with the support of her husband, Blanca has been able to keep her family and her children together. She is very proud of what she does as it is not only a profession but a way of keeping her country's culture alive by teaching her children to weave. It is her dream and and her sacrifice to her children.

Blanca is requesting a loan to purchase thread, needles, cloth and other necessary items to weave the Ñanduti.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, needles and other items.

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es:
El señor Fredy es un pequeño comerciante, su negocio es la venta de verdura, ubicado en el mercado, anteriormente puso una pulperia, que no lleno las espectativas, el cual decide seguir vendiendo verduras.Ha tenido dificultadescon sus ventas, el cual ha logrado equelibrar y seguir adelante, para el bienestar de su familia.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien ayuda en el mercado, es padre de un hijo, y cuenta con su propia casa, poco tiempo de vivir, el cual esta contento. 
Hoy en dia su negocio esta estable gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos. con este nuevo prestamo comprara verduras y frutas como: sandia, naranja, melon, granadilla, aguacate, ayote, yuca, sanahoria, chayote, pepino, repollo, remolacha entre una variedad mas de rica de verduras fresca y accesible de precio.
texts.en:
Sr. Fredy is a small merchant who has a business selling vegetables at the market. He previously owned a grocery store, but that business did not meet his expectations. Fredy decided to sell vegetables. He had difficulty making sales, but he was able to stabilize his business and move forward for the sake of his family.

Fredy manages his business at the market with the help of his wife. They have one child and own a home in which they have lived for just a short amount of time, which makes him happy.

Today Fredy’s business is stable because of the loans from AFODENIC. He has participated in two loan cycles. This new loan will be used to buy vegetables and fruits such as watermelons, oranges, melons, passion fruit, avocados, squash, cassava, carrots, chayote, cucumbers, cabbages, beets, and a variety of other fresh produce at an affordable price.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: La Sra., Ivonne esta  casada tiene un hijo, su esposo es chofer de camión de carga, realiza viajes a diferentes departamentos de Bolivia, lleva días en carretera por lo que la Sra. Ivonne la mayoría del tiempo esta solo con su hijo , la Sra. Tiene su tienda en lugar muy céntrico para sus ventas, atiende de lunes a domingo  tiene una tienda bastante surtida donde ofrece variedad de productos para regalos de fiestas, el préstamo lo invertirán para la compra de variedad de productos para su posterior comercialización y a si de esta forma incrementar su  capital de y trabajo, la Sra. es una persona trabajadora agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Ivonne is married and has a son. Her husband drives a cargo truck and travels to different parts of Bolivia. While he spends days on the road, Sra. Ivonne spends most of her time alone with her son. Ivonne has a store in a centralized area where she generates her sales. She manages it from Monday to Sunday and keeps it stocked with a variety of products used for party gifts.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of various products for eventual resale. This will help increase her operating capital. Sra. Ivonne is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of gift items.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna lives in the village of Mukhrani in the eastern part of the country of Georgia. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children. 

Several years ago, Khatuna was employed as an accountant, but she lost her job due to Georgia's difficult economy. 

To earn a living, she started to trade textiles for clothing and home needs. She buys textiles in bulk at wholesale markets and then sells them in nearby villages. Khatuna travels to the wholesale markets on average once a month and stores the materials she buys in her home. Her most popular item in area villages are blankets. 

Khatuna requests a loan to purchase additional textile materials at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and textiles for resale

loans.name: And  Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité And Deggo est créé le 1er juillet 2011, il est composé de douze femmes qui travaillent ensemble depuis 5 ans, elles sont parentes et vivent dans le même village, l'activité dominante est le petit commerce.


Madame Ndéye Adama est âgée de 40 ans, mariée elle est mère de quatre enfants, elle s'active dans le commerce et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 5 ans. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en blanc.


Elle achète ses denrées alimentaires, fruits, légumes, chaussures, tissus, parfum dans les villes et marché hebdomadaire et revend dans son village.



Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son commerce pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne et promouvoir le bien être familial.
texts.en:
The And Deggo solidarity group was formed on July 1st, 2011.  It’s made up of 12 women who have worked together for five years.  They are related and live in the same village.  Their main business is small-scale sales.

Ndéye Adama is 40 years old, married and a mother of four.  She is active in her sales business, taking advantage of over five years’ experience.  She is pictured standing at right in the photo, wearing white.

She purchases food, fruit, vegetables, shoes, cloth and perfume in cities and in the weekly market, to re-sell them in her village.

Her loan will help her to grow her business so as to bring in a large income.

She wants to increase her savings and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables and various products for retail sale

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona del plan 3000 en la casa de su hermana, tiene un hijo de 1 año, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería. Ella tienen una venta de abarrote en su propio domicilio. El crédito que están solicitando es para comprar fideos, harina, verduras, carne, frutas, hortalizas, sodas, bebidas  para surtir más su venta ya que por donde viven hay un mercado nuevo y quieren tener más mercadería para la venta para tener una mejor atención a sus clientes. La Sra. Silvia es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposo tienen el deseo de superación para brindarle un futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives at her sister’s house in the Plan 3000 District. She has a one-year-old son and her husband is a locksmith. Silvia has a grocery store in her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy noodles, flour, greens, meat, fruit, vegetables, sodas, and beverages to increase her inventory. A new market opened where she lives, so she wants to have more merchandise to sell so that she can attract more customers. Sra. Silvia and her husband are hardworking people. They desire to succeed so that they can provide a future for their son.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker est créé le 1er juillet 2011 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois,  il est composé de quatorze femmes qui adorent leurs époux d'où le nom donné à leur groupe, et s'activent dans le petit commerce de denrées alimentaires....,et l'embouche ovine.


La responsable Bity est âgée de 36 ans; mariée elle est mère de deux enfants, elle mène une activité de petit commerce et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine,elle a une bonne expérience dans ces domaines. Elle est debout tout à  fait à droite sur la photo adossée au mur et habillée en blanc avec motifs orange et rose.


Elle s'approvisionne en huile d'arachide et autres produits divers dans les marchés hebdomadaires et vend dans son village.

Elle compte avec son prêt renforcer son activité en achetant une bonne quantité de marchandises.


Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite subvenir à ses besoins personnels et participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sop Sa Jëker solidarity group was formed on July 1st, 2011, the day that the Banc Villageois opened.  It is made up of 14 women who love their husbands, hence the name they chose for their group.  They are active in small-scale food sales, as well as sheep fattening.

The group leader, Bity, is 36 years old, married and a mother of two.  She runs a small-scale retail business and also works fattening sheep; she has considerable experience in both of these fields.  She is standing against the wall at the far right of the photo, wearing white with orange and pink print.

She buys her peanut oil and other various supplies in the weekly markets, and sells them in her village.

With this loan, she plans on growing her business by purchasing large quantities of stock.

She wants to use her profits both to meet her own needs and to help cover her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase peanut oil for resale

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Xalaat est créé le 1er juillet 2011, il est constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même village et s'activent dans le commerce.


Khady la responsable est âgée de 44 ans, mariée elle est mère de huit enfants, elle mène une activité de vente de divers produits, fait de l'embouche ovine et cultive pendant l'hivernage, elle a une bonne expérience; elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en bleu-rose avec un châle noir sur l'épaule.


Elle s'approvisionne en huile d'arachide, moutons,parfum .... dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans son village.


Son premier prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité, afin de gagner plus de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
